loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina de 56 años de edad,  es madre de familia de 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya tienen  su hogar  establecido y  uno que aun está soltero, es bachiller al igual que los otros cuatro y de ellos aprendió el oficio de pintor  de carros; el esposo se dedica a trabajar de seguridad en una gasolinera y en la agricultura, antes trabajaba de corralero.

Por el momento, Aquilina realiza los oficios domésticos en su hogar, pero antes se dedicaba a la elaboración de tortillas para vender durante 18 años, para poderles brindar el estudio a sus hijos porque era lo que ella más deseaba,  madres como Aquilina son un ejemplo a seguir para poder prosperar económicamente.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar concentrado, zacate, para alimentar el ganado ya que han comprado 3 vacas. Para  asegurar la alimentación familiar con la producción de leche y el resto del crédito lo utilizara para desgranar el maíz, ya que cosecho bastante  y la necesidad de todo ser humano de tener la alimentación adecuada.

A  futuro planea construir la cocina dentro de la casa, ya que la tiene afuera y espera construirla muy pronto y para sus hijos esperan que trabajen muy fuerte para que lo tengan lo necesario en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Aquilina, 56, is the mother of 5 children.  Four of her children have established their own households.  Her other child, although he is single, is a high school graduate like the others, and he learned from them his trade as an automobile painter.  Aquilina's husband works providing security for a gas station, and he also works in agriculture.  Previously, he used to work with livestock. 

At this time, Aquilina is devoting herself to the housework, but before she used to make tortillas to sell.  She did this for 18 years so that she could provide her children with an education, because that was what she desired the most.  Mothers like Aquilina are an example to follow for families that want to prosper financially.

Aquilina is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and hay to feed the cattle, because she has purchased 3 cows in order to assure that she has milk for her family. She will use the rest of the loan to thresh the corn, because she had quite a substantial harvest, and because every human being needs to have sufficient food.

In the future, she plans to build a kitchen inside her house, because now her kitchen is outside.  She wants to do this very soon.  She also hopes that her children will work very hard so that they can have everything they need for their households.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and hay for her cattle, and to thresh the corn that she has harvested

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 28, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava to make a living. To supplement the family income, she also works for others for a fee. She has been doing these businesses for nine years, earning about 40,200 KHR per day to feed her family.

Nat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is seeking a new loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Srey is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. She has grown cassava and rice for almost 10 years. To earn more income, she also works for others for a fee. From her current businesses, she is able to earn about KHR 33,000 per day. Srey has been with VisionFund for five times and successfully repaid all her loans. The past loans have helped her to improve her standard of living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a repeat client with the institution. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children. She lives in a rural area in Kashenyi – Rukungiri District where she carries out her business in mobile local markets. She sells second hand clothing and has an agriculture business where she gets money to cater to her family's needs. Her clientele are low-income earners who come from faraway areas to these market places to buy low price commodities.

With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), she hopes to expand her business in terms of stock in order to cater to a variety of people. She has hopes of managing a boutique where she will earn more income and become a great woman in her village area.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Мавчуда, не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 31 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но ее зарплата не достаточна для этого. Мавчуда работает в государственном учреждении. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты включая кухню и коридор. Мавчуда запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house where Mavjuda lives does not comply with the living standards, and she has to urgently repair it.  She is 31 years old, married and raising 3 children.  The children are adolescent.  They attend a secondary school and always ask their parents to repair the house, but their income is not enough to do that.  Mavjuda works at a government office.  She has to repair all of the rooms, including the kitchen and hallway.  Mavjuda is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., to repair her house.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Dilafriz

texts.ru:
Эту милую леди зовут Дилафруз. Ей 32 года. Дилафруз в разводе имеет двоих сыновей. Развод не сломал ее и она нашла в себе силы продвигаться вперед ради своих детей. Дилафруз с детьми живет с сестрой. Она арендовала помещение на центральном рынке района. Она занимается арендой свадебных платьев. Дилафрузе нравиться то чем она занимается, потому что данная деятельность приносит доход и потому что ей нравиться помогать девушка в выборе платьев. Дилафруз жизнерадостная и отзывчивая женщина, она старается, чтобы каждая девушка нашла свое платье. 
  На данный момент у Дилафруз финансовые затруднения и она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы привести больше платьев. Без кредита ей не удастся сделать задуманное. Дилафруз надеется, что ей помогут и ее деятельность значительно расшириться.
texts.en: The name of this sweet lady is Dilafriz.  She is 32 years old.  Dilafriz is divorced and has two sons.  The divorce did not break her, and she found strengths in herself to move forward for her children.  Dilafriz and her children live with her sister.  She leased a space at the central market of the district.  She is involved in leasing wedding dresses.  Dilafriz likes what she does because this business brings in an income and because she likes to help young women choose dresses.  Dilafriz is a happy and responsive woman; she tries to make sure that every young woman finds her dress.  At the present time, Dilafriz is having financial difficulties and requested this loan to bring in more dresses.  She would not be able to accomplish her goal without the loan.  Dilafriz hopes that she will be helped and that her business significantly expands.

loans.use: to buy dresses for lease

loans.name: Petronela

texts.en: Petronela is a 30-year-old-woman who is married to Daud, a 29-year-old-man.  They are blessed with two children, Lita, 4, and Daud.  Petronela has a beauty salon business. The income from this business enables her to support her husband in meeting their family's needs. She offers such services as:   hair cutting, hair curling and make-up. At the moment she wants to buy a hair dryer, vitamins and a curling iron. To do so, she requested a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 4,500,000.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer, hair vitamins and a curling iron.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 36 year old food kiosk and green grocer in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married man whose spouse provides additional income and together they support three children. He has been in this business for the last four years and has done great.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables, dry food stock of dry maize, beans and green bananas.

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. He hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, dry food stock of dry maize, beans and green bananas.

loans.name: Besian

texts.en:
Besian is 52 years old, married to Mike and blessed with eight children who she supports. She is a mixed farmer in Narok County, Kenya. She has been in this business for the last five years. Her monthly income is KES 25,000. 

This is her fifth loan of KES 90,000 from VisionFund Kenya. It will permit her to buy farm inputs for better crop yields and also pay for land preparation. The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. 

Her future dreams are to have a stable business and educate her children

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Barnabas, a 45-year-old man. They are blessed with 5 children: Dina, 19, in college; Merry, 17, in grade 2 of senior high school; Abner, 15, and Yoan, 13, both of whom are junior high school students; and the last one, Dea, 6, who is not attending school.

Rosalin is a housewife who used to have a bemo (to provide public transportation), but it has been broken since last year.  She has run the business of public transportation since 2006.  Her husband is a civil servant.  Since the bemo has been broken, he has had no time to fix it. 

This month her daughter needs registration fees for her college, but Rosalin does not have enough money to pay the registration fees. Therefore, she applied for an individual loan in the amount of IDR 3,000,000, to pay her daughter's registration fees for college.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's registration fees for college.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Ry is 54 years old and widowed. She has two children. To make a living and take care of her children, she has been growing cassava, rice and cashew nuts. She has been in the business for 34 years. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day.

Ry has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and has completely repaid the loans. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living conditions. With a good business, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ry is going to use her portion to pay labor fees to harvest cashew nuts. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her business and make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay labor fees to harvest cashews

loans.name: Bulaale Butawuka Balimi Group

texts.en: Eriasa is 52 years old, a member of Bulale Butawuka group and the only man in the group. He basically deals in agricultural produce. He also has a motocycle which gives him extra income. His business began 20 years ago to earn him a living. His customers are the regular people in his village. He will use the loan to buy another motocycle. He hopes to improve his income levels and also his standard of living. He faces several challenges, including competition and price fluctuations. He is hardworking and competitive. He thanks the women for being hardworking and standing by his side.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
Voern, 36, is living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. She has six children. Voern has been growing cassava for 16 years. The current business earns her about KHR 100,000 per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the fifth loan for Voern with VisionFund Cambodia. Voern is now leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Voern is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in harvesting cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in harvesting cassava.

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Она Курбонгул. Ей 56 лет. Курбонгул вырастила шестерых детей. Ее муж находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Курбонгул около 10 лет ведет животноводческую деятельность. Ухаживать, поить и кормить скотов помогает ей сын. У нее 3 сына и 3 дочки. Самой Курбонгул нравится ее работа, она любит животных. Она намерена дальше заниматься этой деятельностью. На сегодняшний день у Курбонгул возникли финансовые затруднения, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Курборгул намерена купить несколько голов скота на деньги от кредита и таким способом расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: She is Qurbongul.  She is 56 years old.  Qurbongul raised six children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Qurbongul has been running an animal husbandry business for about 10 years.  Her son helps her to care for and feed the livestock.  She has 3 sons and 3 daughters.  Qurbongul likes her work; she loves animals.  She intends to continue running this business.  Today, Qurbongul ran into financial difficulties and decided to request this loan.  Qurbongul intends to buy several heads of livestock with the money from the loan and expand her business this way.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock in order to increase livestock headcount and expand her business

loans.name: 03.02.17 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thu operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thu is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thu is the group leader of the 03.02.17 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Her children are grown up so Thu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: У нее трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Она -Мунаввар из Таджикистана. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более  15 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами она хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого она должна получить больше урожая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони, чтобы купить семена и скота. Доход, который она будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: She has a hard life and a low income, but a kind heart and good character.  She is Munavvar from Tajikistan.  She is 46 years old, married and raising 4 children.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, wheat, carrots, etc., for over 15 years.  She sells the resulting harvest at a market.  She has an additional income from animal husbandry.  Her husband helps her to run this business.  To provide the family with all of the necessities, she wants to develop her business and needs to get a larger harvest for this.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy seeds and livestock.  The income that she will get from the business will be used to educating her children and improving living conditions.  She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cattle

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, a 71-year-old married father of two from Mwingi, has a business as a mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Priscillar who also helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya after repaying his previous loans successfully. With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase watermelon seedlings and fertilizers. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Benjamin would like to retire from farming since he is now old. 

He hopes to construct a permanent residential house and have a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Amm

texts.en:
Amm, 52, lives in one of the remote areas of the Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province. She is widowed and she has one daughter. To support her family, Amm has been working in the rubber fields. She can earn about US $9 per day to support her family. 

Amm has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce some taxi fee expenses so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her daughter to commute to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Samey is a citizen from a rural area located in the Memot district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Samey is aged 60 years and married. She has struggled to feed her nine children by farming rice and growing cassava and rubber. Having been in the business for 10 years, the current business earns her approximately US$24 per day.
 
Samey has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. Samey is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Aged 37 years old, Yoen is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Cassava and rubber planting are the main source of the family’s income. Yoen has been in this business for several years. Her husband supplements the income from this business by working as a paid worker.
 
Yoen has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is requesting a loan. Yoen will use her loan to buy cassava and pay for labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava and rubber healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cassava and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Sa'bagul

texts.ru: Саъбагул жительница района Хамадони. Ей 56 лет. Она мама шестерых детей. У нее трое дочек и три сына. Муж работает строителем и делает ремонты домов и помещений. Саъбагул 10 лет дома держит скотов. Она любит животных. Ей нравиться проводить время с животными. В Хамадони многие жители занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Не только в Хамадони, но и во многих районах, деревнях и селах основной деятельностью является растениеводство и животноводство. Саъбагул использует скотов для семейных нужд. Саъбагул старается, увеличить поголовья скотов и такими намерениями обратилась за кредитом. Она просит ей помочь купить одну корову.
texts.en: Sa'bagul is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is 56 years old.  She is a mother of six children.  She has three daughters and three sons.  Her husband works as a construction worker and makes repairs for houses and other spaces.  Sa'bagul has been keeping livestock at home for 10 years.  She loves animals.  She likes to spend time with animals.  Many residents in Hamadoni are involved in agricultural business.  Agriculture and animal husbandry are the primary businesses not only in Hamadoni, but in many other districts.  Sa'bagul uses the livestock for family needs.  Sa'bagul tries to increase the livestock headcount and requested a loan for this purpose.  She is asking for help to buy another cow.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо молодая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дилрабо всегда мечтала организовать свой бизнес. Она участвовала в конкурсе «Лучший бизнес план» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и показала себя как целеустремленную женщину. Она хочет организовать бизнес предоставлением услуги прокат посуды для проведения мероприятий и свадебных торжеств. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 долларов США для покупки посуды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilrabo is a young and conscientious woman.  She is married and raising 2 children.  Dilrabo has always dreamed about starting her own business.  She participated in a competition "The Best Business Plan," organized by the Association of Business Women, and showed herself as a driven woman.  She wants to organize a business of providing dishware leasing service for holding events and wedding celebrations.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 US dollars to buy dishware.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dishware in order to start her own business

loans.name: Inn's Group

texts.en:
Inn, 54, is married with five dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. The main sources of her family’s income are from growing cucumber, chili paper and eggplant. To supplement the income of her family, she also sells fried banana. She has been engaging in this business for 34 years, earning about KHR 35,000 per day. She is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day.
Inn has been with VisionFund for one cycle while her group member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Inn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 51, is married with four children and lives in the rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. For the last 31 years, she has been growing cassava as the primary source of her family’s income. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Khoern has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, Khoern is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a single mother with two children. She is 30-years-old and lives in the rural area of Ruhinda – Rukungiri District. She deals in second-hand clothes and agriculture.  This is where she gets money to cater to her family. She hopes to use the loan to increase her second-hand clothes stock for her business and meet her customers' needs.

She hopes to increase her business enough to turn into a boutique and improve on her businesses as well as her family with her two children. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the assistance in terms of finances.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes for sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria previously accessed a PHP 35,000 loan that she used to buy different snacks and biscuits needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Candelaria would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 25,000, to buy different snacks and biscuits needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Candelaria hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She attends the weekly fellowship* meetings where she is inspired to share her weekly life experiences with her co-fellowship members and she learns more about the importance of having quality time with God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different snacks and biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Roeb

texts.en:
Roeb is 57-years-old and married with five dependent children. He lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district and earns a living through farming rice. Together, they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current business. 

Roeb has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now he is applying for a loan. Roeb is going to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kimthim's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Chhoeng Prey district, Kimthim is 27-years-old.  She is married with two children, they are still young for school. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs. 

Kimthim is a second cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Kimthim is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 10 hijos, algunos ya son mayores de edad y se dedican al trabajo en el campo, otros aún son menores y se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

José es comerciante, desde hace 20 años compra y vende animales como cerdos y vacas, actividad que aprendió por su padre, pues siempre lo acompañaba cuando su papá hacia viajes a los cantones. 
Él sale todos los días en el carro, a comprar y vender a los cantones más cercanos, pues su objetivo es obtener ganancias con esta actividad.

Él necesita de este préstamo, para ampliar su negocio, porque desea comprar ganado para vender.

José sueña con tener una casa más amplia ya que donde vive ahora es muy pequeño y su familia es bastante numerosa, también desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y seguir luchando día a día por trabajar y  mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is fifty years old, and unfortunately, he did not have the opportunity to attend school. He is married, and his wife takes care of their home. They have ten children, some of whom are already grown and working in the country, and others who are still minors, studying in school.

José is a businessperson who has been buying and selling animals such as pigs and cows for twenty years; an occupation that he learned from his father, as he always accompanied him on his trips to the cantons. Every day he travels in his car to the nearby cantons, with the goal of earning money through this work. He needs this loan in order to expand his business, because he would like to purchase more cattle to sell.

José dreams of having a bigger house, as the one where he lives is very small and his family is fairly numerous; and he also wants his children to complete their studies. 

He wants to continue  striving every day to work and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Tatiana Eva

texts.es: La señora Tatiana tiene 25 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería, ella tiene una tienda en la zona de Pampahasi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Tatiana,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de perfumes y joyas al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Tatiana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tatiana, 25, is married with two children aged 4 and 5 years. She sells jewelry in her store in the zone of Pampahasi. This loan is her first with the institution. Tatiana will use this loan to buy perfumes and jewelry wholesale for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise stock. Tatiana faces challenges in her business such as competition. She will use the profits to continue to buy goods and, thus, generate more income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being given to grow her business, improve her income, and her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with jewelry and perfume.

loans.name: Halimakhon

texts.en:
Halimakhon, age 59, bakes and sells biscuits, rolls, and other such goods to earn a living. She sells her baked goods at the local market. She began her business 20 years ago. Thanks to the deliciousness of her biscuits, she has many regular customers. Halimakhon and her husband raised their children, now grown, in a spirit of nationalism.

Halimakhon's goal is to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of of 7,500 Somoni. She will use her loan funds to buy flour and sugar.

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar in order to bake biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products such as creams, powders, and perfumes.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne  38 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  HAMDALLAYE  l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et alimentaires.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  5ème  prêt solidaire.            FOUNE,  1 ère femme  debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100Kg de riz et 75Kg de mil et 500Kgs de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à San et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group are on average 38 years old with 2 children each. They all live in traditional extended families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of San/Segou (the fourt administrative region of Mali.) These women came to know each other through relatives and are in the business of purchase and resale of various food producst.

After having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sabaly group are on their 5th group loan .Foune, the first woman pictured standing on the right in the photo ,plans to use her loan to purchase 100kg of rice, 75kg of millet, and 500kg of corn. She stocks up in San and the surrounding villages. Foune makes her sales to a customer base made up of men and women for cash and also often for credit. 

Foune hopes to earn an verage monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA which she will use to pay daily expenses for health, food, clothing, housing, and education, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 40-year-old, married mother of three children, in Thika, runs a butchery business. She is married to Joseph and their children are aged 17, 10, and 7 years, respectively. She has been in her business for the last four years. She also sells fresh milk to supplement her income. 

Agnes currently lacks funds needed to purchase enough meat to serve her ever-growing customer base. With a loan through VisionFund Kenya, Agnes will be able to purchase more cows for slaughter, to sell in her butchery. She is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business. 

In the future, Agnes would like to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for slaughter, to sell in her butchery.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Dina dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulina Antonia

texts.es: La señora Paulina tiene 33 años tiene dos hijos  que son de las edades de  9 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la actividad de alquiler de maquinaria pesada que se encuentran en la zona de Villa Fátima, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Paulina  va a usar este préstamo para compra de combustible para continuar trabajos que tiene la cliente por su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la señora Paulina necesita  comprar diesel para el funcionamiento de su maquinaria ya que tiene un contrato con el gobierno autónomo de una localidad  en la construcción de una carretera y aun no le desembolsaron el adelanto del trabajo,  la señora Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la cliente tiene que viajar constantemente a la población lo que implica un riesgo ya que la carretera esta en mal estado y es el riesgo que corre por las lluvias es un peligro, su deseo para  su negocio es el de poder ser más consolidada con la empresa de maquinaria pesada que posee.
texts.en: Paulina is 33 years old and has two children, aged 9 and 7. She dedicates herself to the work of renting heavy machinery. Her business is located in the area of Villa Fátima. This is her first loan sequence with the institution. Paulina will use this loan to buy fuel to continue projects which clients have requested from her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is that Paulina needs to buy diesel fuel to operate her machinery, since she has a contract with the autonomous government of an town for the construction of a highway, and the work has not been paid for in advance. Paulina confronts challenges in her business; for instance, she has to travel constantly to the town, which is risky because the road is in poor condition, and it is dangerous especially when it rains. Her desire for her business is to be able to lay a stronger foundation for the heavy machinery business she operates.

loans.use: to buy fuel to carry out projects for clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase, cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is 28 years old with four children. Karen is a very soft-spoken person. She loves to play with her children. She is a family-oriented person. She loves what she does and for that she is requesting a loan amounting PHP 5,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her hog-raising business. She hopes someday that she can give her family all that it needs.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita, 48 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She's been into the hog-raising business for almost three years and is earning a net income of PHP 2,000 for every hog that she sells. Her net profits usually are spent on school allowances for her children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will improve and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meachey province, Sorn is 58 years old and widowed. She and her husband had four children. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 38 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 70,000 KHR per day to support her family
. 
This is the 10th loan for Sorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sorn is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beverages wholesale.

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.en: Rahmatjon was born in 1950. He lives with his wife and son in a rural area. Rahmatjon has great experience in the agriculture business. He has been busy growing potatoes and wheat for more than 25 years. Rahmatjon has a good opportunity to develop his business because he lives in an agricultural region. Rahmatjon works hard but his income from growing potatoes and wheat is not enough to improve his living conditions. He is going to buy cattle and feed it. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy cattle to sell. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Belegjargal

texts.en: Ms. Belegjargal is a Bachelor's Degree student who studies in a private university as an English language tutor. She is really interested in this profession and her short-term goal is getting a job and supporting her family. This loan is to pay her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for his moto-taxi

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La, who is 48, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and he is married with nine children. The family's main source of income is from farming rice. He has been in this business for fourteen years. His current business earns him about 16,000 KHR per day to support his family. 

La has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the loans, which have helped him relieve his family's burden and improve their livelihood. He is now leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to pay for land in order to grow rice. He hopes to grow his rice in a timely way so he can sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to pay for land in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Pabla es una joven con 22 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos. Trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Vive en una comunidad rural llamada cataratas. Su actividad es criar pollos, asi genera ingresos al hogar sin descuidar a su familia y además, le ayuda a su esposo en las necesidades del hogar, debido a que su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y no cuenta con un ingreso fijo mensual. Es primera vez que solicita un financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, asi superarse tanto como persona como en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia. Pabla y María Lorena forman parte de éste grupo de señoras con ideas productivas.
texts.en:
Pabla, 22, is married and has 2 children.  She is hardworking and has a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives in a rural community called Cataratas.  She has a business raising chickens.  This is how she generates income for the household without neglecting her children.  In addition she helps her husband with the needs of the household, because although he works in agriculture, he does not have a fixed monthly income.  

This is the first time that Pabla has requested a loan to strengthen her business so that she can excel as a person and in her business and improve her family's living conditions.  Pabla and Maria Lorena form part of this group of women with productive ideas.

loans.use: to invest in her business raising chickens

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene, esta divorciado y tiene dos hijos, vive en una casa en anticretico ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad d La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos, también debe cumplir con el pago de manutención de sus hijos ya que actualmente se encuentra divorciado.
El crédito lo desea invertir en el pago de mano de obra  para la construcción de su vivienda ya que sus padres le dieron un espacio para que construya y pueda tener estabilidad domiciliaria.
El sueño de Rene es terminar su construcción y poder pedir la custodia de sus hijos para darles mas comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Rene is divorced and has two children.  He lives in a two room house with an antichresis mortgage.  The house is located in La Paz.  

Rene works more than eight hours a day as he needs to pay for the costs of food, education, and basic services.  He also has to pay child support since he is divorced.  This loan will be used to pay for labor to build his home.  His parents gave him a plot so that he can build and have a stable home.  

Rene's dream is to finish construction and be able to ask for custody of his children in order to provide them with more comfort and safety.

loans.use: to build his home for himself and his two children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de queso y leche cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de forraje, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un ganado lechero ya que quiere incrementar su produccion,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Eduardo still has the same business selling cheese and milk.  He tells us that the last loan went well, and he used it to purchase animal feed.  He is now requesting a loan to purchase a milking cow as he wants to increase his production.  He is happy and thankful for the opportunity he has been given to grow his business and improve his quality of life, as this is the only way he can support himself.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Virgen de Bronce está formado por 8 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les dan la oportunidad de sacar adelante a sus familias, con su ejemplo les enseñan y les motivan a sus hijos para que aprendan el sacrificio y las buenas prácticas de ser unos luchadores en la vida, aun mas les enseñan sus tradiciones y sus costumbres. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su geografía accidentada le regala hermosos paisajes, está llena de gente amable y gentil.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Susana, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, sus dos primeros hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo estudia en la universidad, su esposo labora como chofer en una compañía, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Susana se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la aprendió trabajando, ahora le permite ser una persona independiente tanto en el trabajo como en su economía, trabaja todos los días y realiza toda prenda de vestir. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en telas, hilos y en repuestos para sus maquinas de coser. Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Bronce (Bronze Virgin) loan group is made up of 8 women who work in different activities which give them the opportunity to help their families.  With their example, they teach and motivate their children so that they learn about sacrifice and best practices to fight for what they want in life.  They also teach them traditions and customs.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which has been a cultural World Heritage site since 1999.  It is bathed in 4 rivers and its geography delivers beautiful landscapes. The city is full of friendly and polite people

One of the members of this group is Susana.  She is 49 years old and married.  She has 3 adult children.  Her older two children are married and live independently.  Her youngest son studies at the university.  Her husband works as a chauffeur for a company.  They own the house where they live. Susana is a seamstress. She learned how to sew at work and now she is independent both in her work and financially.  She works everyday and makes all types of clothing.  The money from this loan will be invested in fabric, thread, and replacement parts for her sewing machines.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and replacement parts for sewing machines.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 32-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons. She maintains her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. 

Nadia is a well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, the number of her of clients increases day by day. So she requires some beauty-salon related items such as facial cream, combs, and furniture like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. Nadia contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, and BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued the loan. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon items such as facial cream, combs, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio, vive en casa prpia con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la confeccion de chalecos, los cuales los comercializa segun contratos que hace con algunos colegios.

El credito que solicita es para colocar machimbre y el pintado de una habitacion que usara para taller de su negocio.y poder tener mayor comodidad y obtener mas contratos.

El sueño de Florencio es poder tener un taller de confeccion mas grande y poder tener empleados o sea generar fuentes de trabajo para jovenes que se interesen en la confeccion.
texts.en:
Florencio lives in his own house with his wife and children in the city of La Paz. He makes jackets for a living, which he sells according to agreements that he makes with some schools.

The loan he is requesting is for tongue and groove material and paint for a room that he will use as the workshop of his business and to be able to have more comfort and obtain more contracts.

Florencio's dream is to be able to have a bigger sewing shop and to be able to have employees or generate sources of work for youths that are interested in sewing.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, dairy products, soft drinks, vegetables, and eggs.

loans.name: Jhon Fernando

texts.es: El Joven Fernando tiene 20 años y es Soltero, el se dedica al diseño y elaboración de tarjetas personales, volantes, trípticos, etc. Tiene su casa que funciona como imprenta donde realiza sus trabajos, el vive en la zona de Villa Adela  de la Ciudad de El Alto, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo para la  compra de materiales al por mayor para elaborar sus tarjetas,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo, el Joven Fernando enfrenta retos en su negocio que son es bastante joven, lo que significa que aún no tiene muchos clientes, desvalorando el conocimiento y habilidad del cliente,  va a utilizar los beneficios comprará, papel couché, tinta, plástico y un ordenador para mejorar su servicio. Su deseo para su negocio es tener una imprenta bien consolidad y tener muchos clientes  para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Fernando is 20 years old.  He is single and designs and creates business cards, flyers, brochures, etc.  The print shop where he does his work is in his home.  He lives in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto.  This loan is the first with this institution.  He will use it to purchase materials wholesale in order to make cards.  He is requesting this loan because he does not have cash.  He faces challenges in his work because he is young and doesn't have many customers yet, and they don't know his knowledge and abilities.  He will use the loan to purchase glossy card stock, ink, plastic and a computer to improve his service.  His hope for his business is to have a good printing operation and many customers in order to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase materials wholesale to make business cards.

loans.name: Zaynaboy

texts.en:
Zaynaboy was born in 1966, and she is a kind woman. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Zaynaboy has been busy growing potatoes and wheat on her own land for more than fifteen years. 

Zaynaboy likes her job and easily makes all her deals. Her husband and children help her manage the business. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. Her family is big, and that’s why she needs more money. Zaynaboy is going to grow a new crop, but she doesn't have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin is 24 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who have earned a living by farming rice for the past three years. To earn more income to better support their family, they also work for others for a fee. Their current business earns them about 30,000 KHR per day to feed their family.

Phin is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phin is going to use her portion to pay for the labor fees associated with harvesting rice. She hopes to grow more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees associated with harvesting rice.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy charcoal and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy charcoal and direct-selling products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena hopes that her business will continue strong and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for charcoal and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Gañaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Gañaloma está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven los alrededores del cantón de Nabon, esta lugar es de clima frió y de bellos paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Las socias al igual que toda su gente se dedica la crianza de animales,  a la agricultura, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad, se caracterizan por ser personas que luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ligia, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Gañaloma, le gusta esta forma de crédito porque esta aprendiendo cosas de la vida que no conocía gracias a la experiencia de todas sus amigas, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le ayudan a mejorar su estabilidad económica.
La Señora. Ligia tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Ligia dese hace un año labora en la ciudad como empleada domestica pero en su tierra natalicia cría cuyes y gallinas los cuales les cuida su mamá y ella los fines de semana que viaja para allá, también cultiva y lo que cosecha es para su casa y también la vende. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de gallinas de postura y cuyes de mejor calidad. Su meta es tener una tienda y así tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The Gañaloma credit group consists of 8 female members and one male member who are neighbors in the canton of Nabon. This place has a cold climate and beautiful scenery with its rugged geography. Its architecture is a mixture of traditional and modern. 
The members of this group, like many around them, earn their livings raising animals, in agriculture, in trade, or working in the city. The area is characterized by people who work hard everyday to raise their families and keep their culture and traditions alive. 
One of the members of this group is Ligia. She is getting her second loan alongside her friends in the Gañaloma group. They like this form of credit because she is learning things in life that she never knew before thanks to the experiences of all of her friends. At the same time, the loans help improve her financial stability.
Ligia is 19 years old. She is married and the fruit of their union is their 2 year old son. Her husband works in construction. They do not have their own home, they are renting.
Ligia has worked in the city as a maid for the past year but in her homeland she has raised guinea pigs and hens. Her mother cares for them and during the weekend Ligia travels home. She also cultivates and harvests crops for household consumption and for sale. The money from her loan will be invested in buying guinea pigs and hens of better quality. Her goal is to have a store and, therefore, have her own business.

loans.use: to invest in guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  33 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  SANTORO I l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et alimentaires.  Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire.            MAMOU,  1 ère femme   à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 rouleau  de Bazin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are on the average 33 years old, with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Santoro, a district in San, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family ties and work as vendors selling food products and miscellaneous items. The Danaya group is on its first solidarity loan. Mamou, the first one from the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy one set of traditional damask-type "bazin" fabric. She stocks up from wholesalers. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 17,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and clothing, with the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, wood and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase house building materials like cements, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay schools fees for his children.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 37-year-old single mother of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She has repaid all her previous loans successfully. 

With this loan from VisionFunds Kenya, Lydia will be able to purchase poultry feeds and pay school fees for her children. Additional income generated will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, Lydia would like to build a permanent store to keep her farm produce and also expand on her farming. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sreymol's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Sreymol is aged 32. She lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To support her family, Sreymol has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee for 10 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Sreymol is in her second cycle with VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Sreymol is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rom is a 46-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming has been the only source for her family’s income for 14 years. She also works for others for a fee. She earns about 30,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
Rom’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Rom is in her second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Rom is going to use her portion to buy a cart for supporting her business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy a cart for supporting her business.

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Sophany is single and lives in a rural village in the Srey Snom district. She earns a living through farming rice. Having been in business for several years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sophany has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe, 56 years of age, is married to a carpenter and blessed with four children. She has been in the hog raising business for almost twenty six years and earns a net income of PHP 12,000 every three hogs that she sells. Her net income is usually spent on her additional business which is vegetable vending. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase hog feeds for her hogs. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, 51, is married. She lives with her family in a village of the Moug Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children. For the last 10 years, Saroen and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of the family’s income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 29,000 KHR per day from the current business.
 
Saroen’s group consists of four members and she is in her sixth cycle. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Saroen is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. This loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to make living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sok is aged 56 years and married. She has nice children. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 17 years and she sells grocery items to better feed her children. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Sok’s group consists of four members who are all female. Sok has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past loans have helped her to gradually improve her living situation. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Sok is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en: Abduvosit was born in 1953. He is a hardworking man. Abduvosit has great experience in feeding cattle. Since childhood he has helped his parents in animal husbandry. For many years, Abduvosit has had his own business with animal husbandry. He feeds cows. Abduvosit buys cattle, feeds them and sells them  in a local market. He has no money to buy firewood and coal for the winter season. The weather is so cold and he needs firewood and coal. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy firewood and coal for the winter season.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 48, is a married mother living in a rural village in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She has nine children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a hardworking farmer who grows rice. Together, with hard work, they can earn about US$9 per day and save about US$5 each day for future needs.

Kong has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loan. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles nucléaires à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
 Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme SALIMATA fait le commerce des  habits dans ce groupe de femme. Elle se tient en première position de la   droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 pièces de bazin à Sikasso  et  Bobo (BURKINA FASO); qu’elle revendra en détail au marché en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya’s four members are married women. They are on average 35 years old with three children. Most of them live in nuclear families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

This is the eighth loan they have taken with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet their customers' needs.

In this group of women, Mrs. Salimata trades in clothing. She is the first woman from the right in the picture.

With her loan, she is planning on purchasing ten pieces of brocade from Sikasso and Bobo (in Burkina Faso). She will retail them at the market to a clientele composed of men and women. She takes cash or credit.

With this loan, she is counting on an average monthly profit of 40,000 XOF, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, with the remainder going to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est né vers 1972 à kadiolo, père de 3 enfants, il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à Kadiolo région de SIKASSO (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Monsieur Abdoulaye mène les activités d’achat et de vente d’essence, riz et sucre, huile ainsi que d’autres produits dans sa boutique au bord de la route Sikasso. Il fait le commerce il y’a plus de 15 ans.
Monsieur Abdoulaye s’approvisionne à Sikasso et à Kadiolo. Il est à son deuxième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 bidons d’huile de 20 litres, 5 sacs de riz, 5 sacs du sucre. Il vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is born circa 1972 in Kadiolo. A father of three, he lives with his wife and children in a traditional family in Kadiolo, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Mr. Abdoulaye buys and sells gas, rice, sugar, oil, and other products, in his roadside shop in Sikasso. He has been in retail for over fifteen years.

Mr. Abdoulaye gets his supplies from Sikasso and Kadiolo. This is his second loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better answer the needs of a growing clientele. The previous loan was paid back on time.

This loan will allow him to purchase two 20-liter cans of oil, five bags of rice, and five bags of sugar. He takes cash and credit, and his clientele numbers men as well as women.

He is planning on an average monthly profit of 70,000 XOF. This profit will allow him to pay back the loan with its interest, and to invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sidi est né en 1979 à Lofigué cercle  de Kadiolo, père de 4 enfants, il réside avec ses deux femmes dans une famille traditionnelle à Kadiolo  région de SIKASSO (3ième région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Monsieur Sidi mène les  activités d’achat et vente d’essence il y4a plus de dix ans, il s’approvisionne à Sikasso et à Siékourani.
 Il est à son quatrième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Les prêts précédant ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 17 bidons de 20 litres d’essence. Il vend au comptant et à crédit à un clientèle composé d’hommes et de femmes à Kadiolo. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidi is born in 1979 in Lofigué, Kadiolo circle. A father of four, he lives with his two wives in a traditional family in Kadiolo, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
Mr. Sidi has been buying and selling gas for over ten years. He gets his supplies from Sikasso and Siékourani.
This is his fourth loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better answer the needs of a growing clientele. The previous loans were paid back on time.
This loan will allow him to purchase seventy 20-liter drums of gas. He accepts cash and credit from a clientele composed of men and women of Kadiolo.
He is planning on an average monthly profit of 70,000 XOF. This profit will allow him to pay back the loan with its interest, and to invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, cooking oil, and cooking season to expand her business.

loans.name: Abdunaby

texts.en:
Abdunaby is an entrepreneur who is married and has two children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than seven years. Little by little with the passing of the years, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to his animal's good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells animals in the local market and has many customers.

Abdunaby is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to sell

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Ella es María y quiere contar un poco de cómo escogió esta hermosa carrera y la motivación que tuvo,  se encontraba hablando con la hermana y ella le comentaba a la hermana que  iba a estudiar porque necesitaba escalar en la empresa donde ella laboraba y que a ella la querían en la parte de administración como auxiliar de contabilidad, ella quería empezar a estudiar, pero tenía la angustia de la hija que a un estaba muy pequeña  para que la dejara sola, pero ella vio que la niña estaba bien cuidada y que iba a estudiar en la noche, porque lo que allá quería era que la hijita y ella misma tuvieran una  mejor calidad  de vida y sabía que estudiando tendría un mejor empleo y mejor estabilidad económica.
De lo que María estaba segura era que ese era el primer paso para cumplir el sueño que ella siempre había tenido que es tener  una pequeña o grande empresa.
Así que ella escogió estudiar contabilidad financiera, ya que con esta carrera podría ayudar a la empresa donde ella está trabajando, empezó a estudiar en la institución de educación superior las mercedes, el dia que estaba realizando el proceso de la matricula le  dieron la noticia de que ella podía obtener un beneficio con el convenio de kiva, fue una noticia que a ella le alegro muchísimo, ya que es una ayuda demasiado grande ya que ella es una madre cabeza de hogar y le quedaba un poco difícil pagar el estudio y con ese beneficio ella estudio, se preparo y fue una persona correcta, obtuvo un ascenso en la empresa donde trabajaba, hasta que llego el día que ella tanto anhelaba, tiene la  propia empresa de distribución y veta de pinturas, ella lleva la contabilidad perfectamente gracias a la carrera que ella escogió.
texts.en:
Maria wants to tell you a bit about how she chose her beautiful career and the motivation that she has. She was talking with her sister and she told her sister that she was going to school because she needed to climb the ladder at the company where she was working. She wanted to work in administration as an accounting clerk. Maria wanted to start studying but had a daughter who was too young to be left alone. She made sure her daughter was taken care of and went to study at night because she wanted to make sure her daughter had a better quality of life. She knew studying would bring a better job and better economic stability. 
Maria was sure that was her first step to fulfill the dream to start a small or large company. She chose to study financial accounting because this career would help her in the company where she is working. She began to study at an institution of higher learning called Las Mercedes. The day she was doing the enrollment process, she was told that she could obtain the benefit of a Kiva loan. It was news that made her so glad because it is a big help for her as a single mother and household head. It was difficult to pay the fees and with this loan she can be prepared. She was the right person because she got a promotion at the company where she worked. Finally the day came that she longed for: she has her own company distributing and selling paintings. She keeps the books perfectly thanks to the career she chose.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Fatoumata Traore

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata née vers 1966 à SAN ville, mère de 10 enfants elle réside dans une famille traditionnelle  à Siékourani un gros village de cercle kadiolo région de SIKASSO (3ième région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Madame Fatoumata mène des activités d’achat et vente de poissons fumés il ya plus de quinze.
 Elle est à son premier prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant, Mme Fatoumata a sollicité ce prêt qui lui permettra de faire l’achat de 3 paniers de 30 kg de poisson fumé au quartier Bobokin de Loulouni ainsi qu’à Sikasso. Elle revend à la maison au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata was born around 1966 in San city. A mother of ten, she lives in a traditional family in Siékourani, a large village in Kadiolo circle, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Fatoumata has been buying and selling smoked fish for over fifteen years.

This is her first loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso; she is taking it in order to better answer the needs of a growing clientele. Mrs. Fatoumata requested this loan which will allow her to purchase three 30-kilo baskets of smoked fish from the Bobokin neighborhood in Loulouni as well as from Sikasso. She sells from home, and accepts cash or credit from a clientele composed of men and women.

She is planning on an average monthly profit of 60,000 XOF. This profit will allow her to pay back the loan with its interest, and to invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish.

loans.name: Fatime Diop

texts.fr: Madame Fatime  est une femme âgée de 49 qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants.  Elle habite aux environs du guichet et évolue dans la couture et vend des pagnes. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter des tissus et des garnitures pour confectionner des pagnes garnies qu’elle vend à ses clients.  Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes  et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité et qui sa maison à 8h pour y revenir vers les couts de 20h. A l’avenir elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et  diversifier son activité
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatime is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children. She is in business in tailoring and she sells pagnes (wrapped clothing).

She is requesting this amount to purchase fabrics and accessories to sew the decorated pagnes she sells to her clients. She helps her husband with everyday expenses and with her children’s school fees. She has over ten years of experience in this business. She leaves home at 8 a.m. and returns around 8 p.m.

In the future, she wishes to improve their living conditions and to diversify her business.
