loans.use: to buy fabrics and decorations to sew "pagne" robes.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Apenas pudo cursar el 4º grado de educación básica, por sus escasos recursos económicos.
Es madre de 3 niños quienes tienen la edad de 11, 4, y 3 añitos. Los 2 mayores se encuentran estudiando educación básica, mientras el pequeñito esta aún bajo sus cuidados en casa.
Su esposo juntamente con ella lucha cada día por darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Él es empleado de un hotel de la Comunidad. Ella se dedica a vender Pan todas las mañanas de 8:00 am a 1:00pm, y por las tardes se dedica a las tareas domesticas que gustosamente día con día realiza.
El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para cancelar a unas personas que le donaron sangre, lo demás para comprar una medicina que le hace falta. Juntamente con su esposo lucharan para que todo mejore y que ella pueda gozar de la salud que tanto necesita para seguir trabajando para sus pequeños. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus niños unos hombres de valor, con sus estudios ya realizados y sus metas cumplidas. Para que puedan tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 29, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She barely completed her basic education through the fourth grade because of limited financial resources.

María is the mother of three children (ages 11, 4, and 3). The two older children are in school, while the youngest one is still being cared for at home. She and her husband strive each day to provide the best for their children. He is employed at a hotel in their community. María sells bread every day from 8:00 A.M. to 1:00 P.M. Later on in the afternoons, she gladly goes about completing her housework.

The loan she is requesting will be used to repay a few people who donated blood to her, as well as buy medicine that she is lacking. María and her husband strive to improve in all areas so that she can enjoy much-needed health, which will allow her to continue working for the sake of her little ones.

She dreams of seeing her sons become men of valor, obtain their education, and accomplish their goals so that they can have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy medicines and to repay those who donated blood to her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, potatoes, and other items.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel se siegue dedicando al negocio de transporte,ella tiene un carro que presta servicio de transporte,la socia es la que administra,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es comprar un carro nuevo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isabel continues to manage a business in the transportation sector. She has a car that is used for providing transportation services. Isabel manages the use of the vehicle. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. Isabel has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to buy a new car.

Isabel is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for her car. She is pleased with the loan and promised to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for her car.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and is married to Jane. They are blessed with two children, ages 12 and 17 years old.
He runs a poultry business.

This has been his income generating business for the last ten years; the poultry business generates an average monthly income of KES 30,000.

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 98,700 to pay school fees for his son in secondary school. He plans to plow back the anticipated profits into the business. His future business plan is to have a record ten thousand birds.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra was born in year 1968. She is married and has four children. Gulchehra has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. She lives in a rural area. Gulchehra has a great experience in this field. Her son and daughter-in-low help her with managing the business. Gulchehra feeds cows. She has a big cowshed in her house. Gulchehra’s business is the main source of income for her family. She is going to increase her working capital. Gulchehra is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit story. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more fruits of different kinds for his business. His loan helped, not just in his business, but also in the education of his children. His income from the business is supporting their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are both working hard to provide for their family.

Remy would like to apply for a 60,000 Philippine peso loan which he will be using to buy more fruits that he will sell in the market. The more items displayed at the store the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and his children's education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Remy hopes that his business will last long and dreams that his family will have a harmonious relationship. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits that he will sell in the market.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil, and Maggie to expand her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak is a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 51 years old and the mother of two children. To make a living, she grows rice on 1.5 hectares as their main source of income and works for others for a fee for additional income. Her 24 years' involvement in the current business has helped her to earn about 40,000 riels (KHR) per day.

Nak, who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for ages with successful repayment, is forming a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a reaping fee. She highly hopes that she can gain a triple yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: To pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señorita Olga, curso la primaria en una vereda, luego se trasladó a otra ciudad a terminar el bachillerato con esfuerzo y sacrificio, ya que no contaba con ningún apoyo económico por bajos recursos en  la familia, con todo ese esfuerzo y dedicación logro culminar el grado 11 en la jornada de la noche en el año 2005. 
Luego se propuso seguir estudiando auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos,  pues siempre le llamo la atención  prevenir  y resolver problemas  relacionados con medicamentos  para mejorar el bienestar y  la calidad de vida del  paciente. 
Después de un tiempo olga decide trasladarse a Bogotá  en busca de otros y mejores logros académicos, luego de buscar e indagar  por instituciones, corporaciones  con alto grado de enseñanza y que pudieran brindarle facilidades de pago, horarios flexibles y por supuesto que tuvieran la carrera que ella quería, entonces supo que existía campo alto una institución con estándares de calidad y una buena base para construir el futuro, ahora olga se matriculo y hace parte de los alumnos de campo alto en donde espera  culminar la carrera y poder desempeñarse laboral mente en el área.  
El convenio de kiva seria de gran ayuda para ella, ya que ella sola es la que corre con los gastos del estudio, sin contar los gastos que le genere el transporte, alimentación entre otros.
texts.en:
Srta. Olga started elementary school in a village and later moved to another city so that she could finish high school with effort and sacrifice. There was no financial support available for low-income families. With a great deal of effort and dedication, she was able to complete the 11th grade on a weekday evening in 2005.

Later on, it was suggested that she continue her studies by entering the pharmacy assistant program. This program focuses on the prevention and resolution of drug-related problems so that the well-being and quality of life of the patient can improve. Afterwards, Olga decided to move to Bogota in search of other ways to improve academically. She researched and inquired about higher education institutions and corporations that offered payment options, flexible hours, and of course, the field of study that she wanted to pursue. Olga concluded that CampoAlto was an institution with quality standards and a good foundation for building her future. She is now enrolled and part of the student body at CampoAlto. Olga hopes to finish her degree program and be able to work competently in her field of study.

The Kiva loan will be a great help to her since she is bearing the cost of her studies by herself. This does not include other expenses such as transportation, food, and other costs.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials, such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, etc. for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a new client at the institution who applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He is 36 years old, married with three children, and hails from Bigaaga – Rwerere, Nyakagyeme; Rukungiri District.

He has a stock of local brew at a local trading center which is a distribution point to neighboring areas and towns. His major challenges has been lack of capital and supply fluctuations, leading to failure to meet customers’ demands. He hopes that with this loan facility, he will be able to meet his customers’ demands and raise enough income to sustain himself and his family.

He appreciates the role UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) is playing in boosting incomes of the local people.

loans.use: to buy liquor to resell.

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
Leticia, the featured borrower of this group, is part of the group called 'Blema Tesaa', and they want to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, because they have always been neighbors and friends.
 
Leticia is 28 years old, single, and the mother of one. She has been selling smoked fish and she is standing second from left in the photograph. She has been working so hard for three years to take care of her child. And this is why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers.

Leticia is very ambitious. In the future, she would like to open a small restaurant that will attract new customers and improve her family's living.
The group will need a total amount of GHS 1,950 to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to fix and repair her room for rent. Her loan also helped in the education of her child. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and education expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Pet is 33 years old and a mother of three kids. For her, two hectares of rice farming and a paid-working job are her main sources of income, which have returned her about 32,800 KHR to cover the daily basic need for her family. 

This is the fifth loan for Pet with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees.

loans.name: Soem's Group

texts.en:
Soem, age 53 and the mother of three kids, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Currently, only one kid is living with her and is helping with the family’s chores as well as the business. For the sake of her entire family, Soem has 5 hectares of rice cropping as their main source of income and works for others for a fee. It is the business that she has had for 15 years.

This is the sixth loan cycle for Soem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle – now better than before. She has formed a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 riels (KHR) each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee. She hopes that she will get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 35, is married to Julius and is the mother of three children. She runs a grocery store in Kawangware on the outskirts of Kangemi. Mary has been in this business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

This will be Mary's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy grocery items to sell such as tomatoes, onions, fruits. etc. In future, she wants to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell such as tomatoes, onions, fruits, etc

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is a resident from Battambang province. She is 57 years old and the mother of five children. To cover the daily cost of living, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for years and currently it earns her about 38,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Mach and the first loan for her co-borrower in this group of two. The past loan which she has fully repaid has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so that it is better than before. Now, Mach and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the fee for plowing for her crop. She hopes to earn more income than she has previously earned.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the fee for plowing

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en: Sadokat is a young woman. She is 22 years old. Sadokat is not married and lives with her parents. She is going to organize her own business because her parents have a small income and they live poorly. Sadokat took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women organization. Sadokat got a certificate. She is going to organize a business with animal husbandry because they have a big cowshed in the house. Sadokat is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby clothing, baby cream and baby oil for resale.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda is a villager from the Mongkol Borey district of Bantey Meanchey province. She is 37 years old and a mother of five children; two of them are in school. To support her family, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and works for others for a fee. Chenda, a three-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) has successfully repaid her past loan and now leads a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. The past loan has helped her to improve her livelihood progressively. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to fix her rice mill. She hopes to gain a good income -   better than before - so that she can renovate her house to a good condition.

loans.use: to fix her rice mill.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak is a villager in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children. To feed her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee as the main source of income. She has been with this business for 12 years and generates an income of about 24,000 KHR per day. 	 

Sreyleak is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her successful repayment of the past loans has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, in a group of three, she is a group leader. Sreyleak is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrowers are each applying for 1,400,000 KHR. For Sreyleak, her loan portion will be spent on plowing her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to prepare her farmland in time to be ready for the replanting season.

loans.use: To plow her farmland

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en: Kai is a villager from Kampong Cham province. He is 37 years old and a father of five dependent children, three of whom are in school and two who are too young for schooling. To support the family, he is planting rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement his income.  The current business earns him about 27,200 KHR per day. Kai and his joint borrower, in the same group of two, are taking a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The original loan has helped him to uplift his lifestyle in a gradual condition. For this cycle, he and his co-borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, Kai will spend his entire loan portion on buying fertilizer for his cassava. He hopes that this purchase will boost his yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: Yasmin is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Recently, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Sreyloeng's Group

texts.en:
Sreyloeng, aged 20, is a farmer from Memot district of Kampong Cham province. To cover the daily cost of living, she plants cassava as her main source of income and works as a paid worker for additional income.  She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. 

This is the second microloan for Sreyloeng and her co-borrower in this group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The original loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so that it is better than before. Now, she is seeking  a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrower is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor fees and to buy fertilizer. She hopes her current business will earn her a good profit.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor fees and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a resident of Nyabikuku cell, Rushsha Parish, Rujumbura County, Rukungiri District. He is married with three children aged three, six and eight years. His major source of income is a drug shop which he operates duly in his time. His major challenge has been lack of capital to extend business operations in that area.

Last year in April 2013, William secured a loan of 2,000,000 UGX with which he managed to make profits that helped him to provide basic requirements for his family. More so, he hopes to expand his business through Kiva funds and attain his goals. He managed to pay in time for the whole year that he was given the previous loan facility. He hopes for a better future with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited's assistance.

loans.use: to restock his phamarcy.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is 28 years old and a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Battambang province. She is also a mother of one dependent kid who is too young for schooling. The main sources of her family’s income are rice farming and pig-raising. Additionally, she can earn extra income via her husband's occupation as a construction worker. Engaging in current business for six years, she is able to earn around 24,700 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is the fourth-time borrower, including this loan, while the other two borrowers are in second cycle loans. She has fully repaid back her past loan with success, and it has enabled her to improve her living condition better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to expand her pig-raising business to a larger scale

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Keat's Group

texts.en:
Keat is a farmer in Kampong Cham province. She is 22 years old and a mother of one son who is too young for schooling. To support her daily cost of living, she grows a cassava field as the main source of income. The business that she has occupied for two years generates about 27,700 KHR per day for her. Keat, a second-time borrower with a successful repayment of her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), formed a group of two to get a new loan. 

The past loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before, especially in providing three decent meals for her kid. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and weeding fees and buy insecticide for her cassava. She hopes to gain her yield better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding fees and buy insecticide.

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en: Ith is 37 years old and a mother of five children, two of whom are in school and one who is too young for schooling. She is also a local villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where her cassava is grown. Besides this agribusiness, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She has been with this business for 12 years and it has helped her family to earn about 34,800 KHR per day. In a group of two, Ith is a leader. She and her co-borrower have been with VisionFund( Kiva’s partner) for at least five cycles with a successful repayment, which has upgraded Ith's living condition to be better than before. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 4,000,000 KHR each. For Ith, she will spend her entire loan portion on paying for labor costs, farmland leasing fees and fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, farmland leasing fees and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Ton is aged 62 years and married. She lives with her husband in a rural area located in the Moungkul Borey district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and she also supplements her income by selling grocery items. She and her husband can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
This is the fifth loan for Ton with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Ton is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her stitching work. Her husband is also a tailor by profession. Both work together to manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demands consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kalsoom hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, buttons, zippers and lace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mamlakotoy

texts.en: Mamlakotoy is a kind woman. She is married and has adult children. Mamlakotoy always wanted to organize her own business and to find a source of income. She is going to organize her own business in animal husbandry. She thinks that her business will go well because she lives in an agricultural region and has a good opportunity to feed cattle. Mamlakotoy took part in a course ‘To get Ahead’ of women's organizations. She got a certificate. Now she needs to money for buying cattle. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy, aged 54, lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has a son. Tursunoy lives in an agricultural area. She began her own business with animal husbandry six months ago because she needs to earn money. Her husband has a low income. 

Tursunoy manages her new business successfully and now wants to increase her business's working capital. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support. She hopes that developing her new business will be the main aspect of her future life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is at the age of 44. She is the mother of one daughter and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products, such as milk, curd, and butter, for sale. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sale. He speaks in monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He is in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Yasmeen demanded a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business.

She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en: Nargis is 26 years old and a house wife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nargis has requested a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fresh fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair products for resale

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is a hardworking farmer from Vedi town. She lives together with her husband and two sons. The farm that Nune currently owns includes livestock and arable land. Specifically, Nune keeps cows, pigs, piglets and chickens and cultivates wheat and tomatoes.
 
Near the house where they live, Nune also owns a small orchard where she grows apricot, apple and pear trees. The whole family works hard to gather a good income from agriculture and cover their daily needs. By applying for this loan, Nune asks for the help of Kiva lenders. She plans to renovate the barn and purchase forage for the livestock. The loan will greatly improve her farm and Nune will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is a borrower from Kampong Cham province. She is 20 years old and the young mother of two dependent children, both of whom are in school.  For her family, cassava farming and selling grocery items are the main sources of income. Thea also supplements her income by working as a paid worker.  These are the businesses in which she has been involved for five years. 

Thea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is teaming up in a group of two to receive a new loan of 500,000 KHR for herself and 1,000,000 KHR for her co-borrower. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to replenish her business on time with a good income in return.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, aged 35, is a local villager from Ponhea Krek district in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of two children; one is in school and the other one is still small. To support the family, she grows rice and cassava as the main of income, and works as a paid worker for additional income. She has been with these businesses for 10 years and she earns about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Including this loan, Touch is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loans has enabled her to support improvements to her living conditions at a gradual pace.  Now, she is teaming up in a group of four to receive a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her paddy rice and cassava farm. She hopes to earn double her income from before.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Humera

texts.en: Ms Humera is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of one child. Her husband's income is insufficient for their family expenditures. To meet her household expenditures and provide a bright future for her child, 15 years ago she decided to start a stitching business at her home. She is an expert at stitching different designs. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs 50,000. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues and generating a healthier source of income.

loans.use: To buy cloth, threads, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 49 years old and a resident from Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is a widowed mother of three children, one of whom still relies on her as this child is in school. To support the daily cost of living, she grows rice and vegetables as the main source of income. 

This is the fourth loan for Thoeurn and the second loan for her co-borrower. The past loans, which she has completely repaid, have enabled her to sufficiently support her business on time. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee for her crop.  She hopes to triple the yield from her crop with a good income in return.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Ms Kaneez is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband. The person shown with her in the picture is her husband. She has 16 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of nine children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na is a resident from Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is 53 years old and is a mother blessed with seven children, one of whom is in school. To deal with the food consumption and other necessary expenses in her household, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. These are the businesses that she has had for years. 

This is the fourth loan for Na with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her past loans. The positive impact of her past loans has helped her to support her lifestyle on time. For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to receive a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee. She strongly hopes that her rice will produce a good crop yield which she can sell for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 43 years old and married to Alexander Melly. They are blessed with five children. She does a bakery business in Chemundu, a location served by VisionFund Kenya's Kapsabet office.This business has been in existence for the last five years and she gets a monthly income of KShs 15,000. She plans to pay school fees with her loan of KShs 45,000. This being her third loan with VisionFund, she anticipates giving the best education to her children and to set a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora was born in 1978. She is married and has four children. She lives with her family in the Northern part of Tajikistan. Nigora, some years ago, began her own business of animal husbandry. She has some cows and sells milk and sour cream to her neighbors. Nigora gets a small income from this business. She learned to sew national women's dresses. Now, she is going to organize a new business with sewing. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 31-year-old married woman who has been selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of plastic crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000. In this way, she will be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as bowls, plates and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase crockery to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 41-year-old, married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past ten years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. 

Farzana has six children, two of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business, through Kashf Foundation's support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase one more cow. Farzana hopes to have an increase in her production capacity which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame FATOUMATA est née vers 1964 à Gao 7eme région administrative de la république du MALI.Elle est mariée, mère de 9 enfants et réside à BOUGOULA VILLE à SIKASSO (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Madame FATOUMATA  mène les activités d’achat et de vente de couvres lit, des caches mur, des couscous arabes et de lait en poudre il y'a plus de douze  ans.
 Elle est à son sixième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat et la revente d’environ 50 couvres lits des caches mur, 20 tapis, 30 sacs de 25kg de lait en poudre et une quantité importante des couscous arabes, elle s’approvisionne en Algérie via Gao.
 Elle les revend en ambulant au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 175 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatouma was born in 1964 in Gao, the seventh administrative region of the Republic of Mali. She is married, a mother of nine children, and lives in Bougoula, in Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Fatoumata has been working buying and selling bed covers, floor coverings, rugs, arab couscous, and milk powder for 12 years. She is on her sixth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yirwaso, as a way to better satisfy her customers who are growing in number. Her previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

This loan will allow her to buy and then sell 50 bed covers, floor coverings, 20 rugs, 30 25-kilogram sacs of milk powder, and a large quantity of arab couscous. She procures her goods from Algeria via Gao. 

She travels around and makes her sales for cash and credit to men and women customers. 

Fatouma hopes to earn an average monthly income of 175,000 francs CFA. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and interest and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy bed covers, floor coverings, rugs, arab couscous, and milk powder

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est née en 1975 à SIKASSO, elle est veuve,  mère de 3 enfants résidant chez son feu défunt dans une famille nucléaire à OUAYERMA I SIKASSO (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Elle mène les activités d’achat et vente des tasses et assiettes en plastique et divers il y’a dix-huit  ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant, madame Mariam a sollicité ce prêt à l’institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Fasso. Madame Mariam est beaucoup sollicitée par  sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle est à son troisième prêt  avec l’Institution. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.   
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 cartons de 50 assiettes, des jouets pour enfant et diverses marchandises.
 Elle les revend sur place et à Sikasso au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1975 in Sikasso. She is a widow, a mother of three children, and lives with her late husband's nuclear family in Ouayerma, in Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Mariam has been working buying and selling plastic cups and plates and other goods for 18 years. She is highly sought after by her customers for the quality of her products, which she procures in Burkina Faso. In hopes of better satisfying her customers, who are growing in number, Mariam is seeking a loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her third loan with the institution. Her previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

This loan will allow her to buy 10 boxes of 50 plates, children's toys, and other goods. She will resell them in her town and in Sikasso for cash and credit to male and female customers. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA per month. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and its interest and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children. Her husband is an electrician. She has been in a beauty parlor business for ten years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing the best services, she has becomes very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. But because she has little cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her third loan. She needs a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater for more customers time-by-time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shamim’s husband who is a driver by profession who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shamim has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shamim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 45 years old and the mother of two children. Kaneez has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou née vers 1968 à SIKASSO, mère de 7 enfants, elle réside à OUAYERMA I à SIKASSO (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Madame Oumou mène les activités d’achat et de vente de viande, haricot et spaquetti il y'a plus de quinze 15 ans, elle mène cette activité de restauration  toutes les nuits devant le domicile conjugal.
 Elle est à son douzième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 sacs de 50 kg de haricot, 20 kg de viande par jour; 15 cartons de 20 paquets de spaquetti, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché. Elle les revend à la maison au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumou was born around 1968 in Sikasso, is a mother of seven children, and lives in Ouayerma in Sikasso (third administrative region of Republic of Mali). She has been working buying and selling meat, beans, and spaghetti for more than 15 years. She prepares this food and sells it every night in front of her home.

Oumou is on her 12th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in the hopes of better satisfying her customers, who are growing in number. All of her previous loans have been repaid correctly.

This loan will allow her to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of beans, 20 kilograms of meat each day, and 15 cartons of 20 boxes of spaghetti. She procures her goods in the large market. 

She makes her sales from home for cash and credit to male and female customers. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and its interest and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she sells

loans.name: Sardara

texts.en:
Sardara is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows and two buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Sardara is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 47 years old, a married woman and mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Nusrat’s husband who is a driver by profession who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nusrat has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane est né en 1975 à Nimbougou cercle de Kadiolo., Père de 6 enfants il réside avec ses 2 femmes  dans une famille traditionnelle à Loulouni région de SIKASSO (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Il mène les activités d’achat et vente des marchandises de boutique il ya plus de dix  ans, il s’approvisionne à Loulouni, Sikasso.
 Monsieur est à son neuvième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de  5 sacs de riz, 10 sacs de sucres, 7 cartons de savons, 5 bidons de 20 litres d’huiles. 
Il les revend dans sa boutique à Loulouni au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Souleymane was born in 1975 in Nimbougou, Kadiolo. A father of six children, he lives with his two wives in a traditional family in Loulouni, Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Souleymane has been working buying and selling shop goods for more than 10 years. He procures his goods in Loulouni, Sikasso. He is on his ninth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yirwaso, with the hopes of better satisfying his customers, who are growing in number. His previous loans have all been repaid correctly. 

This loan will allow him to buy five sacs of rice, 10 sacs of sugar, seven cartons of soap, and five 20-liter drums of oil.

He makes his sales in his shop in Loulouni for cash and credit to male and female customers. He hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA. These earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and its interest and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy shop goods

loans.name: Sant Yalla Goxu Mbathie Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement Sant  Yalla Goxou Mbathie a comme présidente Madame Marième. Il regroupe 10 membres qui habitent dans le meme quartier et font le meme métier. Leur présidente Marième est la femme qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans l’achat et la vente de poissons et crustacés de mer.  Elle est mariée et mère de famille, âgée de 63ans elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier ses activités. Marième  a une expérience de 10 ans  dans cet activité et souhaite d’acheter des quantités de poissons à l’arrivé des pirogues dans sa région.
texts.en:
The Sant Yalla Goxou Mbathie group has 10 members who live in the same area and who do the same type of work. 

The group's president is Marieme; her hand is raised in the photo. She works buying and selling fish and seafood. She is 63 years old, married, and a mother of a family. She helps her husband with the family expenses.

Marieme needs this loan to increase her cash flow and to diversify her business. 

Marieme has 10 years of experience in this area and wishes to buy fish that arrives by canoe to the area.

loans.use: to buy and sell fresh fish

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is young farmer from Harjis village of Syuniq region. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation. Nver keeps livestock and owns arable land where he cultivates wheat and potatoes. During the gathering season Nver, using his own tractor, provides rental services to his co-villagers and helps them to collect their harvest. This enthusiastic and hard working farmer lives together with his parents, grandparents, wife and new-born child. 

As the main breadwinner of the family, he feels very responsible to run his farm in a sustainable way and cover the family's basic needs. Nver has now applied for this loan to purchase tires for agri-machinery and grass-collecting machines. This loan will be a huge support for him and he hopes that Kiva lenders will support his farming business to grow.

loans.use: to pay for tires for agri-machinery and a grass-collecting machine.

loans.name: Ester Sofía

texts.es:
Ester se caracteriza por su tenacidad, pujanza y carisma; a sus 56 años de edad es casada y madre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho amor y dedicación.
Desde hace 16 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo comida de manera ambulante en un pequeño carro adecuado para tal labor; el oficio lo aprendió gracias a un hermano que también se dedicaba a realizar esta labor; actualmente trabaja sola de lunes a sábado de 11 am a 4 pm; así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo destinará para la compra de un nuevo carro de comidas y dos ollas grandes para almacenar los productos que ofrece; esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio, atrayendo más clientela y así podrá aumentar las ventas e ingresos que percibe con su labor.
Ester, con su tenacidad, pujanza y sus ganas de progresar, sueña con montar su negocio en un local comercial, en el que pueda prestar un mejor y más cómodo servicio a sus clientes y así garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida, en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Ester is known for her tenacity, drive and charisma; at 56 years old she is married and the mother of a son, who she has given a good education in life with much love and dedication. Since she was 16 years old, she started working as an independent shopkeeper, selling food on foot from a small cart which was suitable for this work. She learnt this trade thanks to her brother who also worked in this occupation. 

Currently, she works alone from Monday to Saturday from 11am to 4pm, in this way she makes enough income to support her husband with the financial burden of the household.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a new food cart and two big pots to keep the products that she offers. This will allow her to improve the image of her business, attracting more customers and she will be able to increase her sales and the income that she receives from her work.

Ester, with her tenacity, drive and her will to make progress, dreams of setting up her business in a commercial space, in which she can give a better and more convenient service to her customers and thereby guarantee economic stability to be able to enjoy a better quality of life, in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a new food cart and two big pots to keep all the products she offers.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three. 

She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Zahida requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons and two daughters. 

Her husband owns a decoration piece sale shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of new decoration pieces to improve his business. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase decoration pieces for her husband's shop. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business. Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of decoration pieces for the shop.

loans.name: Ildefonsa

texts.es:
Ildefonsa tiene 42 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno, actualmente está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 


La señora se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su esposo, durante la mañana ambos trabajan en las parcelas y camina 6 km para llegar al lugar,  en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo. Ildefonsa se levanta a las 4:30 AM. Junto a su esposo  para realizar las actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a la escuela.  

Este crédito le ayudará para comprar una vaca y producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Entre sus planes a futuro está, que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de queso,  de la siembra, y del préstamo comprar mas vacas, además sueña con comprar un terreno para poder pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Ildefonsa is 42 years old and completed only up to ninth grade. She is married and her husband works in farming.

Ildefonsa also works in farming, a trade she learned from her husband. The couple works together on their land in the morning. They walk six kilometres to arrive at work. In the afternoon the couple milks their cows to make and sell cheese. Ildefonsa wakes up at 4.30am with her husband, in order to carry out their daily activities while their children go to school.

This loan will help Ildefonsa to buy a cow and produce more milk to make cheese and increase her income.

One of Ildefonsa's future plans is to use her profits from selling cheese, from sowing crops and from this loan to buy more cows. She also dreams of buying land for her animals to graze.

loans.use: to buy a cow and produce more milk to make cheese and increase her income.

loans.name: Francy Elena

texts.es:
Ella es francy elena, tiene 26 años, ella vive con la hermana, estudia cosmetología y estética integral, en Campo alto, para ella estudiar es lo que la puede ayudar a sacar adelante a la familia, por este motivo francy trabaja desde muy pequeña y se esfuerza mucho para poder reunir lo de la cuota y materiales para continuar estudiando. En este momento se encuentra trabajando  con una empresa de asesoría en el cual se ha desempeñado como una gran persona y una buena trabajadora.
Ella se esfuerza mucho para cuidar lo que tiene, pues sabe que sin ello no puede culminar los estudios que es por lo cual ella ha hecho hasta lo imposible para no tener que dejarlo.
Ella  sueña con culminar los estudios y así tener la propia estética y siempre continuar estudiando para encaminar una nueva meta cada día, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Kiva le queda más cerca la meta para cumplir el sueño y ayudar a la familia para brindarles un mejor futuro a los hermanos.
texts.en:
Francy Elena, 26, lives with her sister and studies Cosmetology and Integrated Aesthetics at CampoAlto. Studying is what will help her to provide for her family, so she has been working since she was young and she puts in plenty of effort to pay her fees and buy materials so she can continue studying. 

She is currently working for a consulting company, where she has developed herself as a great person and a good worker. She works very hard to maintain what she has, because she knows that without this she cannot finish her studies. Therefore, she has done all she can so that she does not have to give it up.

She dreams of finishing her studies and owning her own beauty shop. She wants to keep studying forever to reach a new goal every day. Thanks to the help which Kiva is offering her, she is closer to making her dream come true and helping her family so that her siblings can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for one semester.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of one child. 

She has been doing a business of selling vegetables and fruits for many years now. She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is responsible for her family’s food and health, and she is trying hard to meet their basic needs through her business. 

This is her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and to enhance her business, this time she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase the vegetables, and sacks of apples, oranges and guavas in large quantity. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and sacks of apples, oranges and guavas in large quantity.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. It’s her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Rakhel

texts.en:
Ms. Rakhal is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Rakhal's husband. They have been working in this business together for many years. Over time, they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of five children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to purchase good quality wood along with packages of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation.   In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Rakhal dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along with packages of polish and nails.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain es una persona trabajadora que pertenece al banco solidario "Mamacha Rosario" y le va muy bien porque es responsable con el pagos de sus cuotas, él sigue dedicándose a la fabricación de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, carpetas entre otros, él desea abastecer su pequeño taller con materiales de trabajo como madera, clavos, pegamentos entre otros. Efrain requiere otros crédito adicional al normal porque desea comprar más madera. 

Efrain agradece por el crédito y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Este crédito se les otorga a los clientes responsables y puntuales con los pagos de las cuotas).
texts.en:
Efrain is a hard-working person and a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank. His association with the bank is going very well because he is responsible with his repayments. Efrain also continues to make furniture - such as seats, chairs and desks - out of wood. Efrain wants to stock up his little workshop with working materials such as wood, nails, glue and more. Efrain needs a larger loan than normal as he wants to buy more wood.

Efrain is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments on time. (This loan is granted to borrowers who are responsible and punctual with their repayments).

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunos terneros para tenerlos en la finca y así aprovechar el pasto que cuenta la finca y a la vez aprovechar los precios bajos de los mismos debido a la época de verano que la oferta es alta. La idea es aprovechar  las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales en desarrollo  para a futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roger is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. Roger intends to use his loan to buy calves for his farm and to use the pastures on his land. He also wants to take advantage of the low price of calves as in summer there are a lot of calves available on the market. Roger's plan is to use the good land and climate  to his advantage in order to have these animals growing up to later sell them for their meat. With these new animals, Roger will be able to do more work and, at the same time, save up, allowing him to have more animals and to invest in his property. This is Roger's first loan with "FUDECOSUR". Roger has not had other loans with state banks but "FUDECOSUR" has provided this loan under better conditions and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Paula Andrea estudiante de enfermería  2 semestre escogió  esta carrera porque le gusta, es una profesión admirable y con ella puede ayudar a mucha gente, aparte quiero ser útil  a la sociedad  ayudar a las personas que mas lo necesitan  y atenderlas, ademas a ella la  llena como persona prestar este servicio. 
Necesito el subsidio que campo alto brinda en convenio con kiva, porque no dispone de un apoyo económico, la mensualidad es muy alta y le queda pesado seguir pagando los estudios y el descuento que kiva le puede brindar la verdad le ayudaría bastante.
texts.en:
Paula Andrea is a nursing student in her second semester. She chose this degree because she likes it and because it is an admirable profession with which she can help many people. She also wanted to be useful to society and to help and care for the people who need it most. She feels fulfilled as a person by giving this service.

She needs this loan from CampoAlto and Kiva because she does not have any financial support. The monthly fees are very high and it is a burden for her to continue paying for her studies. The financial help which Kiva can offer her would truly be a great help to her.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema has successfully built her business of a small general store with the help of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Her husband assists her in purchasing stocks of goods from the market. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of biscuits, sugar, oil and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is hopeful to increase her earnings. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 23-year-old married lady and the mother of four children. She has been running a small general store with her husband in her community for many years. Her husband also is shown in the photo. 

She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Shazia makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Shazia wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital. It’s her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer responsable y amigable que pertenece al banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario", ella continua con la elaboración de artesanía y ayuda su esposo en la elaboración de muebles de madera con el acabado de los muebles. En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera, pinturas y clavos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Virginia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible and friendly woman who belongs to the Mamacha Rosario community bank.  She continues to make crafts and helps her husband by finishing the wooden furniture he makes.  

Virginia is requesting this loan to purchase more materials, including wood, paint, and nails.  She has done this work for many years and it is going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work.

Virginia is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, and nails.

loans.name: Darlys

texts.es: Darlys  de 34 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 7 años. Hace 5 años, su hermana, con su experiencia de negocio, puso el ejemplo y la impulso a vender mercancías: le prestaba artículos para que los vendiera y Darlys  le pagaba poco a poco, de acuerdo a su recuperación de cartera. Para captar clientes, puso un aviso en la ventana de su casa y poco a poco fueron llegando compradores, que ella conquistó, con el estilo propio de una experta comerciante. Hoy su negocio ha crecido y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin cesar,  lo atiende diariamente ofreciendo mercancía de miscelánea, de contado y a crédito. Sus compras las realiza en los almacenes de la ciudad y sus ventas son tan atractivas que ha conquistado los barrios aledaños al suyo. La meta de Darlys es ampliar su clientela y tener mas adelante su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará colonias, cremas prendas, cosméticos y pintauñas. Su mayor desafío es tener los recursos suficientes,  para invertir en su negocio y hacer que este crezca impulsando las ventas. Con su credikiva comenzará el camino hacia el éxito.
texts.en:
Darlys, 34, lives in the south of the city with her spouse and seven-year-old daughter. Five years ago, she followed the example of her sister's business and started selling merchandise. Her sister lent her items to sell and Darlys paid her back little by little as she made sales. To attract customers, she put up an ad in the window of her house, and customers began to come little by little. She won them over with the style of an expert businesswoman. 

Today, her business has grown and she works from 8am until 6pm without a break. She sells miscellaneous merchandise by cash and on credit. She makes purchases at warehouses in the city. Her store is so attractive that she has won over the neighboring areas. Her goal is to increase her clientele and to have her own home in the future. 

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cologne, creams, cosmetics, and nail polish. Her greatest challenge is having the sufficient financial resources to invest in her business and grow by increasing her sales. With this loan, she will begin her path to success.

loans.use: to buy cologne, creams, cosmetics, and nail polish.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en:
Suria is 51 year old.

She has been running a small general store for many years. She sells various products of daily use to the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to purchase stock of oil, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase stock of oil, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for the past six years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.  

She is the mother of three; one daughter and two sons. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Nasreen requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers. She hopes to increase production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
Two members from Together make up this group. One of them is Patience. She is 28 years old and a single mother of three, and has been in the business of selling smoked fish for 5 years. Patience has been a client of ID-Ghana for two years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more fish to smoke and supply to customers. She has to depend on this loan's profits to take care of her children. She is no longer living with the children's father and does not depend on him for her children's upkeep.

Peter is 44 years old and has a business selling firewood.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and supply to customers.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer lives in Voskehask village of Shirak region with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and three little grandchildren. 

Varditer is a farmer with many years of experience running her farm. It currently includes cows, pigs and chickens. Varditer also cultivates barley, potatoes and grass and grows apple and pear trees. The gathered harvest is sold locally and the family is able to sustain its living.
 
Now, by applying for this loan, Varditer would like to enlarge her agribusiness. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to purchase forage for feeding animals and also to buy potato seeds for cultivation. 

Varditer is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who does her best to have a successful and profitable farm. She will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is from the village of Arbat in the Masis region.  She lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren.
