Satik and her husband have been running a small farm for 15 years.  Over these years of hard and tireless work they were able to run the farm in a sustainable way ensuring stable monthly income.  Their farm includes a cow, 10 chickens and also plot of land where haricot is grown. 

Now, Satik decided to apply for this loan, as she needs financial support for her farm. The loan that she has requested will greatly help her to purchase green seed, a calf and grass as food for the livestock. 

Satik is very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for green seed, a calf and grass for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Chan Sultan

texts.en:
Chan Sultan is 53.  She is mother of two daughters and three sons and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is house wife and looks after her family at home.  

Chan Sultan's husband works in dairy selling products like milk, curd, butter.  He owns a small dairy farm consists of buffaloes and cows. Every day he sells milk to different tea stalls.  He is an honest man.  He manages his household necessities from his earning from milk sales.  He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one more buffalo to increase his income . So, Chan Sultan applied for this loan. In this way she can support to her husband business.  She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Henry Yuvini

texts.es:
Henry de 35 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, actualmente está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad que va a pre kínder.

Desde hace 14 años, Henry  se dedica a la agricultura y aprendió ya que cuando su padre y sus tíos iban al campo los acompañaba, actualmente siembra 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol y ¾ de maíz;  también se dedica  a la albañilería y su trabajo de campo es de 5 de la madrugada a 11 de la mañana.

Necesita el crédito, para comprar animales específicamente una yunta de novillos y comprar insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes y pesticidas para la milpa. Su sueños, es reproducir la yunta de novillos y que pueda sacar buenas producciones y en la familia tener buena salud para seguir dándoles la educación as u hijo.
texts.en:
Henry, 35, studied up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife is responsible for the household duties. He has a five-year-old son who is in preschool.

For fourteen years, Henry has worked in agriculture. He learned about farming when he used to accompany his father and uncles to the fields. He currently plants 3,500 square meters of beans and 3/4 of corn. He also works in construction. He works on the fields from 5 to 11 am. 

He needs this loan to buy animals, specifically a pair of steers, as well as farm supplies, fertilizer, and pesticide for his cornfield. His dream is to reproduce the pair of steers, to have good production, and for his family to have good health so that they can continue to give their son an education.

loans.use: to buy a pair of steers, farm supplies, fertilizer, and pesticide for his cornfield.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam  Fatima is a 35-year-old married woman.  

She has been running a business of livestock trade for the past 10 years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.  Currently, she requests a loan of  PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 39 years old and married women.  She has seven children.  

Nazia runs a food stall with her husband, who is also shown in the photo.  They offer "chickpea chat" which is a mixture of chickpeas, vegetables and yogurt.  They have become famous in their locality for providing good tasting food. 

She is in 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  Now, she requests a loan for the amount of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase stock of chickpeas, spices and some utensils from the market so they can meet the demands of their customers without fail. 

Nazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of chickpeas, spices and some utensils

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín es una persona emprendedora y trbajadora, él continúa con su profesión de carpintero y sigue con el pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica diferentes tipos de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, roperos, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pintura y otros. 
  
Efraín continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Efraín is an enterprising and hardworking person. He still works as a carpenter and has his small workshop in his home, where he makes different types of wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, wardrobes, beds, and other items. He needs this loan to buy more working materials, such as wood, nails, paint, and others.

Efraín is still part of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity he has been offered, and he is committed to paying back his installments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy working materials such as wood, nails, paint, and others.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is 40 years old, married and the mother of 5 children.  

Along with her husband, she is doing the business of manufacturing motorcycle indicators which are prepared on a molding machine.  Both have been in this business for the last 4 years and they have met their family expenses from this income, but now Shamim wants to increase her business. 

For this reason, Shamim has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000, to purchase plastic used in indicator manufacturing.  This will help her to manage their household expenses more smoothly and provide good quality indicators to her clients. 

Shamim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic used in indicator manufacturing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nusert

texts.en:
Nusert is 37 years old and the mother of six children. For many years, she has run a shoe-making business with her husband, who appears in this picture. Because of her help with the business, Nusert is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family as well as financial matters. It’s Nusert’s eighth year with Kashf Foundation. With the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. 

Nusert is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to buy additional shoe-making materials including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles and other items. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making materials such as leather, artificial leather and plastic soles

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 46 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. 

Bushra has expertise in hand embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 9 years now.  She started this line of work at a very young age.  During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material.  Today, she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

She has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan worth PKR 50,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand for her work. She says that the women in her community are wanting more and more of her work as time goes by and satisfying them is a challenge that Bushra has taken up.  

It's her 8th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es una persona amigable y responsable que saca adelante a su familia, él sigue con la carpintería pues tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, camas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Juan  requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera y pegamento. 

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan is a friendly and responsible person who supports his family. He continues as a carpenter since he has a small workshop at home where he makes all types of wooden furniture such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, tables and other pieces.  At this time Juan needs a loan in order to buy more work supplies such as wood and glue. 

Juan belongs to the communal bank Mamacha Rosario of the Arariwa Association and he is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and he agrees to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more work supplies such as wood and glue

loans.name: Raúl Ernesto

texts.es:
Raúl, a sus 37 años de edad,  es reconocido por su empuje y tenacidad, es un hombre trabajador y activo que vela cada día para sacar adelante a su único hijo y llevar el sustento al hogar.
Desde hace 6 años comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente, prestando el servicio de instalación de techos y canoas, trabaja solo y su horario de trabajo depende de los requerimientos de sus clientes, la bodega se encuentra ubicada en la casa de su madre, en un barrio del centro de la ciudad; presta el servicio a domicilio en un carro que obtuvo hace poco tiempo y que le ha permitido agilizar el tiempo de desplazamiento, por lo que mejora la eficiencia de su labor.
Con el ánimo de expandir su negocio, desea crear su propia página web, pues ha comenzado a prestar el servicio en algunas empresas y quiere darse a conocer por medio del internet; es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que pagará la creación de la página web de su empresa y comprará algunas herramientas de trabajo que le hacen falta, así podrá mejorar las ventas de su servicio y optimizar el tiempo de trabajo, logrando mejores ingresos, para ser más competitivo en el mercado; esto le ayudará a Raúl a darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, lo que para él significaría haber cumplido sus metas.
texts.en:
Raúl is 37 years old and known for his initiative and tenacity.  He is a hardworking and active man who uses every day to move forward for his only son and the support of his household.  He started to work independently six years ago, installing roofs and rain gutters.  He works alone and his schedule depends on his customer's requirements.  He keeps his materials at his mother's house, in a neighborhood in the center of the city.  He provides home service in a car that bought recently, which has allowed him to travel more quickly and improve the efficiency of his work.

With the goal of expanding his business, he wants to create his own website.  He has started providing services to some companies and he wants to advertise on the Internet.  He is requesting this loan to pay for the creation of a website for his business and to purchase some tools that he is lacking.  This will help him improve the sales for his service and optimize his work time so that he can earn more profits and be more competitive in the market.  This will help Raul provide continuity and permanence for his business, which for him would bean that he has achieved his goals.

loans.use: to create a website for his business and purchase tools.

loans.name: Tsaghik

texts.en:
Tsaghik lives in the town of Talin with her husband and two sons. 

She keeps raises chickens, pigs, sheep and cows.  The milk Tsaghik collects is used in cheese production which she sell at local markets. 

By applying for this loan, Tsaghik asks for financial support to be able to increase her livestock. She plans to purchase 4 oxen, 11 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. 

The loan is very important for Tsaghik to increase agricultural income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy 4 oxen, 11 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 54-year-old married woman. 

For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a business where she sells milk to the people of her community.  Over time, Khalida and her husband have become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Khalida asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. 

Its her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated a business of milk sales. Robina has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

Robina is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase more buffalo. Her loan will help her to increase her milk sales which will ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase buffalo

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling quality cloth in her community. Hameeda requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. This way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. It’s her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Babemba de Sikasso un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
 Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme   NABINTOU fait le commerce de wax dans ce groupe de femme. Elle se tient au milieu sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 pièces de pagne wax à SIKASSO qu’elle revendra en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The five members of the group DANAYA are married women, who average 48 years of age and two children each, all living for the most part in traditional families in the Babemba de Sikasso district, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 12th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. NABINTOU does commerce in Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in this group of women. She is standing in the middle in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth in Sikasso that she will sell retail at the market and within the family. Her customer base is composed of men and women paying in cash. 

With this loan, she envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA. Part of the profit is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. Along with her husband, Najma has been farming for many years growing different vegetables and fruits to sell in the local market. Her husband appears in this picture with her. Najma’s son also assists her in her business by watering the soil to ensure good quality production. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Najma is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase different types of seeds along with of insecticide and pesticide. Her loan will help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase seeds along with of insecticide and pesticide

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, a 44-year-old father of three from Thika, has a business as a livestock seller. He is married to Rebecca, who helps him in the business. He earns a monthly income of KES 42,800, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With this loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for sale. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family.

In the future, Patrick would like to venture into mixed crop farming and also expand his livestock selling business. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for sale.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 43-year-old married woman.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing her revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Book Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe de crédit BOOK NDEYE regroupe cinq femmes qui font parti d’une association de développement. Leur  activité consiste à faire  du commerce de divers produits : achats et vente de crèmes glacés, habits prêt a porter, petit déjeuner  etc. 
Leur présidente, madame Adama  fait du commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle est mariée et responsable de famille car elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer  en appuyant son époux pour  le payement des frais de scolarité des  enfants .Avec l’épargne qu’elle réussi à mettre de coté, elle envisage dans l’avenir d’ouvrir un magasin. Elle demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier son activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h du soir. Adama souhaite  à l’avenir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et devenir autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
The Book Ndeye group is made up of five women who are members of a development association. They work in commerce: the buying and selling of ice cream, ready-to-wear clothing, breakfast, etc. 

Their president, Adama, has been in commerce for three years. She is married and responsible for her family, because she helps with everyday expenses and helps her husband with their children's school fees.

With the savings that she has been able to put aside, she plans to one day open a store.

She is asking for this loan to increase her cash flow and to diversify her business.

She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 6 p.m. In the future, Adama wishes improve her family's living conditions and to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk to make ice cream

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
La señora Federica es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 48 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando. Se dedica a la confección de pants. Inició este negocio siendo empleada y hasta la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales para la confección de pants. Desea en el futuro contar con una maquila. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se decian al comercio, producción y agropecuario.
texts.en:
Federica, 48, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has six children, one of whom is studying. She makes a living by making pants. She started this business as an employee and she now has seven years of experience.

She is the organizer of a group which is applying for a loan. She will use this loan to buy materials to make pants. In the future, she would like to have a machine.

The other members of this group work in commerce, production, agriculture and livestock.

loans.use: to buy materials to make pants.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est né en 1974 à Kaï cercle de Kadiolo, il est père de 7 enfants. Polygame, il réside dans une famille traditionnelle à Kaï un village de Loulouni région de SIKASSO (3ième région administrative de la république du MALI). 
Monsieur Yacouba mène les activités d’achat et vente de céréales  il y’a plus de quinze 10 ans, il s’approvisionne à Sikasso, Loulouni et dans les villages environnants de Loulouni.
 Il est à son neuvième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 70 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 5 sacs de 100 kg de mil. Après l’achat il fait le stockage durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectuera à Kaï au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 220 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba was born in 1974 in Kaï, Cercle de Kadiolo. He is a father of seven. A polygamist, he resides in a traditional family in Kaï, a Loulouni village, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Yacouba has been working in the area of buying and selling grains for over ten years. He gets his supplies from Sikasso, Loulouni, and villages near Loulouni. 

He is on his ninth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for better meeting the needs of his customer base, which is growing more and more. The previous loans were correctly paid back. 

This loan will enable him to purchase 70 sack of corn weighing 100 kg each and 5 sacks of millet weighing 100 kg each. After making his purchases, he stores the goods at home for a while and then resells them. Sales are made in Kaï to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash. 

He envisions making an average monthly profit  of 220,000 francs CFA. The profits will enable him to pay back the loan with interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Ms. Rani is a married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She, along with her husband, have been doing agriculture work for many years. They have crops of different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  They work very hard in growing the various crops by watering soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Rani applied a loan of PKR 50,000. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation

loans.use: To purchase seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Francisco Balmore

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 21 años de edad, vive en un cantón, estudió hasta sexto grado pues las dificultades  económicas no le permitieron continuar sus estudios, además se vio en la necesidad de ayudarle a su familia con los gastos del hogar, ahora está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender  pescado. Tiene un hijo de 3 años que aún no asiste a la escuela, y es el único que depende de él. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura, que es una de sus fuentes de ingresos, y también desde muy pequeño se dedica a la pesca,  todo esto lo aprendió de su padre. 
La pesca la realiza en la laguna que está cerca de su casa, permanece en ella por varias horas hasta lograr pescar una buena cantidad. 
El horario de pesca en ocasiones es de todo el día, su esposa se involucra en el negocio ya que ella va a vender en las comunidades cercanas el pescado obtenido.

Francisco necesita de este préstamo, para reparar la canoa que utiliza para ir a pescar ya que con el tiempo se ha dañado, comprará fibra para repararla, este trabajo lo realiza él mismo de igual forma reparara sus redes con la compra de hilo y plomo. La necesidad que cubrirá es de tener su equipo de pesca en buenas condiciones para realizar su trabajo 

Sus objetivos son, luchar para que a su familia no le falte nada, además planea hacer jaulas con redes en una parte de la laguna y poder cultivar ahí los peces necesarios para vender y de esta forma se le facilitará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 21 years old and lives in a Canton. He studied until Grade 6 but due to economic difficulties he couldn't continue his studies. Also he had the need to help his family with the household expenses. 

Now he is married and has a 3 year old son who does not yet go to school and is dependent on him. His wife sells fish. He works as a farmer and this is one of his sources of income. Also he has been fishing since he was young, something which his father taught him. He fishes in a lagoon close to their home. He spends a few hours there until he has caught a good amount. His fishing sometimes takes up the whole day. His wife is involved in the business as she sells the fish in the local communities.

Francisco needs a loan to repair the boat that he uses to go fishing as with time it has become damaged. He will buy fiberglass to repair it and he will do the work himself. He will also buy line and lead to repair his nets. The need he is filling is to have his fishing equipment in good condition so he can work. His goals are to make sure his family does not go without. He also plans to build cages using nets in part of the lagoon to farm fish to sell and by doing so make his work easier.

loans.use: to buy fiberglass to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 35 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo entonces él continua vendiendo en su ferretería en su domicilio donde vente diferentes productos como por ejemplo clavos, calaminas, alambres, pinturas y otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como alambres, techos de metal, clavos y otras cosas más. 

Porfirio pertenece  al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Huancarani and he is 35 years old. He is married and from that beautiful relationship has seven children. He is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead with much effort and work. He continues to sell in the hardware store he has in his house. He sells different types of products, such as nails, metal sheeting, wire, paint and more.  

At this time, he needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as wire, metallic roofs, nails and more.  

Porfirio belongs to the “Mamacha Rosario” credit group of the Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and he is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as wire, metallic roofs, nails and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Don José es originario de la ciudad de Granada, casado y padre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya independientes. Tiene 59 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con una pulpería pequeña que instalo en su casa, poco a poco fue incrementado sus productos y la pulpería fue creciendo hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es ofertar una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes potenciales. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Detergentes entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es aumentar el tamaño de su pulpería.
texts.en:
José, 59, is from the city of Granada. He is married and has three children, two of whom are independent. He is a vendor and has a grocery store business. He started this business with a small grocery store in his home. Little by little, he added products and the store grew to what it is today. His next goal is to offer a large variety of products to potential customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, and other products. He thinks this loan will be very helpful because he will be able to meet customer demand. His plan for the future is to increase the size of his store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong, 31, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by working in a local company while Hong earns a living running a general store. She started this business to generate income to cover her family expenses. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new stock for her store such as sugar, confectionery and soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers. Through the loan, she hopes she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy new stock for her store, such as sugar, confectionery and soft drinks.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
This group of two strong women includes Gladys, a woman of 54, a widow, with three grown children. For the past 21 years, her business has been the buying and selling of fish. She sells her fish in her community and the surrounding areas from house to house. She has been a client of the institution for two years and has demonstrated to be a person who is very responsible with her repayments. She needs the loan to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers. 

Matilda is a woman of 46 who sells kenkey (maize paste).

loans.use: To buy more fish, smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, sugar, cigarettes and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a new client of the institution, married and blessed with three children. He hails from Bugangari parish, Bugangari sub-county, Rukungiri district.
He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 which he needs to finish up his building.

Moses is a hard working man who is running a boda boda (store) business where he gets income to take care of his family. He has been doing this business for some good years. 

He has applied for a loan from this institution to get income to add in his business and also finish up his building. With this loan from UGAFODE, Moses is hopeful that his business will increase gradually. In the photo is Moses with the wife at the house to be completed.

loans.use: To finish his building.

loans.name: Cocuriga Grp A Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old and is a group leader; they formed the group to benefit from the agriculture loans. Vestine has been in her business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her farming. All the group members practice the same rice farming in the same area. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Kantome

texts.fr: Madame Kantome est une femme célibataire qui habite dans le meme quartier que le guichet, c’est un client du guichet et elle est à son 2ème prêt et demande celui-ci pour acheter des chaussures et des pièces détachés destinés à la vente. Elle a comme charge particulière les dépenses quotidiennes de sa mère et son père qui sont devenus vieux. Elle a une expérience de 4ans et évolue dans la commercialisation des chaussures et pièces détachées. KANTOME quitte sa maison à 9h pour y revenir le soir vers les coûts de 19h 30. Elle souhaite ouvrir d’autres points de vente et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: Kantome is a single woman who lives in the same district as her branch. She is one of the branch's customers and is on her second loan with which she will buy shoes and spare parts for resale. She has specific responsibility for her elderly parents' daily expenses. She has four years' experience in her business selling shoes and spare parts. Kantome leaves her house at 9 o'clock in the morning and returns home at 7 o'clock in the evening. She would like to open other sales points and diversify her product base.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Ame Diom Group

texts.fr: L’association AME DIOM regroupe un nombre de 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles font la même activité. Leur président Madame NDIEME est celle qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est dans l’activité de la pêche et demande ce montant pour acheter des caisses de poisson dans les pirogues et les revend sur la marché local. Il est marié et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et les frais scolaires. Elle a une expérience de plus de 8 ans dans cette activité et quitte sa maison à 8h pour y revenir le soir à 18 h.  Elle veut plus d’autonomie financière.
texts.en: The Ame Diom association is made up of five people who all live in the same district and exercise the same activity. Their president, Ndieme, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has a fish selling business and is requesting this amount to buy crates of fish in the pirogues to resell in the local market. She is married and a mother, and she helps her husband out with the family's expenses and school fees. She has more than eight years' experience in this business and leaves her house at 8 o'clock in the morning, returning home at 6 o'clock in the evening. She would like to have more financial independence.

loans.use: to buy and sell crates of fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Cocuriga Grp 2 Group

texts.en:
Valentine is aged 30. She is a mother of two and they all go to school. Valentine is a group leader and she has been in the business for the past seven years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy more fertilizers in order to increase their production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a more soap, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is an old client at the branch. He is married with three children and two are attending elementary school. He has been a teacher for three years; he also operates a retail business as a source of additional income.

He has been taking loans which have enabled him to sustain his business and he is taking this loan to buy a piece of land and add capital (buying cattle) to his business.

Therefore Richard praises UGAFODE for the financial assistance which has improved his standards of living.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and buy cattle.

loans.name: Ngalele Group

texts.fr: NGALELE est un regroupe de 5 personnes qui habitent la même maison et sont des sœurs unies. La présidente s’appelle Amsatou et c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans l’achat et la vente de parfums et produits divers. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et  les frais scolaires  de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et comme sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Amsatou souhaite à l’avenir augmenter  ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer  les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ngalele is a group of five people who all live in the same house and are close sisters. The president is called Amsatou and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has been building up a business buying and selling perfumes and other products. She is married and a mother and helps out her husband with the daily expenses and their children's school fees. She has more than five years' experience in her business and her day begins at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 8 o'clock in the evening. In the future Amsatou would like to increase her income so that she is able to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell perfumes.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store and pay for her children's school fees. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of food and beverages to restock her store and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Fatou Poulo

texts.fr: Fatou Poulo est une femme âgée de 56ans qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans la commercialisation des caisses en plastique que les commerçants utilisent pour conserver les poissons frais. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Fatou Poulo a une expérience de 30 ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 500.000F pour renforcer son fond de commerce et augmenter sa marchandise. A l’avenir elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Fatou Poulo is a 56-year old woman who is married and a mother. She buys and sells plastic crates that traders use to conserve fresh fish. She helps out her husband with the daily expenses. She begins her day at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 7 o'clock in the evening. Fatou Poulo has more than 30 years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 500,000FCFA to reinforce her capital and increase her stock. In the future she would like  to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic crates which she resells to fish traders to conserve their fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en:
Sarapio is a 46-year-old man married with one wife and has 8 children. He operates a small business of cattle farming around Omukitembe, Kichwamba – Rukungiri District. He started business in the year 2000 to raise money to support his family.
However, he has faced numerous challenges in this business, like prolonged drought, which has dried all the green grass around thus affecting his cows, and competition from other cattle keepers.
He approached UGAFODE micro finance limited Rukungiri branch for a loan to improve his business by buying more cows that he will fatten and later sell at a profit. He hopes to expand by adding more cows to his existing farm.
He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva for the financial support given to him.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 55-year-old man married with one wife and three children. He deals in the cattle fattening business in Rukungiri district. He started this business to raise money to support his family.
However, he has faced numerous challenges in this business, like stiff competition from cattle keepers around Rukungiri district, and drought, which dries the vegetations thus affecting his business.
He approached UGAFODE micro finance limited for a loan facility which will help him to buy young bulls that will help him to develop and improve on his business.
He has a dream of putting a ranch around Rukungiri.
He appreciates the financial support given to him by UGAFODE and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Deisy Mayerli

texts.es:
Mayerli es una joven que creció llevando una vida normal, pero lastimosamente sin el padre al lado, ya que la madre lo dejo por culpa de problemas, en el hogar tuvieron bastantes problemas, pero días después el hombre deicidio buscar ayuda e ir alcohólicos anónimos, un lugar donde ayudan a las personas que tienen problemas con el alcohol, fue así como este hombre dejo de consumir bebidas alcohólicas.
El padre siempre fue muy responsable y quiso quitarle la custodia de Mayerli a la madre, después de varios procesos legales a Mayerli la pusieron a decidir con cual de los dos se quería quedar, Mayerli  decidió quedarse con el padre quien le dio la educación básica primaria, después de un tiempo Mayerli  decidió irse con la madre, ya que en la casa donde vivía con los tíos, abuela, primos, no le brindaban la suficiente atención que ella necesitaba  y quería, muchas veces recibiendo la poca alimentación que querían darle.
Ya tomada la decisión culmino los estudios de bachillerato al lado de la madre, la cual trabajaba como vendedora de rosas en discotecas los fines de semana; mientras ella hacia esta labor Mayerli se encargaba de trabajar  vendiendo cigarrillos, dulces, minutos, La joven después de terminar decidió iniciar una carrera contando siempre con la ayuda del padre, pero todo se vio afectado cuando el padre en un mismo año tuvo tres accidentes, el ultimo dejándolo incapacitado de la rodilla izquierda sin poder seguir ayudando a la hija y haciendo trámites para lograr la pensión, pero fue un tiempo extremadamente largo, tiempo en el cual no daba espera el estudio de Mayerli quien tuvo que retirase faltándo dos semestres. 
Mayerli y la madre continuaron trabajando fuertemente para reunir el dinero que necesitaba para continuar con la carrera, pero nuevamente el destino les jugaba una mala pasada, cuando Mayerli se encontraba laborando en una panadería recibió una llamada de una amiga que a la madre la habían robado, peor robaron fue su lugar de residencia, los dejaron sin nada, les robaron electrodomésticos y dinero que la madre con mucho  esfuerzo tenia ahorrado. 
Nuevamente  volvieron a levantarse, continuaron con la vida y trabajando para tratar de recuperar poco a poco las cosas, Mayerli vio agotadas las posibilidades de terminar la carrera.
La joven empezó a trabajar en un almacén de ropa y como Mayerli siempre ha sido una mujer a la cual le gusta estudiar no desaprovechaba ciertos cursos gratuitos  que se le presentaban unos de esos fue primeros auxilios y salud ocupacional, cursos que la hicieron interesarse en el campo de la salud. Cierta ocasión estaba trabajando recibió un volante de campo alto donde habían varias ofertas de estudio, entre ellos servicios farmacéuticos por el cual se interesó, llamo y le brindaron la información pertinente del programa, ya que en la mentalidad tiene como expectativa y proyecto de vida tener una carrera, comenzar a laborar, tener la propia vivienda, el propio negocio y tener una familia a la cual le pueda brindar una vida digna y porque no ofrecerle a los hijos lo que ella no tuvo.
Por esto Mayerli  quiere contar con  el subsidio de kiva para hacer todos los sueños realidad y demostrar que los sueños si se pueden cumplir cuando hay entrega y perseverancia.
texts.en:
Mayerli is a young woman who grew up in a normal life, but unfortunately she didn't have her father by her side. Her mother left him because of problems. They had a lot of problems in the home, but days later he decided to seek help with Alcoholics Anonymous, a place that helps people with alcohol problems. That is how he stopped drinking.  

Her father was very responsible and wanted to have custody of Mayerli instead of her mother. After several legal proceedings it was left up to Mayerli to decide which parent she wanted to live with. Mayerli decided to stay with her father and he provided her with a primary education. After a time, Mayerli  decided to go live with her mother, since in the house where she lived there were also aunts and uncles, her grandmother and cousins living there and she didn't get the attention she needed and wanted. Often, she would get what little food they wanted to give her. 

Once she decided, she finished high school at her mother's side. Her mother worked selling roses in dance clubs on weekends. While she did this, Mayerli would sell cigarettes, candies, and phone cards. After finishing school she decided to start a major with her father's help. However, everything was affected when her father had three accidents that same year. The last one left him disabled in his left knee, unable to help his daughter, and in the process of being able to pay tuition. However, it took an extremely long time and Mayerli's studies wouldn't wait, and she had to withdraw after two semesters. 
 
Mayerli and her mother continued working hard to get the money she needed to continue studying her major, but fate again played a dirty trick on them. Mayerli was working at a bread bakery when she got a call from a friend who told her her mother had been robbed of everything. What's worse is that they robbed the house and left them with nothing. They stole their appliances and money that her mother had saved with so much hard work.

They picked themselves up again and went on with their lives, working to try and recover their things little by little. Mayerli thought the possibility that she could finish her major was gone. She started to work in a clothing store. Since Mayerli has always been a woman who liked to learn she took advantage of free courses offered in first aid and occupational health. These courses got her interested in the area of health. On one occasion she was working and she received a flyer from Campo Alto, where they offered several areas of study, among them pharmacology. She became interested and she called. They gave her information related to the program. She expects and has as a life project to get a college education, start to work, have her own home, her own business and have a family to whom she will be able to offer a dignified life and why not, offer her children what she didn't have.

That is why Mayerli wants to have the Kiva subsidy to make her dreams come true and show that dreams can come true when there is dedication and perseverance.

loans.use: to pay to register for a semester.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est une femme âgée de 49 qui vit avec sa famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et vend aussi des beignets. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'ainé âgé de 25 ans et le plus petit a 5 ans. Aminata aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité des ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 26 ans dans ce domaine. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 500.000F pour acheter des tissus qu’elle revend et du mil pour préparer les beignets. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle souhaite avoir plus de confort avec sa famille.
texts.en: Aminata is a 49-year old woman who lives with her family. She buys and sells fabrics and also fritters. She is married and a mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old and the youngest five. Aminata helps out her husband with the daily expenses and their children's school fees. She has more than 26 years' experience in her field and is requesting a loan of 500,000FCFA to buy fabrics which she will resell and millet to make fritters. Her day begins at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 7 o'clock in the evening. In the future she would like her family to have more comforts.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, as well as sugar and millet to prepare fritters that she resells to her customers.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette est une femme qui habite dans la commune, âgée de 35 ans elle est marié et mère de famille. Elle est à son 2ème prêt. Elle vend le petit déjeuner dans une gargote et ça depuis plus de 6 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 12h. Maguette a une expérience de plus de 6 ans dans cette activité. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter du sucre, café, etc. pour la vente de son petit déjeuner. Elle n’a pas de charge particulière car son mari prend en charge les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Maguette is a 35-year old woman who is married and a mother, and she lives in the municipality. She is on her second loan. She sells breakfasts in a café and has been doing this for more than six years. She begins her day at 7 o'clock in the moring and finishes at midday. Maguette has more than six years' experience in this business. She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, coffee, etc. for the breakfasts she sells. She does not have any particular expenses as her husband covers the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products such as milk, sugar and coffee to be able to prepare breakfasts that she sells in her café.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima -Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia Segundina pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSA DE LIMA - URUBAMBA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Segundina tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 06 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picanteria a la vez vende chicha de jora y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la carpinteria, limpieza. venta de comida, venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
Segundina belongs to the SANTA ROSA DE LIMA - URUBAMBA communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba,   department of Cuzco.

Segundina is 49 years old. She has 6 children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling food. She also sells chicha de jora and raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and more. she has had her business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working so that in this way she can keep supporting her family.   

She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments. 

The other members work in carpentry, cleaning, selling food and selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
This is the "Universal" loan group and it consists of four women who are responsible mothers with six children, in total, in their care. They are originally from the coastal region of the country. They are characterized as hardworking and responsible, and have the will for personal achievement. They strive day after day to offer a better future to their children.

Members of the group sell plantains, diapers, fish and second-hand clothing. Bernice is the representative of the group and she has been selling second-hand clothing for eight years. She works at the main market from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying grade one second-hand clothing to sell to customers. Bernice is standing on the right in the photograph, and she is married with two children.

loans.use: to buy grade one second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. She describes herself to be creative and she operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to reach higher heights within five years and she hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, thread and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man and has 1 child. He describes himself as being energetic and hardworking. 

Joseph operates a carpentry business where he makes wooden chairs, tables, beds and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenges to be theft and lack of funds. Joseph will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to be most successful within 5 years. Joseph hopes that in the future he will achieve his business goals. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 1 year and 4 years. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Monsieur OUMAR est un jeune homme âgé de 24 ans, il est célibataire sans enfants. Il est à son 1er prêt et demande celui-ci pour acheter des prêts à porter qu’il revend dans le marché.  Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 14h de l’après midi. Il a comme charges particulières les dépenses quotidiennes de ses parents qui sont en retraite. Oumar vient de commencer cette activité avec seulement 02 ans d’expérience. Il voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution ouvrir un grand magasin dans le marché pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et ensuite diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: Oumar is a 24-year old man who is single with no children. He is on his first loan which is requesting to buy ready-to-wear clothing which he resells in the market. He begins his day at 6 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. His specific responsibility is his parents' daily expenses, since they are retired. Oumar has just started this business and only has two years' experience. With the help of the institution  he would like to open a large store in the maret to increase his income and then diversify his product base.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for men and women to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material to expand her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 30 years old and a married women. She has four children. She is running a business of making sweets with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She is very hard working lady. She supports her husband and family. 

She is in 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. Now she requested a loan for the amount of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase stock of sugar, oil, and dry fruits from the market so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, oil, and dry fruits.

loans.name: Ayitcheme 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEME 6 est composé de trente – six personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Anasthasie(est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo)âgée de 32 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Anasthasie est célibataire avec un enfant scolarisé à sa charge. Anasthasie vit seule avec son enfant. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Anasthasie. Pour ce faire, Anasthasie vend  depuis quatre ans des mèches et des produits cosmétiques par la technique de distribution. Anasthasie est aussi une enseignante, activité qu'elle exerce de façon. Anasthasie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Anasthasie ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEME 6 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Ayitcheme 6 group is made up of 36 people who live in the same district. The representative of this group, by the name of Anasthasie (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 32 years old and went to school until high school. With the goal of increasing their level of business in order to better cope with the demand from their clientele, this group is asking for financial support from ALIDé for the first time. Anasthasie is single, with a child in school in her care. Anasthasie lives alone with her child. The various expenses of the family are borne by Anasthasie. In order to do this, Anasthasie has sold hair extensions and cosmetic products through the distribution technique for four years. Anasthasie is also a teacher, an activity that she practices after a fashion. Anasthasie stocks up in the market of Benin. With the goal of increasing the level of her business and satisfying her clientele, Anasthasie, together with the other members of the Ayitcheme 6 group, is asking for a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr: SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR est un groupement composé de 15 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et pratique le même métier. Leur présidente s’appelle Rokhaya, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans l’achat et la vente de poissons frais. Âgée de 44ans, Rokhaya est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a comme charges particulières les propres besoins et est pris en charge par son mari qui le soutient dans tous les cotés. Elle a une expérience de 4 ans dans la vente de poisson et demande ce prêt pour renforcer son fond de roulement  pour mieux satisfaire ses clients avec des produits de qualité. Rokhaya commence sa journée à 7h pour revenir à la maison à 19h. Elle souhaite devenir avec l’aide de l’institution autonome sur le plan financier.
texts.en: Sope Serigne Babacar is a group of 15 people who all live in the same district and have the same profession. Their president is called Rokhaya and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has a business buying and selling fresh fish. She is 44 years old, married and a mother. The only specific expenses she has relate to her personal needs, as her husband covers the rest of the expenses. She has four years' experience of selling fish and is requesting this loan to increase her working capital so that she can satisfy her customers with better quality products. Rokhaya begins her day at 7 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 7 o'clock in the evening. With the aid of the institution she would like to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy and sell fresh fish in the municipal market.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.en:
Marianella is a Peruvian artisan who knits and crochets trendy fashion accessories. She hopes to stock up on alpaca wool, silk and cotton for her designs. Marianella has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"You could say my passion for the textile arts runs in the family! One of the reasons I enjoy this art form is that it relaxes me. My designs mirror the convergence of different cultures and traditions, since my mother is from Trujillo and my father from Huancavelica. My life's journey has taken me down the path of education, and now I also teach. I love creating innovative models and new trends! Thank you! With this microcredit, I plan to invest in materials to create a good supply of items in stock and be able to sell more of my  designs."

Use the link below to view Marianella's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5210

loans.use: to stock up on alpaca wool, silk and cotton for her designs

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Ella es marcela  quien es alumna de segundo semestre en la carrera de servicios farmacéuticos de campo alto.
Ella esta  muy interesada pro concluir los estudios satisfactoriamente, pero por su situación económica se le dificulta poder seguir cubriendo con el pago total de las cuotas mensuales, por eso ella quiere se beneficiara del convenio de kiva.
Es una alumna con un buen desempeño académico, con muchas metas pendientes por desarrollar, como mujer y como profesional, el mayor interés es concluir los estudios y ser una digna representante de la profesión y a si poderle brindar bienestar y tranquilidad a la familia.
texts.en:
Marcela is in her 2nd semester of pharmacy at Campo Alto.

She's hoping to finish her studies in a satisfactory manner, but her financial situation makes it difficult for her to continue covering her monthly payments. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

She is a student with good academic standing who has many goals to reach as a woman and as a professional. Her main goal is to finish her studies and be a dignified representative of this profession in order to offer her family tranquility and well-being.

loans.use: pay a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Modeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MODEB est composé de vingt-deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Edith (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) âgée de 49 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Edith est mariée à un certain Specor. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont assumées par Edith et son mari. C'est pour cette raison que Edith vend des tissus et des colliers par la méthode de distribution depuis une dizaine d’années. Edith s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre son fond de roulement et le niveau de son activité, Edith ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MODEB sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Modeb group is made up of 22 people who live in the same district. The representative of this group, whose name is Edith (she is the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 49 years old and attended school up until secondary level. With a view to expanding their business volume and meeting their customer demand more easily, this group is requesting a first loan from Alidé. 

Edith is married to a man called Specor. The couple has two children, who are both at school and in their care. Edith lives with her husband and children, and she and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. To this end Edith has been selling fabrics and necklaces through the distribution chain for the past ten years or so. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With the aim of increasing her working capital and business volume, Edith is, together with the other members of the Modeb group, requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room for the purpose of raising chickens.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with 10 children, and seven of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister-in-law and her children). She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more  bunches of green bananas, beef, cowpeas, beans, Irish potatoes, yams and rice. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from a retail shop and also selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to educate her remaining children up to university. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Herr monthly expenses includes school fees, medication and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, cowpeas, beans, Irish potatoes, yams, beef and rice.

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Luz Carlota alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones,chompas,polos,casacas y blusas,  el negocio de la ropa lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, casacas y polos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Carlota divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes. She sells trousers, sweaters, pullover shirts, jackets, and blouses. Luz sells clothes as a traveling vendor. Through her small business, she is able to help her children get ahead.

Luz Carlota wants to expand her clothing sales business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy trousers, blouses, jackets, and pullover shirts in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, jackets, and pullover shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more perfume, soap and body wash cream for resale.

loans.name: Pavan

texts.en:
Pavan came to the U.S. from India six years ago looking for more opportunities for professional growth. Pavan had always wanted to start his own business, and when a friend told him that he was going to purchase a Subway franchise, Pavan thought he would do the same.

He bought a Subway franchise in January 2013 and is now not only serving food out of the store but also offering catering services to local schools, colleges, and businesses. Though he has experienced considerable success in his first year as a Subway franchisee, Pavan has had difficulty getting working capital.

With this loan, Pavan will pay for advertising material, payroll, and inventory.

Help this entrepreneur and support this small business by contributing to his loan goal.

loans.use: to pay for advertising material, payroll, and inventory.

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial members who are into the sale of yams, and other items. Doris is 51 years old, and married with two children in her care. She has been selling yams for 10 years. She has been a member of the institution for three years and has proven to be a very responsible client with her repayments. She is asking for a loan of 1,400 GHS to purchase yams to sell to customers. She is standing on the left in the photograph.

Other members of the group include Abban who is 60 years old and sells soft drinks, and Naomi who is 56 years old and sells fish. Together with Doris, they need a total amount of 3,700 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase yams to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, fish, flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, biscuits, sugar, Ovaltine and drinks for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been doing this for 10 years. She applied for a loan of 2,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for charcoal. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, soap, milk and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Las Misioneras Group

texts.en:
About four years ago in Northern Guatemala, in a town called Santa Cruz del Quiche, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Misioneras,” meaning “The Missionaries,” was formed. The group consists of eight women who are on average, 43 years old. The women share a common goal to improve the standard of living for their families and create a better future for their children. They work in various commercial ventures including the sale of clothing, manufacturing and sale of textiles, as well as selling foods like fruit and tortillas.

Each Friendship Bridge Trust Bank has officers and a board of directors. The current President of Las Misioneras is 44-year-old Candelaria who is married with four children. She is most dedicated to her children and their success. Two of them have graduated from high school and another child will graduate this year. Her last child is in the 7th grade. Candelaria, along with the women in her Trust Bank, realize that education is a vital key to a successful future for the children.

Candelaria has been a member of the Trust Bank since the beginning. Her previous loans have positively impacted her bakery business. Recently she began to sell “refacciones,” which are snacks. Candelaria is requesting a new loan and will use the funds to purchase a refrigerator and additional items for food preparation. She sells her snacks during the week at a school in her community, beginning at 9:00 in the morning. When school is not in session and the children are on vacation, Candelaria makes banana bread to sell in the community.

Along with the fellow members of her Trust Bank, Candelaria is most grateful for the funds generously donated by KIVA lenders and administered by Friendship Bridge. The women are able to maintain and increase their businesses. They also benefit from the monthly trainings on subjects like business administration and indebtedness, nutrition and health, as well as self-esteem. The combination of the loans and education is a winning one for these women who are able to step into a more empowered future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of Santa Cruz del Quiche.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and additional items for food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron and sand, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and food to run a poultry-raising activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén es un joven abogado de 35 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia, es el último de siete hermanos y vive con su mamá que depende enteramente de él. Estudió en la Universidad Pública del Alto.
Rubén trabaja como auxiliar legal en la Fiscalía Departamental de La Paz, sus ingresos son el sustento de su hogar y tiene la inquietud de seguir estudiando y actualizando sus conocimientos por ello solicitó un crédito educativo para cursar la Maestría en Ciencias Penales y Forenses.
Rubén indica que con los conocimientos adquiridos durante su maestría podrá mejorar su desempeño laboral y mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño, en el ámbito profesional, es alcanzar un alto cargo ya sea en una institución pública o privada y en lo personal conformar una familia y brindarles condiciones adecuadas de vida.
Rubén da las gracias a las personas que le dan la oportunidad de alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rubén is a 35-year-old lawyer. He was born in La Paz, Bolivia. He is the youngest of seven brothers and lives with his mother, who depends on him entirely. He studied at the public university in the city of El Alto (Universidad Pública de El Alto).

Rubén works as a legal aide in the District Attorney's office of La Paz and his income supports the household. He would like to continue studying and updating his knowledge, so he is requesting a loan to study his Master's in Forensic Science and Criminology.

Rubén tells us that all the knowledge he'll learn earning his Master's will help him improve his job performance and increase his income. His dream, in the professional realm, is to reach an important position either in a public or private institution; in the personal realm, he hopes to make his family happy by offering them a good quality of life.

Rubén is thankful to those who give him the opportunity to realize his dreams.

loans.use: pay for his Master's degree in Forensic Science and Criminology.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province, Chanthorn, age 40, is married and the mother of four children. To deal with her family’s hardship, she grows rice as their main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Nowadays, she is able to earn up to 24,600 riels per day. 

Chanthorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle with successful repayment which has enabled her to make her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she formed a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy wooden boards to renovate her house and fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Florentina, la socia continua dedicándose a la preparación y venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sra. Florentina continues to prepare and sell food at one of the markets in the city of Cusco.
