She has been in this business for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Florentina is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that her family can get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as meats, vegetables, and other items. Florentina is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meats, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant donde prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,sopas y saltados de carne,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha continues to manage her business of selling food. She has a restaurant where she prepares different dishes such as roasted chicken, soups, and stir-fried beef. Bertha works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Bertha dreams of expanding her restaurant.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, chicken, and beef. Bertha is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 42-year-old woman. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s brother, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 2 years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000, for her brother. He wants to buy new tires and spare parts for his vehicle for maintaining the vehicle in good order. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her brother and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for her brother's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products, like brooms, buckets and kitchen items.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Quiche Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres del Valor Quiche,” meaning “Quiche Women of Worth,” is located in Northwest Guatemala in Santa Cruz del Quiche.The women proudly call themselves this because they value their strength and perseverance. 

Celestina is a young 26-year-old single woman who is a member of the Trust Bank. She learned to weave and embroider when she was a child. Approximately one year ago, she decided to open her own small store where she sells aprons, called “delantales,” that she and one of her sisters make. The aprons are quite popular in her town and can be very elaborate, filled with beautiful embroidery and trim. Celestina also sells baby clothing, gifts, toys and many other things. She feels committed to supporting her family and providing income. She has eight siblings. This hardworking, young woman is requesting a new loan to purchase colorful fabrics to make additional aprons. She also wants to stock additional baby clothing. Finally, Celestina is thinking of selling the traditional skirts used by the indigenous women in Guatemala called “cortes.” They come in many colors and sizes.

Celestina is most grateful for the financial support provided by KIVA lenders as this not only gives her working capital but also other opportunities as well. Friendship Bridge offers monthly trainings for Celestina and her friends in the Trust Bank with their Microcredit Plus Program, a most useful combination of financial capital and education. In this way, Celestina and her fellow Trust Bank members face a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community. It is truly a “win-win” situation!

loans.use: to purchase colorful fabrics to make additional aprons.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas se dedica a la venta de comestibles pues tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella también ahora se está dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos.  
En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo aceite, fideos, golosinas, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Felicitas sells groceries. She has a tiny grocery store in her home. She's been running this business for many years and it's been going well thanks to all the determination she puts into her work. She's also just now dedicating herself to breeding small animals, like guinea pigs and pigs.

She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise, like oil, noodles, candies, bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice and other things.

loans.use: buy more merchandise, like oil, noodles, candies, bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice and other things.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Chipuac Group

texts.en:
This energetic Friendship Bridge Trust Bank was established five years ago in a rural village of Totonicapan, Guatemala. There are eight businesswomen in the group who are mostly involved in the cultivation of corn as well as the manufacturing of textiles, mostly the traditional skirts called “cortes.” Most of the ladies have only had two years of education. The average number of children that they have is three.

The current President of the Trust Bank is 29-year-old Julia. She has had four years of formal education and is raising three children. Many women in the group are weavers and Julia is one as well. She fabricates textiles and is requesting a new loan to purchase thread and other materials in order to produce more textiles. 

Julia possesses an outstanding leadership skill. She shares that her group is very responsible, punctual and supportive. She adds that during the five years that she has been involved in the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Program, her business has grown. Her production and sales have increased as well. Friendship Bridge provides useful monthly trainings to clients and Julia and her fellow Trust Bank members have learned a lot about topics like hygiene and health, natural medicines, empowerment, self-esteem, children and women’s rights. This component of the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus Program contributes greatly to their personal growth. 

On behalf of “Las Rosas de Chipuac” Trust Bank, Julia thanks KIVA lenders who believe in their efforts and work, and fund their loans. This means so much to the women as they can be productive and empowered. They are able to contribute to the economy of their household and the local development of their town. It is a wonderful win-win situation!

loans.use: to purchase thread and other materials to produce more textiles.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria  se dedica a su negocio de ropa y calzado y su esposo es jubilado, tiene bajo su  cargo a un hijo que muy pronto ingresara a la universidad, los otros ya son independientes pero habitan en casa de su madre. Gloria solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar divisiones de cuartos para la comodidad de sus hijos en su humilde hogar.
texts.en: Gloria sells clothing and shoes. Her husband is retired. She has a son who is under her care and who will enter university very soon, the other children are independent, but also live in her house. Gloria is requesting this loan to buy construction materials in order to construct separate rooms so she can accommodate her children in her humble home.

loans.use: buy blocks, cement, metal, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en: Davy, 25, is a married mother of one son who still under her take care. She is a borrower from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To feed her family, she plants cassava on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for five years and it earns her about ten dollars per day. Now, she is the leader of a group composing of two women. Both of them are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they successfully repaid the original loan. For Davy, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to gain a good income, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava.

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en:
Pon is 37 years old and a mother of two kids who are in school. For the sake of her kids, she solely counts on her rice farming and cassava planting. 

She has been farming for more than ten years, and currently it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Pon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a good pace. 

Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sakhoeurn

texts.en:
Sakhoeurn is a resident from Sreysnom district of Siem Riep province. She is 32 year-old and also a mother of two kids who are too young for schooling.

To make a living, she farms rice as her main source of income and plants cassava for additional income. She has been in this business for 14 years and it earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle loans for her with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has completely paid back, has improved her family’s livelihood. Now, she is applying for a loan amount of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops. She hopes her current business will produce a good yield for her to make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kolab's Group

texts.en:
Kolab is a villager from Sreysnom district of Siem Riep province. She is a 29 year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school and the other of whom is too young for school.

To provide daily decent food for her family, she and her husband grow rice and cassava as their main source of income. She has been in this business for 11 years and it earns her around 29,200 KHR. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loans which she has repaid completely. The positive impact of her loan has helped her to support her business. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield--even better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chek's Group

texts.en:
A 43 year-old mother of five children, originally from the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham province, Chek works on two and half hectares of rice farmland for her family's survival. She works with the support of her husband who also spares his time to works for others for a fee to earn additional income.

Having been with this business for 20 years, Chek is able to earn about 38,600 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. Chek is the the leader of a group of two. She is a sixth-time borrower, and her co-member is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her past loans with success and it has helped her to timely support her cash crop.

Now, both of them are seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her portion to pay harvesting fees for her crop. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 cows and to make adjustments to the corral and fences

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
William de 26 años de edad,  es un joven trabajador, trabaja como albañil. Logro estudiar bachillerato, por no contar con los recursos económicos suficientes, no pudo seguir los estudios universitarios; pero esto  no se ha significado una limitante, se empeñó en aprender un oficio que le permitiera valerse por si mismo. Esta acompañado y su señora  tiene un pequeño cafetin en una escuela del cantón. Su hijo tiene 5 años y está asistiendo al kinder. 


la albañilería la desempeña desde hace 7 años, pero este oficio es temporal, porque solo es cuando surge la oportunidad de alguna obra de construcción. En ocasiones ha tenido que viajar a lugares bastante lejos de su hogar para aprovechar trabajos de albañilería que surgen.  El trabajo que es más fijo es el de atender el negocio que tiene con su señora en la escuela (cafetin), en este negocio venden frutas, golosinas, licuados de frutas, bebidas, útiles escolares, entre otros productos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para surtir  la pequeña tienda (cafetin), ya que se acerca la época escolar y tienen que abastecer el negocio, haciendo una gran inversión, aprovechando la gran demanda que presentan, siendo esta una oportunidad para la obtención de mejores ingresos que llegaran para su familia.
 
Su sueño es que  su negocio sea permanente, no solamente en la época escolar como lo es en la actualidad,  sino  tener una tienda cerca de su casa que le genere los recursos suficiente para mantener a su familia, que su hijo pueda crecer , tener salud, la educación  adecuada  y pueda formarse como buen profesional.
texts.en:
William is 26 years old and a young man who works as a mason.  He started studying for a bachelor’s degree but was not able to continue his university studies due to a lack of resources. This has not meant a limit for him and he decided to learn a trade where he could feel valuable.  He is married and his wife has a small coffee stand.  His son is five years old and attends kindergarten.

He has been a mason for seven years but this is temporary whenever a construction opportunity arises.  At times he has had to travel to faraway places to take advantage of masonry work opportunities. The more steady work comes from tending the business he has with his wife in the school (coffee stand), where they sell fruit, snacks, fruit smoothies, beverages, school supplies, and other things.

He is asking for this loan to stock the small stand, now that the school years is approaching and they need to stock the business by making a big investment so they can take advantage of the big demand.  This will be an opportunity for better income for his family.

His dream is for his business to be permanent, not just during the school year, like today, but by having a store near his home that will generate enough resources to support his family, for his son to grow up, be healthy, have good schooling, and become a good professional.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer lives in Antaramut village with her husband and 5 children. Her eldest son is 19 years old and currently serves in the army. Varditer and her husband are involved in agriculture. They have small but beautiful farm that includes 5 cows, 5 calves, 5 chickens and a plot of land. Varditer also cultivates potatoes and grows nut, apple, and pear trees.

Varditer applied for this loan as she has no financial means for purchasing forage for the livestock. The family's costs don’t allow her to purchase it by her own means and she has decided to ask for help from Kiva lenders. 

Varditer will be very grateful to lenders for their goodwill and she hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Ikhtar

texts.en:
Ms. Ikhtar is 32 years old and has been doing the business of scrap for many years now. She buys pop bottles like Pepsi, Coke, Miranda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) or other similar bottles in scrap. After properly crushing and recycling these bottles she sells them to the people of her community. Through her business she makes enough income to contribute to the family income.

She has six children; four of them are school-going and she hardly manages to satisfy their needs. She is liable to provide them with good food, health, and education so she requires earning more income to support her family well. 

She is in 8th loan cycle with Kashf foundation and she requested a loan of Rs. 45, 000 to buy more bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales. She expects to boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao, 40, is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province where her cassava is grown and her pig-raising business is run. She has two dependents to support; one in school and one is too young for school. The business that she has had for more than 20 years has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is the first time loan for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to support her cassava business. She hopes that she can gain a better income with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To support her cassava business

loans.name: Sida's Group

texts.en:
Sida is a mother of two children and is in her late 40s. She is a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.

To make a living, she farms rice and cassava as her main source of income. She has been in this business for ages and it earms her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Solida with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan with success and used it to improve her standard of living. For this cycle she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plants

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Nen is 36 years old and a mother of three kids. She is living in Kampong Cham province, where she grows cassava and rice. This business has returned her about 24,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

It is the third loan for Nen and her joint borrower in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loans has enabled her to provide sufficient food for her kids. Now, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the leasing fee of 1 hectare of cassava farmland. She hopes to grow more cassava in a timely manner with a good yield in return.

loans.use: To pay for the leasing fee of 1 hectare of cassava farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat, 47, is from a rural village located in the Chul Kirey district of Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with five children: two daughter and three sons. Currently, four of them still count on her as three kids are in school and one is too young for school.

Khat is a farmer who grows paddy rice and lotus as the main source of her family’s income. Khat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for past two loan cycles and has completely paid back the past loans already. These loans have helped her to improve her living conditions. For this cycle, she wants to support her son’s education instead of her business. Therefore, she applies for education loan to cover the tuition fees of her son who wants to continue the university degree majoring in Nursing. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To cover her son's the tuition fees

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Saumnea

texts.en:
Saumnea, 43, is from a rural village in the Ou Chrov district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is married and blessed with four children, one of whom still relies on her and is in school. To struggle for a living, she runs a small garage to fix cars as her main source of income. It is the business that she has been with for four years.

Besides the business that she needs to focus on, she wants to pay attention in her son’s studies as well. Therefore, she has applied for an education loan as a first time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to cover tuition fees as well as to buy school materials for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees as well as to buy school materials for her son

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Geraldine Cristina

texts.es:
Geraldine, está  culminando   los  estudios  de  secundaria  pero  ha decidido iniciar  estudios  relacionados con la salud.

Ella desde que era niña tiene el deseo de estudiar medicina, es por esta razón que ha decidido dar este pequeño  paso  para    así  adquirir  conocimiento, desea que  en   esta  decisión que  ha  tomado   sea la  mejor,  para  motivarse  y  llenarse  de  fuerzas  para continuar  cumpliendo  con  los  objetivos  y  así  alcanzar   la  meta  principal,  ser un  gran  ser  humano  y  un  excelente  médico.

Ya  que  esta  es  la  pasión,  en  el  futuro  desea  auxiliar   a  las  personas  que lo  necesitan, crecer  como  ser  humano,  sin  dejar  a  un  lado  lo  que  es,  y olvidando  a   aquellas   personas  que  la  ayudaron para  alcanzar  este  pequeño paso,  en  donde  va  a  adquirir  conocimientos  que  en  un  futuro  no  muy  lejano  le  brinden  la  posibilidad   de  ser  la  mejor  en  la  carrera  en  lo  que decidió  desde  que  era  muy  niña.

En  el  futuro  otra  de  las  grandes  metas  es  continuar  estudiando  para  así especializarse  en  pediatría   y  así  conseguir  alcanzar  más  metas  y  sueños que  aunque  no  es  fácil  tan  poco  será  difícil  ya  que  mientras  en  ella  habite el  deseo  de  surgir  y  crecer  cada  día  más  lograra  los  objetivos  y  lograra ser  lo  que  quiere. 

Ella desea el convenio con kiva ya que es una persona que quiere salir adelante y el dinero que se pueda ahorrar en el pago completo del semestre, lo puede utilizar para otros gastos que tenga en la vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Geraldine, está  culminando   los  estudios  de  secundaria  pero  ha decidido iniciar  estudios  relacionados con la salud.

Ella desde que era niña tiene el deseo de estudiar medicina, es por esta razón que ha decidido dar este pequeño  paso  para    así  adquirir  conocimiento, desea que  en   esta  decisión que  ha  tomado   sea la  mejor,  para  motivarse  y  llenarse  de  fuerzas  para continuar  cumpliendo  con  los  objetivos  y  así  alcanzar   la  meta  principal,  ser un  gran  ser  humano  y  un  excelente  médico.

Ya  que  esta  es  la  pasión,  en  el  futuro  desea  auxiliar   a  las  personas  que lo  necesitan, crecer  como  ser  humano,  sin  dejar  a  un  lado  lo  que  es,  y olvidando  a   aquellas   personas  que  la  ayudaron para  alcanzar  este  pequeño paso,  en  donde  va  a  adquirir  conocimientos  que  en  un  futuro  no  muy  lejano  le  brinden  la  posibilidad   de  ser  la  mejor  en  la  carrera  en  lo  que decidió  desde  que  era  muy  niña.

En  el  futuro  otra  de  las  grandes  metas  es  continuar  estudiando  para  así especializarse  en  pediatría   y  así  conseguir  alcanzar  más  metas  y  sueños que  aunque  no  es  fácil  tan  poco  será  difícil  ya  que  mientras  en  ella  habite el  deseo  de  surgir  y  crecer  cada  día  más  lograra  los  objetivos  y  lograra ser  lo  que  quiere. 

Ella desea el convenio con kiva ya que es una persona que quiere salir adelante y el dinero que se pueda ahorrar en el pago completo del semestre, lo puede utilizar para otros gastos que tenga en la vida cotidiana.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Cruz Del Norte Group

texts.es:
Máxima Eduarda, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 20 años. Ella es socia del grupo "Cruz del Norte", el grupo está formado por seis socias.
Máxima Eduarda se dedica desde hace mas de ocho años a la preparación y venta de churros, son una especie de pan relleno de manjar blanco. Gracias a éste negocio ha podido brindar estudios escolares a su hijo y ahora sus estudios superiores. Este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulatoria, en un carrito especial para la venta de churros y se ubica en una avenida principal, para poder captar la mayor cantidad de clientes.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como harina por saco para poder tener un stock del productos y así poder adquirirlo a menor precio.
texts.en:
Máxima Eduarda, 43, has a 20 year-old son. She is a member of the “Cruz del Norte" group, which is comprised of six members.  Máxima Eduarda has had a business making and selling churros (a type of bread stuffed with milk-based custard) for more than 8 years.  Thanks to this business she has been able to provide her son with an education, and she now supports him in his college studies.  

Máxima Eduarda sells her products from a special cart designed for churros that she takes to a main avenue of the city, so that she can attract the greatest number of customers.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies, such as sacks of flour, so that she can have a good quantity of supplies and can acquire them at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make churros

loans.name: Montoek's Group

texts.en:
Montoek, 20, is a single woman from the Memot district of Kampong Cham province. To support her daily cost of living, she grows rice and cassava on two hectares of farmland and works as a paid worker for more income. She has been with this business for ten years and she can earn about 31,100 KHR per day.

She is now the group leader in a group of two applying for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Both of them are in their second cycle of loans and they are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can get better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 35 years old and a mother of two children who are still in school. To struggle for a living, she farms rice and cassava as the main source of income. She supplements her income via working for others for a fee. This business has generated her about 26,000 KHR per day. This is the sixth loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid, has improved her livelihood better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for weeding and to use some portion of it to buy rubber tree seedlings for planting to supplement her income. She hopes to gain a good income from her business better than before.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and to buy rubber tree seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soknai

texts.en:
Soknai is 34 years old and a mother of three kids. Currently, she deals with the daily cost of living via a fish-selling business. She has been involved in the current business for seven years. 

This is the fifth loan for Soknai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has helped her to keep her kids in school and provide sufficient food for her family, especially her kids. 

For this loan cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to support her fish-selling business. She hopes that she can use this transportation to better support her business with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to support her business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun is a villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 29 years old and a mother of one son and one daughter who are still in school. She and her husband farm cassava and rice as their main income source. She has been with this business for 11 years and it has provided her with good income. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle which has helped her to promptly support her family and expand her business with a successful repayment. Now, she is seeking new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her entire loan to support her cassava farm. She hopes that her current business will produce an  extra-good crop yield so that she can earn a good income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Martha Edilma

texts.es:
Martha, a sus 60 años de edad, trabaja incansablemente para generar ingresos que le permitan solventar los gastos familiares, pues es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Hace aproximadamente 8 años trabaja de manera independiente en un taller de confección que montó en su casa, allí presta el servicio para terceros y cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos hijos a quienes les enseñó el oficio.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos y agujas), con esto podrá cumplir con la entrega de la producción de manera oportuna, mejorando la rentabilidad del negocio.
Martha manifiesta que su edad no le impide soñar y seguir luchando para hacer realidad esos sueños, especialmente el de confeccionar una línea de ropa con marca propia y darse a conocer en el mercado, logrando así mejores ingresos para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, 60, works tirelessly to generate income that will help her pay household expenses, as she is the head of the household since she separated from her spouse.

She's been running her sewing shop from her home for 8 years. She's a wholesale supplier and she counts on the support of her children whom she taught her trade.

She's currently requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk, like fabric, thread and needles. With this, she'll be able to fulfill her production orders quickly, improving the profitability of her business.

Martha tells us that her age doens't stop her from dreaming and fighting to realize those dreams, especially the one about designing her own line of clothing and being known in the market and that way generating better earnings to enjoy a higher-quality of life in the company of her children.

loans.use: buy supplies in bulk, like fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Xexac 2 Group

texts.es:
Catarina (primera de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señorita de 31 años de edad, soltera, tiene  tres hijos, ella vive junto a su familia en Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella es una joven entusiasta, visionaria y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, esto bonita actividad lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la heredó de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo y fue asi como le transfirieron todo el conocimiento y experiencia. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y con ella le sirve a su comunidad. Tiene más de 17 años de experiencia en esta actividad.
Con el objetivo de contribuir a su comunidad ella decidió organizar un grupo para ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Catarina sueña con incrementar sus ingresos a través de la siembra y producción de más banano.
texts.en:
Catarina (the person to the far right of the photograph) is a 31 year-old woman.  She is single and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in Nahualá, Sololá.

Catarina is a young, enthusiastic and visionary person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She has a business selling bananas.  She carries out this activity in the community where she lives.  She inherited this line of work from her parents, who used to do the same work.  They transferred all of their knowledge and experience to her. With this business, she generates the income she needs to support her family.  Catarina comments that she enjoys this work, because it is honest work that gives her a way to serve her community.  She has more than 17 years of experience in this line of work.

With the goal of contributing to her community, Catarina decided to organize a communal bank where she and her fellow group members could help each other and thereby improve their living standards.  She will use this loan to buy supplies (fertilizers) and to pay for labor to maintain her banana crops.  Catarina dreams of increasing her income through her work cultivating and producing bananas.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Lida Mireya

texts.es:
Lida Mireya es una mujer de 36 años mama  cabeza de hogar de 3 hijos Julián, Cristina Paola y Juan Felipe, trabaja, estudia farmacia en campo alto porque le gusta todo lo relacionado con la salud y este es un buen comienzo, le gustaría estudiar enfermería terminando la farmacia para tener mas conocimiento y complementar la profesión, además porque quiere demostrar así misma, a los hijos y a otras personas  que los obstáculos para surgir solo existen en la mente, que  todos pueden  alcanzar lo que quieren,  que no hay nada imposible, la meta a futuro  es poder montar la propia farmacia, ser independiente, que los hijos vayan a la universidad, sean profesionales, alcancen los sueños para que sean  personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.

El subsidio con kiva lo necesita ya que como menciono antes es madre cabeza de hogar de 3 hijos y los gastos son bastante altos, ya que tiene que pagar los gastos del hogar y aparte lo que ella necesite para el estudio.
texts.en: Lida Mireya, 36,  is the head of her home and has three children, Julián, Cristina Paola y Juan Felipe. She works and studies pharmacy at Campo Alto, because she enjoys everything related to health and this is a good start. She'd like to study nursing after she finishes pharmacy in order to have more knowledge and complement her profession. Also, she'd like to show her children and others that obstacles only exist in the mind and everyone can achieve what they want; nothing is impossible. Her future goals include opening her own pharmacy, being independent, having her children go to university to become professionals and achieve their dreams so they will be good and productive people to society. The Kiva loan she is requesting is to pay for one semester of tuition, as she is the head of her household with three children and her expenses are already quite high, without factoring in what she needs for her studies.

loans.use: pay a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 38 años de edad, el está casado y vive junto a sus siete de ellos tres hombres y cuatro mujeres actualmente residen en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre que tiene deseos de superación por salir adelante junto a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la albañilería a pocos metros de su vivienda. Decidió elegir esta actividad porque desde pequeño le gusto y es por ello que ahora cuenta con quince años de experiencia, la cual le ha servido para alcanzar mejores ingresos que le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia y darles estudio a sus hijos. Como también comenta que cuenta con un taller de estructuras metálicas ya que es otra fuente de ingresos.
El ha tomado la decisión de construir una casa a la orilla de la carretera ya que cuenta con un pequeño espacio. Por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción como: block, hierro, lámina y cemento.
Sus sueños son terminar la construcción de su vivienda y ampliar su taller de estructuras metálicas para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Pedro, 38, is married and lives with his 7 children (3 men, 4 women) in the departament of Sololá.

He has a desire to get ahead with his family. He currently dedicates himself to bricklaying very close to his home. He decided to become a bricklayer when he was little because he liked it; that's why he now has 15 years of experience, which have facilitated higher earnings, helped him improve the economical situation at home and sent his children to school. He tells us that he also runs a metallic structure shop which is another source of income.

He has some land near the edge of the road and has decided to build a house there. He is requesting a loan of 8,000.00 GTQ to buy construction materials, like cement blocks, metal sheets and cement.

His dreams are to finish the construction of his home and expand his metallic structures shop, so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2007 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy fertilizers for her eggplant production business.

Gloria dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her eggplant production business

loans.name: Mujeres De La Fé Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena de estado civil casada. De 49 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 6 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos y pollos. Inició este negocio con 4 pollitos y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerdos y pollos. Desea en el futuro contar con una granja grande.

Las demás intgrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.

En la fotografia aparecen 8 personas pero solo a 7 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is married, 49 years old, and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has six children, three of whom are students. She works raising animals like pigs and chickens. She started this business with four little chicks, and now has five years of experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan that they will use to buy pigs and chickens. She hopes to have a big farm in the future.

The other members of the group work in selling and livestock activities. 

In the photo there are eight people but only seven have received the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old and lives in San isidro, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

For her means of living, Natividad has a hog fattening and poultry raising business, which she has run for 15 years. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP3,500.00 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feed and vitamins for the pigs and chickens. Natividad has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years.  

In the future Natividad hopes to engage in other business.

loans.use: To be used to purchase additional 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Zainab. She is married and has three children who are 29, 25 and 23 years old. In 2008, Zainab established her provisions and drinks business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy more sugar, drinks, mayonnaise, cheese, and other items to satisfy her customers at all times. With the help of her last loan, she was able to increase her profit by SLL 150,000 and used part of it to help support her household.  Although she did not achieve her goal of renting another shop, Zainab still hopes to do so in the future. She is extremely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is from Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 58 years old and is married.

In 2013, Concordia applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one.

Recently, Concordia is asking for financial assistance of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional sewing materials for her clothing business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

She hopes to maintain the status of being a member in good standing and repaying her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing materials for her clothing business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old. She is single and has five children aged 25, 22, 19, 15, and 11 years old, all of whom are currently living with her. Elizabeth established her business selling slippers and sandals for ladies in 1987 with the aim of becoming financially independent. Her business is located in the city center. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she now earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from the business. Prior to her first Kiva loan, which has already been paid back, Elizabeth only made SLL 1,000,000 per month. Despite the increase in profits, she has been unable to rent a bigger market space, due to a road construction project in the vicinity that is obstructing development.

Elizabeth would now like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,250,000 in order to purchase additional stocks of slippers and sandals and to eventually expand her market space. 

She is incredibly grateful for your support in this effort to grow her business even further and to better provide for her large family.

loans.use: To buy additional slippers and sandals for ladies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new ladies' sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Después de varios años ella decide continuar  los estudios, ya que ella solo tenía hasta 5 de primaria   y decidió empezar por hacer el  bachillerato validando los domingos ya que el esposo  le colaboraba  con las labores del  hogar, la validación fue de  3 años con muchos sacrificios y dificultades,  se graduó el 9 de diciembre y toda la familia se sentía tan orgullosa de ella, con muchos anhelos  de continuar estudiando, pero aunque ella trabajaba medio tiempo y el esposo no le puede colaborar económicamente porque los ingresos eran muy bajos y solo alcanza para los gastos del hogar, a si que el subsidio de kiva seria de una gran ayuda económica para ella. 

A finales del 2013 se da cuenta que tiene la posibilidad de estudiar financiando el semestre y decide estudiar COSMETOLOGIA Y  ESTÉTICA INTEGRAL  ya que este ha sido un gran sueño y lo que ha ella más le ha gustado por el cuidado del cuerpo  y el de los demás, pensando en tener el propio negocio  para apoyar a los hijos en los estudios, pero también pensando en conseguir la vivienda propia, ya que ha pasado el tiempo y por tanta dificultad económica no ha logrado obtenerla, ella tiene los  sueños, ilusiones y ganas puestas a este el proyecto de vida para mejorar el nivel de vida y el de la familia.
texts.en:
After a number of years Nancy decided to go back to school, since she only completed fifth grade. She decided to begin with an accelerated study program for her high school diploma on Sundays, as her husband helps her with the household work. The accelerated program took her three years to complete and it involved a lot of sacrifices and difficulties, but she graduated December 9 with all of her family feeling very proud of her. Nancy would very much like to continue studying. She works part-time, but she and her husband use all of their combined income to pay their household expenses. For this reason, this Kiva loan would be a great financial help for her.

At the end of 2013 she learned that she could continue studying by financing her tuition for the semester. She decided to study Cosmetology and Holistic Esthetics. This program has been a dream of hers, because she is very interested in the care of the body. She is thinking of having her own business, so that she could support her children in their studies, but she is also thinking of buying a home. She has come through a period of so much financial difficulty that she has not been able to buy one. Her dreams, hopes and desires are focused on this project of a lifetime, with which she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Victoria.  She is married and has 2 children aged 20 and 15 years old. In 2005, Victoria established her manicure, pedicure and hair dresser business. She began the business because she wanted to support her husband and children. Her business is located in the out-skirts of town and the majority of her customers are women.  The business is open 7 days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 LE in order to buy more cosmetics and new types of hair products. With this new and additional stock, she hopes to attract more customers and thus expand her business. In the future, Victoria plans to open a training center for young girls who want to learn the trade and also to become a well recognized cosmetologist. 

She describes herself as a very honest and loving person and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Zainab.  She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 3 years. 

In 1999, Zainab established her business selling jeans, t-shirts, ladies dresses, skirts, and slippers. She began her business to assist her husband with the upbringing of their children. Her business is located in the city center and her customers are both men and women. Her business operates 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more of the same stock. With this additional stock, she will grow her business and increase her profit.

The biggest challenges she faces in her business are unexplained customs fees when bringing stock across the border from Guinea.

In the future, Zainab plans to find a better business location. She describes herself as very honest and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, ladies dresses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items such as bottled water, soft drinks, beer and stout.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more household items like buckets and bowls for her business.

loans.name: Fuerza De Mujer Group

texts.es: Patricia quien aparece sentada de las segundas de derecha a izquierda con una blusa de color morado, un poco seria porque ese día estaba enferma,  pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuerza de Mujer de Concepción. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienes diversos negocios tales como librerías, venta de ropa usada y nueva, peluquería. Patricia tiene un negocio de costuras, ella comenzó hace 16 años, después de haber estudiado corte y confección en el liceo. Frente a esto Patricia ha podido comprar algunas maquinas con la gran ayuda de su marido, pero en estos momentos su marido y ella han decidido por fin tener su propia casa y esto los ha llevado a tener que ahorrar mucho. Es por esto que Patricia se ha visto muy mal de dinero, peor con la esperanza de poder reunir luego el dinero para tener su casa propia. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar los materiales que necesita como lo son tela, cuellos pique blanco tela de delantales y cotonas para niños, franela, botones, ya que ella se dedica a vender ropa de colegio, y es por esto, ya que en Chile, los niños entran en el mes de marzo al colegio, que ella necesita aun más el dinero. Y sabe que le irá muy bien. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar es todo el apoyo que ha podido encontrar en sus amigas del Banco Comunal y en Fondo Esperanza.
texts.en: Patricia, seated 2nd in the 1st row in a purple shirt, is a bit serious because she had a cold that day. She's part of the Communal Bank "Fuerza de Mujer de Concepción". The associates of this communal bank have diverse businesses like, book stores, new and used clothing sales, hair salons. Patricia runs a sewing business that she started 16 years ago, after studying cutting and confection in college. Patricia was able to buy some sewing machines with the help of her husband, but at this time, they've decided to save up in order to buy a house. This is the reason why Patricia lacks funds right now. She is requesting a loan to buy the materials she needs, like fabric, collars, white piqué for aprons, cotton for children, flannel and buttons as she sells clothing for school, and in Chile, the children go to school in March and that's when she needs the most money. She knows it will go very well for her. What she's enjoyed most about working is the support she gets from her friends at the Communal Bank and in the field partner, Fondo Esperanza.

loans.use: buy fabric, collars, piqués, buttons.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Christian.  She is single and has no children.   

In 2010, Christian established her cosmetics and toiletries business. She began her business in order to be self-employed and independent. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her customers are mostly women. She operates her business 6 days a week for 10 hours every day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3000,000 SLL to buy stock items such as body lotion, shampoo, vaseline, soaps, toothpastes and many other products for re-sale. She hopes that this loan will help her business to grow. 

In the future, Christian plans to establish another shop in order to serve customers in other neighborhoods. She says her biggest business challenge is keeping up to date with the latest products on the market. 

She describes herself as caring and considerate and thanks you very much for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body lotion, shampoo, vaseline, and tooth paste.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks and pure water for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Massah is 34 and married with 2 children aged 12 and 7, both children attend school. To help ease the financial burden on her husband, she opened a small bar 3 years ago to sell soft drinks, beer, wine, and stout.

With few competitors nearby, she hopes to expand her business but needs additional chairs and tables to do so. Her first Kiva loan of  5,000,000 SLL will allow her to achieve this goal. 

The biggest challenge to her business is the lack of parking space nearby. She describes herself as very honest and hardworking and is thankful for your support to reach her goals.

loans.use: to purchase additional tables and chairs to accommodate more customers.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu is 35 and married with 1 child aged 2 years old. 

In 2011, Rugiatu established her business to sell jeans, trousers, t-shirts, skirts and blouses. She began her business in order to be independent. Located in the city center, the business is opened to the general public 6 days a week for 10 hours per day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to increase her inventory. With increased stock, she hopes to expand her business and increase her profit. In the future, Rugiatu hopes to open a fully established clothing store in a permanent location. She says that inflation is the biggest challenge to her business these days.

Rugiatu describes herself as very honest and trustworthy and would like to thank you sincerely for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, trousers, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale prices, such as peanuts, sugar, raisons and plastic bags.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has one child aged 8 months. She has one additional dependent, her cousin, living with her. 

In 2005, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business to help her husband to take care of the home and for her personal development. 

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to purchase dry cotton, wax cotton, and black wax cotton. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise profits. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to see her business become a very big shop and educate her child to the university level. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for dry cotton, wax cotton, and black wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: La señora Pamela tiene 20 años, ella se dedica al del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para las mujeres, de manera manual tiene telares para el tejido, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Santa Rosas , solicita el crédito para la  compara de lana al por mayor de vicuña y alpaca para el tejido de mantas ya que tiene mucha demanda y tiene pedidos que entregar, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Pamela is 20 years old. She produces woven sweaters for women and blankets out of alpaca wool. Pamela produces her products by hand with the help of a loom. She has a workshop in her home in the District of Santa Rosas.

Pamela is requesting a loan in order to buy vicuña and alpaca wool in bulk so that she can produce woven blankets. There is a great deal of demand and she has orders that need to be completed. She also has to deliver the orders to different markets in the city of La Paz.

Pamela is pleased and appreciates the Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy vicuña and alpaca wool in bulk.

loans.name: Mirella Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirella, a sus 44 años de edad, es una mujer casada y madre de un hijo por quien ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlo adelante.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a vender mercancía por catálogos, idea que surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo se había quedado sin empleo y no tenían otra alternativa; poco a poco fue ahorrando y montó una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en la vivienda familiar; sin embargo, las ventas bajaron súbitamente y el negocio decreció, pero, con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas por catálogo, ha logrado sostenerlo, con poco surtido, pero sigue en pie. Es por esta razón que Mirella se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, el cual destinará para la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, granos, gaseosas, lácteos, entre otros), esto le permitirá fortalecer sus inventarios y mejorar no sólo la imagen, sino también las ventas diarias.
Mirella sueña con equilibrar ambas actividades generadoras de recursos, pues así logra sostener su familia y apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Mirella is 44 years old, married, and the mother of a son whom she has been tirelessly striving to get ahead.  

She has been selling merchandise via catalog and got this idea out of a need to generate income to pay her household expenses; her husband had lost his job and she didn’t have any other alternative.  Little by little she saved up and set up a grocery store in her home, but the sales decreased and her business shrank, but she has been able to continue with her catalog sales and continues with a small inventory.  Mirella is asking for this loan so she can buy inventory in quantity (cakes, grains, soft drinks, dairy, etc.).  This will allow her to strengthen her inventory and improve not only her image, but also her sales.  

Mirella wants to level off both businesses, sustain her family and help her husband with the household finances.  This will provide her family with a better quality of life and improve their wellbeing.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: José Tomas

texts.es:
José tiene 63 años de edad,  no estudió ningún grado, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que van a la escuela, y solamente vive con ellos y su esposa.

La agricultura y ganadería han sido el trabajo al cual se ha dedicado José, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que aprendió gracias a su tío y a su padre, pues ellos le inculcaron ser una persona trabajadora, además se dedica a la carpintería, para llegar al trabajo debe hacer un recorrido de 30 minutos desde su casa.

El crédito que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar cerdos, engordarlos y luego venderlos, de esta forma obtendrá ingresos económicos que le permitan seguir adelante y mantener a su familia.

Él espera seguir con el negocio de cerdos, y lo logrará gracias al crédito, y de esta manera logrará que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and was not able to get an education. He is in a relationship and has two children who were able to go to school. José lives with his wife and children.

Farming and ranching are José's lines of work. He has 25 years of experience doing this type of work and learned the trade from his uncle and his father. They showed him how to be a hardworking individual. In addition, José works as a carpenter. His place of work requires a 30 minute trip from his house.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy pigs for fattening. He will then sell the pigs so that he can generate income to maintain his family and help them move forward. José hopes to continue his pig business. With this loan he will be able to achieve that goal so that his family does not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy pigs that he can fatten and sell.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
The self-help group "Maa Mangla Shg" is made up of 11 women who fight each day to improve their families' financial stability. They are friendly, kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. These women live in a small village in Odisha, India. 

One of the members of this group is acting as the Kiva representative. She is Indrabati, the lady in the picture standing with her hand raised. She is 44 years old, married and has one child. Indrabati's husband works as a day laborer. The house they live in is their own.

This member learned to work in the fields from her parents at a young age. It is now her way of life. Agriculture provides her income. In addition to planting vegetables, Indrabati has a greenhouse for different vegetables. At the moment, it is working out well.Her work gives her the opportunity to be at home to take care of her family.

Indrabati is taking this loan because she wants to keep investing in her business. The profit she earns is a great help in meeting her family's expenses. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for her greenhouse. Indrabati's goal is to help her child have a decent career.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Shakti Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Soudamini is a resident of Angul district in Odisha, India. She is a mother of two children. Currently, both of her kids still depend on her as one child is in school and one is too young for schooling. Her entire family relies solely on rice farming and a grocery selling business. 

Soudamini has been involved in her current business for more than 13 years and now she is able to earn up to 3,800 INR per month.

She has never been with People's Forum India, Kiva’s partner, before. Soudamini currently leads a group of 11 women to obtain a new loan. All of her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers with People's Forum. The total loan amount for her entire group is 264,000 INR. Soudamini's loan portion will be 24,000 INR. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her farmland will produce a better yield so she is able to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in January 2014 and consists of eight rural poor women belonging to the below-poverty-line category. This group is located in a remote rural village in the Angul district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood for most of the members of this group. 

Sanjukta is one of the members among them. The lady standing with a raised hand is Sanjukta. She is a very active lady of 28 years of age. She lives with her husband, two sons and two daughters.

Sanjukta has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger (okra), onions, etc. on the farm. She sells her products to the traders from the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. 

Sanjukta says that she earns a minimum amount of 5,000 INR per month from this business. This is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. Sanjukta wants to expand her business by taking a loan from People's Forum. She will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs, such as seeds and pesticides, for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. 

Sanjukta dreams to construct a house and purchase a water pump for a better irrigation facility for her farm. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other seven members of this group are also involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, general grocery shop, vegetable vending, and tailoring businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs, such as seeds and pesticides, for expanding her farming.

loans.name: Maa Mahamayee Shg Group

texts.en:
Tikina is the leader of a group that hails from a small village in the Angul district of Odisha, India. She is a widowed woman of 38 years. She has a small family comprised of two members including one son aged 15 who is still in school. The member standing with her hand raised is Tikina. 

Tikina, with the help of her son, has been doing a vegetable and flower selling business for the last 10 years. At present, her monthly family income is Rs 3,000 INR. But it is not sufficient to lead a better life. So she formed a self help group with nine other members in her locality and applied for loan. It is her first loan from People's Forum for the development of her business. With this loan, she will purchase vegetables in bulk and flower plant in a large quantity for the growth of her business.

Her future plan is to construct a house and to provide a higher education to son. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and flower plant for her business.

loans.name: Sanaiswar Shg Group

texts.en:
This group, called "Sanaiswar SHG", consists of 11 ladies who live in a small village in the Angul district of Odisha, India. The group has applied for a loan of 165,000 INR from People's Forum (Kiva's Partner). All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, vegetable selling etc.  

Damayanti, a 31-year-old married mother, has been working as a vendor selling fish and other food. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise her children well. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish and other food. 

Damayanti hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. She, along with her group members, are very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and other food to increase her sales.

loans.name: Milena  Patricia

texts.es:
Es una joven de veinte siete años que estudia segundo semestre de  auxiliar en servicios farmacéutico.

Siempre el sueño fue estudiar algo relacionado con la salud, pero hasta el momento no había tenido los recursos económicos para poder hacerlo.
 
Las metas a corto plazo son finalizar los estudios para poder conseguir un buen empleo en una buena  droguería, clínica u hospital, para realizarse laboral mente y continuar estudiando para cada día aprender un poco más. 
 
Para un futuro le gustaría poder montar la propia droguería y atenderla ella misma y así seguir adelante y colaborar a la familia. 

Con la ayuda del convenio kiva  ella puede lograr  todas estas metas ya que la situación económica es un poco escasa.
texts.en:
This young woman is 26 years old and in her second semester of the pharmacy assistant program. She has always dreamed of pursuing her studies in a health care related field, but at the moment she does not have the financial resources to continue.

Her short-term goal is to finish her studies so that she can secure a good job at a reputable drugstore, clinic, or hospital. This will allow her to gain work experience while continuing her studies so that she can learn a little bit more each day.

In the future, she would like to open and manage her own drugstore so that she can contribute to her family and help them move forward. With the help of the Kiva loan, she will be able to accomplish all of these goals since her financial situation is limiting her.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
Swarnalata is a local villager from Angul district of Odisha, India. She is 34 years old and a married mother blessed with three children. Presently, all are relying on her, as they are studying in a local school in the area. 

To support her family, Swarnalata grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. To respond to her demand to better support her crop, she joined a group of eleven to get a new loan from People's Forum (Kiva’s partner). This loan will make Swarnalata be able to uplift her living condition in a timely manner. 

Now, she and her co-borrowers are seeking 165,000 INR. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion for seeds and fertilizers for her crop and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. 

She believes that this purchase will help her to better grow her rice with a good yield in return.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizers for her crop and for plowing the field.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Anusaya belongs to a small village in the Angul district, which is located in the forest area of Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Anusaya.

She is 50 years old and alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture. She has been in business for years and things have gone well for her because of the hard work she does. Anusaya is responsible and persevering and sells her goods to customers who request them. Her aim is to continue working to get ahead.

Anusaya is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

All the members of this "Maa Santoshi SHG" group are women. The other members are involved in the sales of vegetables, food and drink, agricultural services, fruit and vegetable cultivation, and raising small animals.

Anusaya is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Kuni (shown in the photo standing with hand raised) is a 26-year-old woman who is married and has two children who are in school. She lives in a small village of Odisha, India. 

Kuni produces and sells flowers in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Kuni’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Kuni has more than 7 years of experience in this trade. 

She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. Kuni will use her loan to buy supplies (such as fertilizer) and to pay for labor so that can maintain her flower plants. She dreams of increasing her flower plantings so that she can improve her income.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maa Bramhani Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
Rati, the lady standing with her hand raised in the photograph, is a lady who is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small village of Odisha, India.

She is engaged in the production and sale of vegetables, which she carries out in the community where she lives. She learned this occupation from her parents, who had been engaged in it for many years. This work generates the income that she needs to support her family, and she comments that she likes this occupation because it is honest, and it helps her to feel useful to her community. She has more than 14 years’ experience in this occupation.

She decided to organize a group with her friends, with the goal of helping each other and thus improving their living standards. She will use the loan for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, and for the payment of workers, in order to maintain the vegetable plants. 

Rati dreams of increasing the area of her vegetable fields, and thus increasing her income, in order to provide her children with an academic preparation and prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Jai Balaji Group

texts.en:
Anusaya, aged about 55 years, is the leader of a five-member group in Muniguda, situated in the Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. Her family comprises four members: her husband, one daughter, aged about 34, and one son, aged 28. The member standing at the extreme left with her hand raised is Anusaya. 

She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a betel shop with the support of her husband and son for the last eight years. 

Anusaya, along with four other members of her village, formed a group, and this is the third time they will take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. At present, Anusaya’s family income is Rs. 6,500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan. With the loan, she will purchase betel, biscuits, chocolates, potato chips, shampoo pouches, packed water, cold drinks, etc. for her betel shop, as well as rice, pulses, grams, nuts, oil, washing powder, sugar, tea, salt, etc. for a grocery shop. She has a dream to open a tea stall adjacent to her betel shop.

Regarding the other four members of her group, three members named Truptimayee, Laxmi, and Chanchala are doing leaf plate-making businesses, and another one, Narmada, is doing a cement ring and cement products business.

loans.use: to purchase betel, biscuits, chocolates, potato chips, shampoo pouches, packed water, cold drinks, etc. for her betel shop, as well as goods for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yolanda es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, soltera y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 57 años de edad. Es de oficio enfermera. Su meta es proveerle a su familia las mejores condiciones de vida. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el saneamiento de su vivienda, con el fin de tener una red sanitaria segura. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ofrecerle a su familia un hogar limpio y saludable. Su plan futuro es cancelar el crédito y seguir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Yolanda is  57 years old and a native of Estelí. She is a single mother of three grown, independent children and works as a nurse. 

Doña Yolanda's goal is to improve her family's living conditions. She is therefore applying for a loan to improve sanitation in her home and have safe plumbing. Doña Yolanda believes that this loan will allow her to provide her family a cleaner and healthier home. Her long term plan is to pay off the loan and continue making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to improve her home's sanitation and provide her family safe plumbing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 53-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 to 23 years old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry business where he makes wooden chairs, tables and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Melisa

texts.es: La señora Melisa tiene  19 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato y no tiene hijos dependientes, no pudo continuar con sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, a su corta edad empezó a trabajar de forma independiente. Su principal actividad  es el Comercio en una Tienda de Barrio que se encuentra en la ciudad de Cochabamba, empezó vendiendo todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y tiene una antigüedad de 2 años en el rubro. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar material de escritorio para su tienda, ya que empezaron las clases en los distintos colegios y es cuando suben las ventas de esos productos, de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones en las que vive.
texts.en: Melisa is 19 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  She began working toward a bachelor’s degree, but was not able to continue her education due to a lack of financial resources.  She began working on her on at her young age.  Her main business is a small neighborhood store located in Cochabamba.  She began selling all types of personal products and has been doing this for two years.  She is asking for a loan to buy desk supplies for her store, because classes have started in the various schools and this is when sales of these products increases.  This way she can increase her income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy desk supplies.

loans.name: Ervin Naun

texts.es: Ervin es originario de Rio Blanco, Matagalpa, casado y padre de un hijo. Tiene 23 años de edad. Es de oficio obrero. Su meta próxima es seguir invirtiendo en las mejoras de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en la red sanitaria de su vivienda. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Su plan futuro es establecer un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ervin is a laborer and a native of Rio Blanco in Matagalpa. He is 23, married, and the father of a son.  

Ervin's short-term goal is to continue investing in improvements to his home. He is therefore applying for a loan to make plumbing improvements. Ervin feels that this loan will be a great help and allow him to provide better living conditions to his family. Ervin plans to start his own business in the future.

loans.use: to make plumbing improvements in his home.

loans.name: Jhonatan Alejandro

texts.es:
Jhonata, a sus 27 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, honrado y servicial; vive con su compañera sentimental y por ello se gana la vida trabajando arduamente para lograr llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Durante su vida productiva, ha laborado en empresas de estampación donde adquirió experiencia y conocimiento en los 7 años que duró vinculado a la empresa. Esto le permitió tomar la decisión de independizarse y montar su propio taller, ubicado en un local del centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja con un empleado de lunes a sábado de 9 am a 6 pm y así se gana la vida actualmente.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina sublimadora, lo que le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así obtener mayor número de contratos, beneficiando las finanzas del hogar.
Jhonata manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es fortalecer y hacer que su negocio crezca, esto le permitirá expandirse a otros mercados, generando así mejor nivel de ingresos con los que pueda ahorrar para comprar una casa propia y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jhonata is 27 years old and is a hardworking, honest, and serving man.  He lives with his wife and earns a living working arduously to support his household.  

During his productive life he has worked for a stamping company, where he gained experience and knowledge in the seven years he was connected to the company.  This allowed him to decide to go independent and set up his own workshop in the city center.  His business supports one other employee, and he works from Monday through Saturday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm.  This is how he currently earns a living. 

He will use the money to buy a sublimation machine so he can provide better customer service and get more contracts which will benefit his household finances.

Jhonata says that his greatest desire is to strengthen and grow his business.  This will allow him to expand into other markets, generating better income so he can save and buy a house to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sublimation machine for the business he started

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
