She tries very hard to meet the quota and gather the materials to continue studying. She is currently working in a restaurant, where she has performed as a great person and a hard worker. 

She tries very hard to look after what she has as she knows that without it she cannot finish her studies, and she has worked too hard to leave them behind. 

Life has taught her to fight to meet her objectives. She hopes to finish her studies and therefore have the proper esthetics, and to always continue studying in order to set a new goal every day. Thanks to the help that Kiva has brought her she remains closer to her goal of accomplishing this dream, along with helping her mother and providing a better future to her siblings.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of her tuition.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Hog-fattening is the primary source of income for Merly. She is 55 years old and has been raising hogs for eight years. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 for each hog when sold. Merly is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to grow her business continuously to earn better profits and sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
This is Amparo, 60, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She and her children manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
Amparo oversees and owns operations of a tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of the motorcycle.
Amparo hopes to buy another tricycle and dreams of always being in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of a tricycle unit.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Menardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Wilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Wilma earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Wilma is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Wilma hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week; this is also where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various perfumes, body creams, lotions, cosmetics and deodorants.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 42 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. Trang has been running a soft drinks and sugarcane juice stall to earn a living. 

She started her business four years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different soft drinks and new furniture for her stall. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and soft drinks for her stall

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
Leus is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is helping with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leus dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a responsible mother of a daughter and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation by driving a rickshaw for the past 10 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Saima's husband's rickshaw needs maintenance because the current condition of the rickshaw is not good. It requires maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his rickshaw. Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Saima's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transportation to earn more income. Saima also plans to increase her savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. 
Saima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business 10 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products such as soft drinks and snack food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman. She has been running a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business gradually by buying a variety of different products such as soft drinks and snack food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different products such as soft drinks and snack food to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nông

texts.en:
Nông is 52 years old. She is married with two children. She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up. Nông has a business growing rice and raising poultry and cattle. Nông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nông faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Nông is requesting a loan to purchase a water pipeline, an electricity line for the bathroom and toilet, a washbasin, a septic-safe toilet seat cover, a bathroom door, and material to build a toilet. She and her family are not using hygienic latrines.
 
In 2010, Nông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her family's life. This is Nông's second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nông hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipeline, an electricity line for the bathroom and toilet, washbasin, a septic-safe toilet seat cover, a door for bathroom and material to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Linda hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es: Ella es Katerin tienen 19 años de edad vive con la mama y los dos hermanos en una situación un poco difícil, la mama trabaja como auxiliar de archivo en una empresa, de igual manera Katerin trabaja como operaria de microfilmación, pero en una empresa independiente empresa, ella trabaja por servicio todo depende de lo que ella haga, la mama los mantiene a ella y los dos hermanos, pero de igual a la mama le queda difícil mantener a los tres ella le colabora mensualmente con $150.000 mensuales cuando puede, porque al ser el trabajo por lo que se haga Katerin muchas veces solo le queda para pagar la mensualidad del estudio y los transportes, es por esa misma razón que la mama le queda difícil el pagarle muchas cosas a Katerin, ya que a ella le toca responsabilizarse  por el estudio de los dos hermanos mas, los servicios del lugar donde viven y los propios transportes, es por esa la razón por la que Katerin necesita la ayuda que ofrece KIVA porque muchas veces lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cancelar la cuota mensual que campo alto le pone y hace lo que sea para alcanzar así sea para lo único que le alcance para cancelar  la cuota porque ya un año aplazo el sueño de estudiar lo que le gusta que es enfermería.
texts.en:
Katerin, 19, lives with her mother and her two brothers in a slightly difficult situation.  Her mother works for a company as a filing assistant and Katerin works doing microfilming for a private company.  Katerin does piecework so everything depends on what she does.

Katerin's mother supports her and her two brothers, but it's difficult to support the three of them.  Katerin helps by contributing 150,000 pesos [COP] a month when she can, because sometimes she only has enough to pay her monthly school expenses and transportation.  This is why it's difficult for her mother to pay for a lot of Katerin's things, because she has to pay the school expenses of Katerin's brothers, the services where they live, and their own transportation.

This is why Katerin needs help from Kiva, because often what she earns isn't enough to make her monthly payment to Campo Alto.  She does what she can to make her payment because she already postponed her dream of studying for a year.

Katerin enjoys nursing.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for a semester

loans.name: Concepción Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Concepción, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad y una de 9 años que estudia en escuela, con ella también vive un chico de 16 años que estudia en colegio y que lo crio desde pequeño como su hijo, el marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Concepción tiene una pequeña granja allí cría pollos  y chanchos, ella compra estos animalitos pequeños, los cría por tres meses los pollos y 6 meses los chanchos  y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad,  sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo, de la misma forma vende los chanchos sino que estos entrega a los comerciantes, de esta forma ella se gana algo extra en beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas  para los chanchos y pollos. Lleva más de 14 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group María Auxiliadora gathers in the parish La Sequita in Montecristi, a prosperous canton of Manabi known for being the place of birth of the Old Warrior Eloy Alfaro, and for the famous hats made of cap straw that are appreciated both inside and outside the country. 

In this place lives Mrs. Concepción of 47 years old, married and with 6 children, 5 of them of legal age and 1 of 9 years old, who is still attending to school. There’s also another boy of 16 years old and attending to school, who has lived with her since he was a little boy and was raised as her son. Her husband works at a factory in Manta. 

Doña Concepción has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs. She buys these small animals, raises the chicken for three months and the pigs for six months, and then sells them alive or by the pound to the neighbors or the stores of the location. Her chickens are widely sold because she feeds them with corn, and that makes the meat to be like the one of creole chicken. She also sells her pigs to the traders and in this way she gets some extra income for her family’s well being. 

She will use this loan to buy food and medicines for the pigs and chickens. She has been over 14 years in the credit group and likes to be in it for all the help she gets with the loans. Her dream is to keep going forward.

loans.use: to buy food and medicines for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, vive en casa propia con su esposa en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, percibe una renta de jubilado con la cual se mantiene y mantiene a su familia. 

El credito que solicita es para pagar los gastos medicos de su pierna, en una clinica particular, debido a que la CNS  no cuenta con los equipos necesario para efectuar el estudio y analisis de su enfermedad.

El sueño de Humberto es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Humberto lives in a house he owns with his wife in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz, he receives a retirement pension with which he lives and supports his family.
The loan requested is to pay for medical expenses for his leg in a private clinic, because the “CNS” doesn't count with the equipment needed to run the tests and analysis of his medical condition.  Humberto's dream is that his children become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses related to his leg.

loans.name: Luyện

texts.en:
Luyện is sixty-three years old. She is married with three children. She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents, as her children have grown up. Luyện has a business making metal furniture and raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Luyện faces in her business is a lack of capital. 

Luyện is requesting a loan to purchase a water pipeline and electricity line for the bedroom and toilet, a wash basin, septic toilet seat, mirror, door for the bedroom and materials to repair the toilet. Currently, she and her family are not using hygienic latrines. 

In 2010, Luyện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her family's life. This is Luyện's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Luyện hopes that her business will do well. With the profits, she hopes to remodel her house and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipeline and electricity line for the bedroom and toilet, a washbasin, septic toilet seat, mirror, door for the bedroom and materials to repair the toilet

loans.name: Shirley Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
Aquí vive la señora Shirley, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada, y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 9 y 4 años y un bebé de 1 mes de nacido, el mayor de ellos estudia en escuela. Su esposo es electricista.
Doña Shirley para ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre la ciudad por donde tiene sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, siempre sale en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su mamá le ayuda con sus hijos y ella puede salir a ofrecer sus productos. Así se gana algo para el bienestar de sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo en especial de temporada playera que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito desde hace  3 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras. Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora loan group meets in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous cantón of Manabí, known for its famous palm fiber hats that are appreciated inside and outside of the country. 

This is where Shirley lives. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children. They are 9 and 4 years old, and she has a baby that is 1 month old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is an electrician.

Shirley, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, sells all types of clothing and costume jewelry. She works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, selling door to door. She works all over the city where she has her clients. She sells on credit and collects every eight days. She always leaves in the mornings because its during that time of day 'that her mother helps her with the children and she can go out to sell her products. Doing this, she earns something toward her children’s wellbeing. 

She will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing, especially beachwear, which is what is selling best right now. She has been a member of the loan group for 3 years and she likes the how responsible her group mates are. Her dream is to have a small store.

loans.use: to buy beachwear.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene 44 años, casada ella se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado lechero para la venta de leche, ella vive en la localidad de Huayrocondo, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Martha va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado lechero mejorado para tener una mejor producción de leche,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la producción de leche, la señora Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, la señora Martha va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y para compra de forraje para su ganado, la señora Martha desea para su negocio crecer en la producción y venta de leche.
texts.en: Martha is 44, she is married, she is a dairy farmer and sells milk.  She lives in Huayrocondo, this loan is the first one she gets with the institution, Martha is going to use this loan to buy one head of dairy cattle to improve and have more milk production, Martha's challenges are to improve her business and quality of life.  Martha will use her profits to buy feed for her cattle.  For her business, she dreams to grow in production and milk sales.

loans.use: to buy a head of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria tiene 45 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 12 y 15 años, ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes, ella vende en distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Victoria,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de mercadería juguetes al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victoria is 45, married, has two children ages 12 and 15, she works selling toys at different markets of the city of El Alto, the loan is her first with the institution.  Victoria will use this loan to buy toys at wholesale to stock her business, her reason to request the loan is to have more merchandise.  Victoria's challenge is the competition in her business.  She will use the profits in buying more merchandise and this way continue to generate more income.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to her to grow in her business, improve her income and as a result her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toys at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en:
Mui is thirty-six years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. To earn a living, she and her husband have been running a business making shoes.

Mui started her business six years ago. She intends to take a loan to buy more leather and accessories for producing shoes. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more leather and accessories for making shoes.

loans.name: Lao

texts.en:
Lao is forty-eight years old and married with five children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. To earn a living, she and her husband have been running a cafe and soft drink shop.

Lao started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different soft drinks and new furniture. This purchase will satisfy and attract more customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different soft drinks and new furniture

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is requesting a new loan to purchase a variety of better quality products such as soft drinks, cupcakes and travel-size shampoo to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater range of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store and grow sales, which will in turn help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy variety of products such as soft drinks, cupcakes and shampoo to restock her general store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer que desde niña le gusta la modistería, la atracción por este estilo de vida empezó desde que vio a una vecina coser y esto le causó mucha intriga, se la pasaba todas las tardes observando a la vecina en la manera y facilidad que se le daba para coser. 

Margarita cuidaba los niños de la vecina, mientras ella trabajaba, un día decidió coger la maquina por iniciativa propia porque quería aprender a utilizarla, pasaron muchos días,  partió muchas agujas y dañó mucha ropa hasta que aprendí, es así como entre muchas de las actividades que ella desarrolla, está la de arreglar y rediseñar prendas, actividad que realiza muy bien, pues no le ha sido difícil, ya que posee  habilidades y aptitud para llevar a cabo este trabajo.

Ya con la práctica de la máquina,  se interesó mucho más al darse cuenta que esa era la pasión, pero por cosas de la vida no ha podido lograr el sueño, siempre ha querido ser una MODISTA PROFESIONAL  y seguir estudiando para perfeccionarse y así poder ser independiente en el trabajo y emprender la propia empresa, pues otro de los sueños es poder ayudar a las personas, brindándoles una oportunidad de trabajo, pero por el momento ella no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar el valor normal de la mensualidad, por eso se ve en la necesidad de pedir el subsidio de kiva para poder termianar esta carrera y cumplir el sueño que ella tiene.
texts.en:
Margarita likes fashion since she was a little girl, she became interested in it when she saw a neighbor sewing and was very intrigued about it, she used to spend her afternoons watching her neighbor and the way she could sew with little effort.

Margarita babysat for her neighbor while she worked, one day she decided to take the initiative to use the sewing machine because she wanted to learn to use it, many days passed, she broke many needles and damaged pieces of clothing until she learned.  This is how among many of the activities she does one is fixing and re-designing clothing, activity that she can do very well and is not difficult because she has the skills needed to do this type of work.

Once she had practice with the sewing machine, she was even more interested in it, because she realized it was her passion.  Because of life situations, she hasn't been able to achieve her dream.  She has always wanted to be a professional fashion designer and continue studying to master her craft.  This way, she can be independent.  She would like to start her own company, because another dream of hers is to help people by giving them the opportunity to have a job.  For now, she doesn't have enough resources to pay for the monthly tuition, that's why she needs to the help from Kiva to be able to finish her studies and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Eduardo Elides

texts.es:
Eduardo de 60 años de edad, solo logro sacar 3º grado, esta casado su esposa solamente se dedica al oficio del hogar, tienen cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y que ya no viven con él. Eduardo solamente vive con su esposa.

 Eduardo trabaja desde muy pequeño en el cultivo del maíz y en los tiempos libre que le quedan se dedica a dar servicio de trasporte con su vehículo y cuando lo requiere él hace viaje con su vehículo así genera un poco mas de ingreso a su hogar.


Eduardo utilizara el préstamo, para la preparación de 16 hectáreas de terreno, en la compra del abono, en semilla, combustible para regar el terreno para sembrar maíz. Con lo que produzca él desea darle una mejor vida a su esposa.
 

El sueño de Eduardo, es darle un mejor condición de vida a su esposa y con la ganancia adquirida en la producción del maíz. Pueda volver a cultivar nuevamente generando cada vez mas, mas ingresos para su hogar y tenga una condición mejor.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 60, studied 3rd grade, he is married, his wife is a housewife.  They have four children that are adults and don't live with them anymore.  Eduardo only lives with his wife.

Eduardo works since he was little growing corn and during his free time he provides transportation services with his vehicle and this way he generates more income for his home.

Eduardo will use the loan to prepare 16 hectares of land, buy fertilizer, seed and fuel to water the land and grow corn.  With the harvest he wants to give his wife a better life.

Eduardo's dream is to give his wife a better quality of life with the profits from corn production. He also wants to continue farming, generate more income for his home and improve its condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and fuel to water the land and grow corn.

loans.name: Angie Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es angie carolina, en su niñez era una niña muy experimental porque quería jugar a todo lo que le gustaba, en este caso es cosmetologia y estética integral.

Era muy buena en los estudios, le gustaba mucho porque cada dia iba aprendiendo mas de lo que le gustaba, quiere estudiar cosmetologia integral porque le gusta todo lo que tenga que ver con la relajación corporal, los muslos y todo lo que tenga que ver con el cuerpo.

Los planes a futuro son tener una buena carrera estar bien preparada, ayudarle a los padres y ser muy buena en lo que hace que es cosmetologia y estética integral.

Quiere el convenio con kiva por la razón que los padres no pueden pagar todo lo que vale la carrera y por ese motivo quiere que le ayuden con el descuento.
texts.en:
Meet Angie Carolina, during her childhood she liked to experiment because she wanted to play with everything that she liked, in this case cosmetology and aesthetics.
She was a very good student, she liked it because every day she learned something she liked, she wants to study integral cosmetology because she likes everything that has to do with body and muscle relaxation, and anything that has to do with the body.
Her plans for the future are to have a good career, be prepared, help her parents and be really good at what she does.
She wants a loan with Kiva because her parents can't afford to pay all her education expenses and for this reason she needs help from a loan.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Sol De Cultura Y Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” conformado por 05 socios progresistas. Francisca de 63 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos independiente. Francisca se dedica a la venta de productos de golosinas fruto de su esfuerzo pudo educar a sus hijos. Así mismo prepara frituras como pollo broaster todos los fines de semana, la cual le ha generado un ingreso extra a su hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de golosinas. El grupo “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por el Apoyo brindado. Francisca  es la segunda a la parte derecho y viste una blusa a colores. Juan Carlos se encuentra en la  parte superior a lado izquierdo, la cual no pudo estar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: The group “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” (Sun of Culture and Progress) is formed by 5 members. Francisca is 63, married, has four children that are now independent.  Francisca works selling snacks, with this business she was able to provide education for her children.  She also makes chicken during the weekends, which has generated an extra income for her home.  She requested the loan to buy snacks.  The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the support provided. Francisca is the second from the right and is wearing a colorful top.  Juan Carlos is in the top left, he couldn't be there on time because of work.

loans.use: to buy snacks for sale.

loans.name: Dora Sulema

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Dora, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudia en colegio, el marido es obrero.
Doña Dora para ganar algo y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados, también los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los mismos.  Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito y por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora loan group meets in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous cantón of Manabí, known for its famous palm fiber hats that are appreciated inside and outside of the country. 

This is where Dora lives. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children, 4 of whom are of legal age, and the youngest is 16 years old and is studying in high school. Her husband is a laborer.

Dora, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, raises chickens. She buys these animals when they are still small and then raises them for a period of three or four months until they have reached an adequate weight. She then sells them to buyers who come to her house to take them to different markets. She also skins and sells them by the pound to neighbors and stores in her neighborhood.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicines. She has been in the loan group for 10 years and she likes it because the interest is lower than in other places that provide loans and also for the support the group gives her. Her dream is to keep working and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicines (for the chickens).

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena is a 31-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband has been running his own welding business for the past ten years. He is the only one responsible for feeding his family and fulfilling all their demands.

Rozeena's husband wants to purchase different types of tools and other accessories for his welding plant, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these tools and accessories. Therefore Rozeena has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to enable her husband to buy these relevant items for business purposes.

Rozeena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some tools and accessories for her husband's welding plant.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is aged 48 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, consisting of five persons. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult. So Farzana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching related items like clothes, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of four sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 12 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Her husband needs maintenance for his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport services to earn profitable income. 

Nasreen also plans to make savings with the the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the expense of maintenance for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is the age of 32; she is a mother of four children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well; some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Yasmeen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Zulaikha

texts.en:
Zulaikha is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and six children. Her husband is a shoe maker by profession, and he has been running his business for the past five years. He is a guardian of her family and responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Zulaikha is an active borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She has applied for a loan so that she can help her husband to buy pieces of leather, nails, glue, etc., for shoe-making purposes. This loan will also be helpful for her husband to increase the size of his business and earn more profitable income. Zulaikha also plans to make savings with the income derived from her husband's business, so that she can meet her family's future needs.

Zulaikha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of leather, nails, glue, etc., for her husband's business

loans.name: Nacor

texts.es:
Nacor, a sus 50 años de edad, se ha ganado la vida trabajando de manera independiente; inició hace muchos años trabajando como comerciante de pescado en su pueblo natal, pero luego, por razones externas a su voluntad, tuvo que trasladarse a la ciudad, donde inició una salsamentaría en la que ofrece mecato, licor, gaseosas y otros productos, adicionalmente complementa sus ingresos trabajando como músico, en las noches y fines de semana; de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.
Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar un amplificador de sonido para amenizar el ambiente en el establecimiento y para llevarlo a las presentaciones como músico, ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así darse a conocer para luego atraer nuevos clientes.
Nacor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder garantizar el bienestar a su familia, por ello trabaja cada día con entusiasmo para lograr disminuir sus deudas y liberar el flujo de caja de sus negocios, dando paso para generar mayor rentabilidad que le ayude a brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Nacor, who is 50 years old, has earned a living on his own. He started many years ago working as a fish merchant in his home town, but later, for reasons beyond his control, he had to move to the city. There he started a deli where he sells pastries, liquor, soft drinks, and other products. He also complements his income by working as a musician at night and on weekends. In this way, he has been able to generate enough income to provide for his family’s expenses.

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to buy a sound amplifier to improve the atmosphere of the store and to take it to his music events so that he can offer better service to his customers so that he can become better known and then attract new clients.

Nacor explains that his greatest wish is to be able to guarantee his family’s wellbeing. That is what he works for enthusiastically every day, so that he can reduce his debts and liberate his cash flow for his businesses. This will, in turn, improve his profitability and help him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a sound amplifier.

loans.name: Katheryne Michelle

texts.es:
Katheryne es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 20 años de edad, recién graduada de diseño gráfico y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de abrir un local comercial para vender su mercancía, por lo que invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas) y ajustará el capital de trabajo con unos ahorros para poder comenzar a generar recursos en su nuevo lugar de trabajo, brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Katheryne tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Katheryne is a young and dynamic entrepreneur who is 20 years old. She recently graduated with degrees in graphic design and independent sales. Two years ago she started to sell merchandise to her family members, friends, and university classmates, with the goal of earning income to contribute to her family’s income and to pay for her studies.

The loan she is requesting is to strengthen her business. She was presented with the opportunity to open a store in order to sell her merchandise. She will invest the money in buying merchandise at wholesale prices (jeans, t-shirts, blouses) and she will complement this working capital with some savings so she can begin to earn income in her new place of work. She will provide better comfort and service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable. 

Katheryne has the strong goal of making her business productive because she wants to become a successful businesswoman and guarantee a better quality of life and wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale prices (jeans, t-shirts, blouses) and to complement her working capital.

loans.name: Tano Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos uno de ellos es Estanilao hombre de 65 años de edad, acompañado, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, se dedica a sembrar maíz y pipían y también  trabaja como transportistas desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de abono, semillas mejoradas  de maíz, semillas mejoradas  de pipían,compra de insecticidas , fertilizantes, preparacion de la tierra, pago de mozo. Marbelline tiene 26 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas y nacatamales, Teresa mujer de 36 años su negocio es la venta de pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is Estanilao. He is 65 years old and has a spouse and one son under his care. He grows corn and pumpkins. He has also worked as a driver for eight years. 

He needs to loan to buy fertilizer, improved corn seeds, squash seeds, insecticides, as well as to pay laborers and prepare his land.

Marbelline, 26, has a business selling tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales. Teresa, 36, sells pinol and pinolillo, traditional drinks made of cornmeal and cacao.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, improved corn seeds, squash seeds, and insecticide, as well as to pay laborers and prepare his land.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, no está casada y únicamente tiene dos hijos.

Ella no tiene negocio en este país, pero es ciudadana de los Estados Unidos de América, cuando está allá se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos como lo es limpieza en casas.


El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar una casa que pertenece a su hermano, pues él padece de sus facultades mentales, hace desorden, y es por esta razón que ella desea ayudarlo, arreglando la casa para que su hermano permanezca ahí y de esta manera, evitar problemas de violencia que pueda ocasionar su hermano hacia las demás personas.

Su sueño, es regresar de los Estados Unidos cuando ya quede pensionada, y  continuar su vida en El Salvador, para estar unida con su familia.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 56 years old, studied until third grade, is not married, and only has 2 children.

She does not have a business in El Salvador, but she is a citizen of the United States. When she is in the US, she is dedicated to domestic activities like cleaning houses.

She needs this loan to improve the home of her brother, who suffers from mental illnesses and is becoming disorderly. It is for this reason that she desires to help him clean up his house and avoid problems of violence that her brother sometimes can cause others.

Her dream is to return from the United States when she is pensioned and continue her life in El Salvador to be united with her family.

loans.use: to improve her brother's home

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda es una mujer de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado; pues la situación económica que tenían sus padres eran difíciles para seguir estudiando comenta Fredesvinda.  Ella es viuda tienen 8 hijos, de los cuales 7 están acompañados y están fuera del país en su vivienda solo viven con ella un hijo y  3 nietos de 15,14 y 8 años de edad, los nietos actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y son los únicas personas que dependen de ella.

Fredesvinda se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar y cuidar a sus nietos, comenta que desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a esta actividad, pues es un trabajo hereditario por parte de su mamá que desde que estaba pequeña su madre le enseño a aprender este oficio, ella dice que es una actividad muy importante y que se siente orgullosa de desempeñar esta actividad en su familia, gracias a ellos ha crecido a sus hijos  y también ella siempre recibe el apoyo de sus  hijos en los trabajos que desarrolla en su hogar. 

El préstamo lo utilizara, para la reparación de su vivienda pues comenta que está un poco deteriorada más que todo el techo, comprara específicamente tejas y madera para el techo, esta mejora le ayudara a vivir más cómodamente junto a sus nietos, sin peligro que se pueda caer el techo de la casa pues era un gran problema y pensar que tenían cuando llovía.

Ella desea en el futuro tener mucho bienestar para ella y su familia poder tener una mejor vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida que sus nietos sean personas de bien en la sociedad que sigan estudiando y logren sacar una carrera universitaria, todo esto dice que lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y gracias al crédito solicitado y futuros  créditos que solicitara para mejorar su calidad de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda, 69, only studied until second grade as her parent’s financial situation at the time didn’t allow her to go any further.  She is a widow with 8 children; all but one have partners and are now living abroad.  Living with her in her house, she only has one son and 3 grandchildren aged 15, 14 and 8.  Her grandchildren are studying at the moment and are the only people who depend on her financially.

Fredesvinda takes care of the household chores and looks after her grandchildren.  She tells us that she has been doing this work since she was little as it is a job that she inherited from her mother, who also learnt it when she was little.  For her, it is a very important job and she feels very proud to do this for the family.  Thanks to her efforts, all her children are now grown up and can now help her when she works in the home.

She will use the loan to repair her home which has deteriorated a little, especially the roof.  She will buy tiles and wood to repair the roof.  This will make for a more comfortable home for her and her grandchildren, without the danger of the roof falling in, which has always been a problem and a great concern for them when it rains.

She hopes to have a nice standard of living for her and her family in the future and to have a better home to enjoy.  She also hopes that her grandchildren grow up to be good people in society and are able to continue studying until university.  She says that she will achieve all this with the help of God and this and future loans that she might ask for in the future to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KONI, commune de KONI, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de céréale, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leurs septièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARAIAM la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement restauratrice depuis deux ans, chose qu’elle a apprise avec sa tante à Bamako. Elle compte acheter avec son argent: 30kg de riz ,10 litres d’huiles, et des condiments chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente s’effectue dans son mini restaurant sis à Koni à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000Fcfa par mois qui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who average 46 years of age with an average of six children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koni in the Koni municipality, which lies in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). 

They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends and they practise restauration activities and trade in condiments, cereals and clothing. The women in the Benkadi group are on their seventh group loan. With a view to satisfying huge customer demand, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and these loans will be used to buy the afore-mentioned goods.

The customer Mariam, who is standing on the far left of the photo, has had no education. Having unsuccessfully tried several income generating activities, she has been running a restauration activity for the past two years now; she learned this trade from her aunt in Bamako. With her loan she is planning to buy: 30kg of rice, 10 liters of oils and condiments from wholesalers in Fana. She sells her goods in her mini-restaurant in Koni to a diverse customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA which will be partly reinvested in her business with the rest being used to cover the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration activity.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou est un mécanicien de profession , marié et père de famille. Il habite avec sa famille et prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 30 ans dans ce domaine. Il sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 100.000F pour acheter et vendre des pièces détachées.il commence sa journée à 10h pour la finir à 19h. A l'avenir il souhaite avoir deux voitures de location pour augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Amadou, who is a mechanic by trade, is married and a father. He lives with his family and takes responsibility for covering its daily outgoings as well as his children's school fees. He has more than 30 years experience in this field. He is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to buy and resell spare parts. He begins his day at 10 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 7 o'clock in the evening. In the future he would like to have two rental cars so he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and resell spare parts for cars.

loans.name: La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Genevieve est une brave commerçante et trésorière du collectif d’affaires « La Sagesse »,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 49 ans, célibataire, mère de 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 1 est encore gosse.   La cliente est vendeuse  de la boisson. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette sur la route dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de  son petit ami. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 40 caisses Primus, 10 caisse Mitziing et 20 caisses de coca cola. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Genevieve, the customer, is a courageous retailer and the treasurer of the La Sagesse business group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 49 years old, single and the mother of 3 children, two of whom go to school and one who is still very young. She sells drinks. She sells her merchandise in a bar located on a road in a busy district where she has built up her clientèle. She started her business with money she received from her husband. Later on, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in business for 10 years. This new loan will be used to buy 40 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Mitziing and 20 cases of Coca Cola. She would like to build a house and to feed her children and make sure they get an education. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banking channels achieve self-sufficiency, especially in this difficult time after the war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 40 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Mitziing and 20 cases of Coca Cola.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KELEGNA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SIRIMOU, commune de SIRIMOU, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de savon, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
La cliente DJENEBOU la personne au milieu dans le rang assise n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers depuis trois ans .Elle compte acheter avec son argent:20 paires de boucle d’oreilles, 30 pièces de colliers, et des bagues en garanties chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente s’effectue au marché journalier du village à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes surtout à l’approche des mariages. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kelegna group is made up of married women who average 48 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sirimou in the Sirimou municipality, which lies in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they trade in condiments, soaps and other products. The women in the Kelegna group are on their first group loan.

The customer, Djenebou, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, has had no education. Having unsuccessfully attempted several income-generating activities, she has been retailing a variety of products for three years now. With her money she is planning to buy 20 pairs of earrings, 30 necklaces and rings under guarantee from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her products at the daily village market to a customer base primarily made up of women and above all in the run up to weddings. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be partly reinvested in her business, with the rest being used to cover the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de tenis, venta de juegos electrónicos, producción de mantas, sombrerería, venta de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de venta de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su madre, ya que desde niña ella ayudaba en la elaboración de sus productos, después de tener su pareja decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y  dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir” [Future] communal bank is beginning its seventeenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors, with Señora Antonia as Treasurer.   The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, among them: food sales, sneaker sales, electronic game sales, suitcase sales, a hat shop, and making blankets.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises such as that of Antonia.  She relates that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, signing up due to an invitation from one of the bank’s promoters who came to visit her in her home.  Currently, she has a business knitting and selling blankets.  She shares that she began this business on the recommendation of her mother, because from the time she was a young girl she would help make them, and after meeting her life partner she decided to begin her own business.

The loan that she is currently taking out is to increase her capital--to purchase wool that she will get in the markets of the La Paz region.  After making the blankets, she will sell them in her sales stand.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, because she lives with her mate and two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area that the institution provides her.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Amrita

texts.en:
Amrita is the mother of three daughters and two sons. She takes her responsibilities as a mother and homemaker very seriously. The family lives in Rawalpindi. 

Amrita's husband earns his living by providing taxi transportation services. He has operated this business for 20 years. As the sole breadwinner for the family, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

At present, Amrita's husband needs to perform maintenance and repairs on his vehicle because its current condition is not good. It also requires ongoing maintenance. Due to insufficient income, he is unable to afford this maintenance work. For this purpose, Amrita has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Amrita's husband will be able to afford the maintenance costs required. The repairs will allow him to provide better transport services and earn a more profitable income. Amrita also plans to build savings with her husband's increased profits in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Amrita is very grateful to BRAC Pakistan and to her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to help her husband pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his yard, buy poultry feeds, a cage for producing eggs and to build a drinking system for the chickens

loans.name: Abed Alhakeem

texts.en:
Abed Alhakeem is 35 years old. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, so he worked with his father and after that he became a taxi driver.

In 2012 he started his taxi business to provide transportation services.  He has a group of drivers.  He asked Ryada for this loan to purchase a car tracking device, so that he can monitor the work that is being done. 

Abed Alhakeem has a lot of customers who prefer to use his taxi service since he drives attentively and very carefully.  He hopes that this loan will increase efficiency of the drivers which will increase his income and the income of his drivers, too.  

He said that he wants to do his best to be able ensure his children’s needs and he is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a car tracking device for his taxi business, so that he can monitor the work that is being done.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is 51 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife and his daughter.  He sells all kind of vegetables and fruits in his vegetable shop. He opened it more than three year ago and this business helped the family income.

Nihad asked Ryada for this loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits so he would be able to increase his stock as he had shortage in his capital. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to be well known in the city so he tries to give the best service to his clients.

Nihad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 48-year-old, married man.  He lives in Jinen city with a big family; he has four children, two of them attend primary school. 

In 2010 Bilal started selling birds in his shop, buying them from hunters and selling to special customers. It is a good business, but it still needs a lot of improvement. 

He asked Ryada for this loan to buy birds in large quantities this will increase his customers and his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. His dream is to expand his business, and he desires to use part of the profits for his children’s education in the future.

Bilal is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy birds in large quantities this will increase his customers and his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.name: Abd Al Kareem

texts.en:
Abd Al Kareem is 44 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and three children.
He opened a small garage in 2010. He specializes in repairing and painting vehicles; this business is the only source of income for his small family. 
Abd Al Kareem is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy a multi use machine for painting and cleaning the cars. This will increase his customers and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. His dream is to expand his business and to use part of the profits on his children’s education in the future.
Abd Al Kareem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a multi use machine for painting and cleaning cars. This will increase his customers and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.name: Misleh

texts.en:
Misleh is 28 years old. He lives in Nablus with his wife and two children.

He opened a small carpentry workshop in 2011. He specializes in manufacturing furniture. This business is the only source of income for his small family.
Misleh is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy a new machine for his workshop and wood boards, which will allow him to expand and hire another laborer to help him because his customers are increasing constantly.

Misleh is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his carpentry and wood boards

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is 36 years old and is living in Gaza with his wife and six children.

In 2011 he started sewing clothes. He thought to do something to improve the family's income, especially as they are a big family and his income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family, so he decided to expand his sewing workshop. He is sewing clothes for many shops in his area and distributing them.  His dream is to have his own brand in larger areas.

Rami is asking Ryada for this loan to buy a motorcycle to use for distributing the clothes. This will increase the quantity he produces and provide him with more time and less effort. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for distributing clothes

loans.name: Aqeela's Group

texts.en:
Aqeela, age 44, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband has been working washing vehicles in a service station for many years. 

Thanks to his hard work and sincerity in his work, his number of clients continues to increase. Whenever he is at the service station, a crowd of his clients gather around him. He needs to purchase sitting chairs for them to wait in, and a pressure pump for him to use at the service station. 

So, Aqeela contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Her husband will use the loan to purchase a pressure pump and sitting chairs for his service station. Aqeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's service station. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy material for service station such as pressure pipes, sitting chairs for costomers etc.

loans.name: Kirubukene Group

texts.fr:
Catherine fait partie du groupe  Kirubukene  et habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de   53 ans.  Elle a 3 enfants  âgés de 15 à 25 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce de  bière. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Catherine is a member of the Kirubukene group and lives in Gitega. She is 53 years old and a widow. She has three children, aged from 15 to 25 years old. 

Catherine sells beer. She is on her third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of beer, which she will resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer to resell

loans.name: Ntizoguta Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe Ntizoguta et habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Ernest, un photographe-cameraman. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  l’un a 3 ans et l’autre 12 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (unités téléphoniques, riz, haricot, ...) depuis 11 ans.

Elle est à son neuvième crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (unités téléphoniques, riz, haricot,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une grande propriété foncière pour une agriculture moderne et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aline belongs to group Ntizoguta and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Ernest, a photographer and cameraman. They have two children together: one is three and the other is twelve. Both attend school.
She has been in retail (phone credits, rice, beans…) for eleven years.
She is on her ninth loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy many more items to resell in her shop (phone credits, rice, beans…), in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many items to resell in her store (phone credits, rice, beans...) in order to earn more.

loans.name: Himbarwa Group

texts.fr:
Egide fait partie du groupe Himbarwa  et habite à  Gitega. Il  a 29 ans et est marié  à Mme. Rose, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6 mois à 5 ans. 

Il est menuisier et fait le commerce des meubles et des planches depuis 12 ans.

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  planches pour la fabrication de beaucoup de meubles  à  vendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Egide belong to group Himbarwa and lives in Gitega. He is 29 and married to Madam Rose, a shopkeeper. Together they have three children ages six months to five years.

He is a woodworker and has been selling furniture for twelve years.

He is on his third credit with Turame. With the KIVA loan he obtained, he will increase his capital and purchase more planks to build many pieces of furniture, which he will sell to earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many boards with which to build furniture, sell it, and earn more.

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
Véronique fait partie du groupe  Tujinama  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 53 ans et est mariée à  Salvator, un agriculteur.Elle a sous sa charge ses deux petits enfants l'un a 16 ans et l'autre 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  charbon de bois et de boutique depuis 9 ans.

Elle est à son vingtième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sacs de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins familiaux (se nourrir, se vêtir,…).
texts.en:
Véronique belongs to group Tujinama and lives in Gitega. She is 53 and married to Salvator, a farmer. She takes care of her two grandchildren, one aged sixteen and the other seventeen.

She has been retailing charcoal and other items for nine years.

She is on her twentieth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she will increase her capital and purchase many bags of charcoal to resell and earn more.

Thanks to profits from her trade, she manages to provide for the family’s needs (food, clothing…)

loans.use: increase her capital and purchase many bags of charcoal, to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Ntagoheka Group

texts.fr:
Sylvie fait partie du groupe  Ntagoheka  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 38 ans et est mariée  à Gabriel, un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 6 à 20 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 1 an.

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup de  bananes   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Sylvie belongs to group Ntagoheka and lives in Gitega. She is 38 years old and married to Gabriel, a shopkeeper. Together, they have five children aged six to twenty.

She has been retailing bananas for one year.

She is on her third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she will increase her capital and purchase many bananas to resell and earn more.

loans.use: increase her capital and purchase many bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Uzuzanye Group

texts.fr:
Pascal  fait partie du groupe Uzuzanye  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 46 ans et est marié à  Godelieve,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont 4 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (bière, savon, riz, sel, …) depuis  10 ans. 

C'est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  la quantité 
d’ articles ((bière, savon, riz, sel, …)  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Pascal is a member of the Uzuzanye group and lives in Gitega. He is 46 years old and is married to Godelieve, a farmer. Together they have five children, of whom four go to school.

Pascal has been selling goods in a shop (beer, soap, rice, salt, …) for about ten years.

This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his stock for resale and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of goods (beer, soap, rice, salt…) to resell

loans.name: Umuteramyi Group

texts.fr:
Claude fait partie du groupe  Umuteramyi  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 27 ans et est marié à Francine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 1 an 6 mois. . 

Il fait le commerce de boutique (huile de palme, riz, tomates,…) depuis 5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique ( huile de palme,riz, tomates,…)  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une maison, une voiture et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claude is a member of the Umuteramyi  group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 27 years old  and married to Francine, who is a farmer. They have one eighteen month old child.

He has been a shopkeeper for five years (palm oil, rice, tomatoes…)

This is his fourth loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of products for his store (palm oil, rice, tomatoes…) for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a house, a car, and see his children studying.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of products for his shop (palm oil, rice, tomatoes...) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Magnifique  fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere et habite à Gitega. Elle a 39 ans et est mariée à  Stéphane un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 17 ans dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (lait en poudre, savons, limonade, ...) depuis 3 ans.

Elle est à son  quatrième crédit à Turame.Avec  le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (lait en poudre, savons, limonade, ...) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle, un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Magnifique is a member of the Twitezimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and married to Stéphane, a storekeeper. They have five children aged between five and 17 years, of whom four go to school.

She has been a storekeeper (powdered milk, soap, lemonade...) for three years.

This is her fourth loan from Turame. With this Kiva credit, she will increase her capital and buy many articles for her shop (powdered milk, soap, lemonade...) for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land, a farmable plot, and see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many articles for her shop (powdered milk, soap, lemonade...) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Jabuka Group

texts.fr:
Scholastique  fait partie du groupe  Jabuka  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a  48 ans et est mariée  à Thaddée, un  scripteur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  7 à 22 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits et des chaussures depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’habits et de paires de chaussures  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Scholastique is a member of the Jabuka group and lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and married to Thaddée, who is a scriptwriter.  They have three children aged between seven and 22 years, all of whom are students.

She has been selling clothes and shoes for six years.

This is her tenth loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of clothes and a large number of pairs of shoes for resale in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothes and pairs of shoes for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Abatuhurana Group

texts.fr:
Juvénal  fait partie du groupe Abatuhurana  et habite à Gitega. Il a 45 ans et est marié  à Sylvana, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (sel, sucre,…) depuis  20 ans.
