Il  est à son troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des articles de sa boutique en grande quantité(sel, sucre,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait  acheter une voiture.
texts.en:
Juvenal is a member of the Abatuhurana  group and lives in Gitega. He is 45 years old and married to Sylvana who is a farmer. They have four children of whom three are studying.

He has been a shopkeeper for 20 years (salt, sugar…)

This is his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy large quantities of products for his shop (salt, sugar…) for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a car.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy large quantities of products for his shop for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Armonia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de tostado de haba, costura de almohadas, tejido de polainas, venta de frutas, venta de gelatinas y frescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por al observar que este producto es uno de los más vendidos en el mercado, es por ello que con un poco capital decide comercializar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las ferias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "PORVENIR" or "The Future" will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer or Pro Woman, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima or the Central Focus of Higher Lima. It is made up of ten members and is headed by a board of directors where Margarita is President. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling roasted beans, sewing pillows, knitting legwarmers, selling fruit, and selling gelatin and drinks.

The loans that they take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Magarita is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining by invitation of a friend that is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling cheese. She says that she began this business by observing that this one of the best selling products in the market. It is for that reason that will a little capital she decided to start this business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (purchase of cheese) that she will acquire in the markets of the department of La Paz and subsequently she sill sell in in a retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family as she is married with three children.

When asked what she like about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cheese.

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Mathias  fait partie du groupe Tugumane  et habite à Gitega. Il  52 ans et est marié  à  Perpétue  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 9 à 20 ans,tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de haricot depuis 1 an et 6 mois.

Il est à son  treizième crédit à Turame.Avec  le crédit Kiva qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilogrammes de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Mathias is a member of the Tugumane   group and lives in Gitega. He is 52 years old and married to Perpétue, a farmer. They have four children aged between nine and 20 years old, all of whom go to school.
He has been selling beans for one and a half years.
This is his 13th loan from Turame. With this Kiva credit, he will increase his capital and buy many kilograms of beans for resale, to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many kilograms of beans for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Acqueline  fait partie du groupe Abizera et habite à Gitega. Il  36 ans et est marié  à  Déo, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants  âgés de 1 à  12  ans dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  téléphones portables et leurs accessoires depuis  2 ans.

Elle est à son  cinquième crédit à Turame.Avec  le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  téléphones portables et leurs accessoires  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Acqueline, age 36, is a member of Abizera Group. She's married to Déo, a merchant. Together, they have 5 children, age 1 to 12. Four of them go to school.

Acqueline has been selling mobile phones and accessories for two years. She's seeking her fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

With this Kiva loan, she will increase her working capital and buy lots of mobile phones and accessories to resell, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy lots of mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Dukure Group

texts.fr:
Samia  fait partie du groupe  Dukure et  habite à Gitega. C’est un célibataire  de 26 ans responsable de  ses 2 sœurs et son frère  âgés de 16 à 20 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle  parvient à assurer ses besoins et de ceux de ses sœurs et son frère( habillement, la nourriture, et payement des frais scolaires).
texts.en:
Samia, age 26, is a member of Dukure Group. She's single and lives in Gitega. She's responsible for her two sisters and her brother, aged 16 to 20, who are all students.

She's been selling clothes for the past three years. She's seeking her tenth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her working capital and buy lots of clothes to resell, in order to increase her income.

Thanks to the profits of her business, she manages to provide for her needs and those of her sisters and brother (clothes, food, and school expenses).

loans.use: to buy lots of clothes to resell

loans.name: Tugarukire Group

texts.fr:
Violette fait partie du groupe Tugarukire et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 30 ans et est mariée à Jean. Un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 10 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de bananes  depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Violette is a member of the Tugarukire group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years old and married to Jean, a shopkeeper. Together they have 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10. 

Violette has been selling bananas for 6 years. She is on her seventh loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she obtains, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell and earn more

loans.name: Dukerebuke Group

texts.fr:
Alice fait partie du groupe Dukerebuke et habite à Gitega. Elle a 31 ans et est marié à Nepomicene un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 2 à 12 ans dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de pierres et de briques pour construire.

Elle est à son vingtième crédit à Turame.Avec  le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pierres  et fabriquer une grande quantité de briques à  vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Alice is a member of the 'Dukerebuke' Group, and lives in Gitega.  She is thirty-one years old, and married to Nepomicene who works as a driver.  Together they have six children between the ages of two and twelve.  Five of their children attend school.  

Alice sells stones and bricks for use in the construction industry.  This will be her twentieth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy lots of stones to make a large quantity of bricks for sale.  In this way, she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy lots of stones to make a large quantity of bricks for resale.

loans.name: Giribanga Group

texts.fr:
Consolate fait partie du groupe  Giribanga et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 45 ans et est mariée à Marc. Un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 15 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de pommes de terre et des patates douces  depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de pommes de terre et de patates douces à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Consolate is a member of the Giribanga group and lives in Gitega. She is 45 years old and is married to Marc, a merchant. Together they have six children, aged from three to 15 years old.

Consolate has been selling potatoes and sweet potatoes for ten years. This is her first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of potatoes and sweet potatoes, which she will resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of potatoes and sweet potatoes to resell

loans.name: Dushigikirane Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuella  fait partie du groupe  Dushigikirane  et  habite à Gitega. C’est une  veuve  de 35 ans.
Elle a 7 enfants âgés de 7 à 15 ans, tous étudient.Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie, 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de bananes mûres, avocat, maïs … depuis 13 ans. 

Elle est à son vingt-deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes mûres, avocat, maïs …   à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait construire une maison dans sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emmanuella is a member of the 'Dushigikirane' Group, and lives in Gitega.  She is a 35-year-old widow, with seven children aged between seven and fifteen years.  All her children attend school.  She is also responsible for two further children from her extended family, one of these children attends school.

Emmanuella has been buying and selling ripe bananas, avocados and maize for thirteen years.  This will be her twenty-second loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of ripe bananas, avocados and maize, for resale.

In the future, she would like to build a house on her plot of land, and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of ripe bananas, avocados and maize, for resale.

loans.name: Abashizehamwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Evariste fait partie du groupe Abashizehamwe II  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 40 ans et est marié à Francine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 14 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière et de la limonade dans son bistrot  depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  10caisses de bière (Primus ), 5 caisses de bière (Amstel),  et 3 caisses de limonade, à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une voiture pour son déplacement et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste is a member of the Abashizehamwe II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Francine, a farmer. Together they have 5 children between the ages of 3 and 14, 3 of whom attend school.

Evariste has been selling beer and lemonade in his pub for 10 years. He is on his fourth loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan he obtains, Evariste will increase his capital and purchase 10 cases of Primus beer, 5 cases of Amstel beer, and 3 cases of lemonade to resell and increase his earnings. In the coming years, he would like to purchase a car for his own transportation and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase 10 cases of Primus beer, 5 cases of Amstel beer, and 3 cases of lemonade to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Kigobe Group

texts.fr:
Eric fait partie du groupe Kigobe et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et  est marié à Evelyne une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants agés de 1 à 2 ans.

Il fait le commerce de Boutique (riz, haricot,…) depuis 4 ans.

C’est son premier crédit à  Turame.Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  50kg de riz et 50 kg de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait construire une maison en matériaux durables et acheter un machine pour démarrer les activités de  pêche.
texts.en:
Eric belongs to the Kigobe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and married to Evelyne, who is a farmer. They have two children, who are one and two years old respectively.

He has been selling shop products (rice and beans) for the past four years. This is his first loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy 50 kg of rice and 50kg of beans to resell so that he can make more money. 

In the coming years he would like to build a house with durable materials and buy a machine to start up fishing activities.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy 50kg of rice and 50kg of beans to resell so that he can make more money.

loans.name: Ejoheza Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe Ejoheza  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 47 ans et est marié à Foïbe. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 13 ans, dont 2 étudient. 
Il a sou sa charge une fille membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  manioc et de chèvres  depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc et 3 chèvres  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait entamer la couture  comme nouvelle activité.
texts.en:
Etienne belongs to the Ejoheza group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 47 years old and married to Foïbe, who is a farmer. They have four children together, whose ages range fro three to 13 years old; two of the children are at school. He also has another dependant who is a member of his extended family and who is also at school.

He has been buying and selling cassava and goats for the past five years. This is his first loan from Turame and with his Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cassava and three goats for resale, so he can earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to begin tailoring as a new activity.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cassava and three goats to resell so he can earn more money.

loans.name: Kizerwa Group

texts.fr:
Antoine fait partie du groupe Kizerwa  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 55 ans et est marié à Générose une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 14 à 27 ans, dont 4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de petits poissons (ndagala)  depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  petits poissons (ndagala) à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire de l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Antoine belongs to the Kizerwa group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 55 years old and married to Générose, who is a trader. They have five children together, whose ages range from 14 to 27 years old; four of the children are studying.

He has been buying and selling small fish (ndagala) for the past three years. This is his first loan from Turame and with his Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of ndagala to resell and make more money.

In the coming years he would like to begin farming.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of small fish (ndagala) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Turamire Group

texts.fr:
Déo fait partie du groupe Turamire et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 62 ans et est marié .Sa famille  comprend  5 enfants. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, savons,…) depuis 35 ans. 

Il est à son onzième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, savons,…)  en grande quantité  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Déo is a member of the Turamire group and lives in Gitega. He is 62 years old and married. There are 5 children in his family.

Déo has operated a shop (selling beans, rice, soaps, etc.) for 35 years. He is on his eleventh loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that he receives, Déo will increase his capital and purchase items for his shop, such as beans, rice, and soaps, in bulk so that he can resell them and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase items for his shop (beans, rice, soaps, etc.) in bulk to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Tuvyurane Group

texts.fr:
Innocent fait partie du groupe Tuvyurane  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il  a 41 ans et est marié à Yerada, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 a 12 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce du riz, du haricot, du sel,… depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz,  de haricot,   est de sel,... à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter  une moto  pour son déplacement et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Innocent is part of the Tuvyurane group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 41 years old and married to Yerada, a farmer. Together they have 5 children between the ages of 1 and 12, 3 of whom attend school.

Innocent has sold rice, beans, and salt for 3 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, beans, and salt to resell and increase his earnings. In the coming years, Innocent would like to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, beans, and salt to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Abarondezi Group

texts.fr:
Eric fait partie du groupe Abarondezi et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 32 ans et est marié à Jeanine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 2 ans et 7 mois. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 13 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une  maison, une voiture  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Eric is a member of the Abarondezi group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and married to Jeanine, a farmer. Together they have a child who is 2 years, 7 months old. 

Eric has sold clothes for 13 years. He is on his third loan with Turame. 

With the Kiva loan that he receives, Eric will increase his capital and purchase many articles of clothing to resell and increase his earnings. In the coming years, he would like to buy a house, a car, and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase lots of clothes to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.fr:
Sévérin  fait partie du groupe  Twitange et  habite à Cibitoke. C’est un célibataire de 33 ans.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (unités téléphoniques, du sel, savons,…)  depuis 13 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique(unités téléphoniques, du sel, des savons,…)  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter  une voiture.
texts.en:
Sévérin is a member of the Twitange group and lives in Cibitoke. He is a bachelor and 33 years old.

Sévérin has had a shop (selling phones, salt, soaps, etc.) for 13 years. This is his first loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of items for his shops (telephone units, salt, soaps, etc.) to resell and increase his earnings. In the coming years, he would like to purchase a car.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of items for his shop (telephone units, salt, soaps, etc.) to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Apostol

texts.en:
Apostol, 27, is the father of two, a two and a half and a one year old. He has been photographed with his younger child, his daughter who was born with severe heart problems. 

He needs your financial help to take his daughter to the capital city, where a team of heart specialists from Italy will examine some of the most difficult heart cases in children; his daughter has been selected as one of them. His daughter was operated on five months back, yet her condition is getting worse.

Apostol lives in a village, and his living conditions are away below the poverty level. With his wife, they practise agriculture as a source of income. They plant mainly potatoes, beans and wheat and have grapevines as well. 

During the summer, Apostol goes to Greece for seasonal work, leaving behind his wife to look after the children and, of course, the agriculture.

loans.use: to have his daughter examined by a team of heart specialists

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large amount of dried cassava.

loans.name: Alketa

texts.en:
This poor family really needs your financial help to replace a dairy cow. Sadly, about a year ago strangers burned the stable and the cow. “All of us work hard, but we are still very poor. We plant corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and onions, and we have thirty-five chestnut trees. Our soil supports pears very well, too, and also apples in addition to what we plant,” said Alketa.

Alketa has been photographed here with her husband, Bashmir, and their two children 15 and 13. Unfortunately, their son suffered brain damage caused by high fevers when he was about a year old.
 
The village they live in is situated in a field area, yet with a very cold climate. Their specialty food is some sort of giant pancake as big as a large-sized tortilla called “kollozheku”, and is cooked on a heated flat stone and filled inside with cheese.

loans.use: to replace a stable and a cow.

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en:
Teuta, who is 40 and a mother of two, a 14-year-old and a 12-year-old, wants to expand her bakery shop and have an additional section to sell groceries. For a long time their family lived in Greece, and now they are back in their native city. They have found in Greece a good source of grocery items at a lower price, so that selling them in the city would make them win over other competitors.

Teuta’s region is known for its rich cuisine and for having the first beer factory in Albania since 1928. During summertime they organize two events: one is the beer festival and the other the food festival. During the wintertime, the national skiing team practices in the mountains of the Dardha village.

loans.use: to build an additional space in her bakery to sell groceries

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita and her husband live in a city in southeastern Albania. She works as a kitchen helper at a nearby restaurant and her husband works in a Bektashi Tekke (a Sunni mosque for Albanian Muslims). They are requesting this loan to repair the roof of their house because it has been leaking non-stop all this winter, and according to the weather forecast it will continue to rain for about four more months.
 
Their city, Korca, is known for lots of museums and for the first female school, built in 1887, and also for the first French high school. Their traditional costumes include the red color of the national flag, a white apron, a female dress made of felt and stockings embroidered by the females in the villages. Their traditional food is dried beans cooked with smoked pork called in Albanian “pasterma” and also cooked lima beans called “fasule pllaqi” in Albanian.

loans.use: to repair the roof of their house.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, age 60, is the mother of two daughters and one son. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi. 

Her husband is the breadwinner of the family and is a rickshaw driver by profession. For some time now, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He needs to repair his vehicle as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the costs of repairs. For this reason, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband to pay for his rickshaw to be repaired. This will allow him to continue his business and support his family. 

Shahida is so thankful to her Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for essential repairs to her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Estrellas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS DEL MAR” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tejido de chompas, venta de productos cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de abarrotes, venta de mochilas, venta de artefactos electrónicos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos al necesitar un espacio de compra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas y abarrotes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association 'ESTRELLITAS DEL MAR" will be beginning a second loan cycle with Pro Mujer through their Achacachi regional hub. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors headed by Juana, the President. The businesses of the members of this communal association are varied, including selling clothing, knitting sweaters, selling cosmetic products, running a neighborhood store, selling groceries, selling backpacks, and selling electronic items.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs, including Juana. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for two years, having become a member at the invitation of one of the institution's outreach officers, who came to visit her at home. Juana currently has a business running a neighborhood store; she explains that she learned this business some years ago, upon observing that her neighbors needed a place to buy things.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, to buy preserved foods and staple items which she will get from wholesale vendors from the city of El Alto, and later sell herself in her store. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she likes the training that they offer.

loans.use: to buy preserved foods and staple items

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es muy joven, tiene 24 años de edad sin embargo sus ganas de poder superarse lo han motivado a emprender su negocio. Él es soltero, vive y trabaja con sus padres. Jonathan es muy trabajador y siempre muy responsable con todas sus actividades, vive en un municipio que es considerado uno de los famosos Pueblos Mégicos de México, lugares pintorescos, llenos de historia y tradición. 
Jonathan continua con su negocio de elaboración de ropa, esta vez esta vez esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos, tintas, mayas, raceros para elaborar sus trabajos de serigrafías. Platica que realizar estos terminados en los uniformes le gusta mucho,  para realizar la serigrafía Jonathan debe tener mucha imaginación y creatividad  así sus clientes quedan muy contentos con el estampado en sus uniformes deportivos. Jonathan no tiene ningún problema con su negocio solo es la falta de capital para reinvertir, pero con este nuevo crédito tendrá material para entregar a tiempo los encargos que ya tiene planeados. Aunque seguramente en el mes de marzo estará necesitando un nuevo crédito para realizar más uniformes con sus estampados. Esta actividad la inició porque sus padres comenzaron con la costura hace 30 años. Jonathan aprendió muy rápido gracias a la enseñanza de su madre aunque su papá también participa activamente en el negocio. El crédito le ayudará a invertir más ya que las clases en las escuelas están por iniciar en el próximo mes y tiene ya varios pedidos importantes. Jonathan comenta “Nuestra única dificultad en estos momentos es la falta de dinero para obtener todos los materiales, necesitamos fuertes cantidades de dinero para poder cumplir con todos nuestros encargos”. Sus uniformes son distribuidos a otras municipios no solo donde ellos viven. El sueño de Jonathan es hacer crecer mas su negocio para poder llegar a dar sus servicios en otros lugares, quizás emprender otro taller de costura.
texts.en:
Jonathan is very young: 24 years old.  Nevertheless, his desire to be able to improve himself has lead him to launch his own business.  He is single.  He lives and works with his parents.  Jonathan is very hardworking and is always very responsible in all his doings.  He lives in a town that is considered to be one of Mexico’s “Pueblos Mágicos,” or Magical Towns.  These are picturesque places, full of history and tradition. 

Jonathan is continuing with his business making clothing.  This time he is asking for a new loan to buy thread, inks, mesh, and squeegees to make his silk-screened items.  He says that he really likes putting these finishing touches on uniforms.  To do the silkscreen, Jonathan needs to have a lot of imagination and creativity.  In this way his customers are left very happy with the printing on their sports uniforms.  Jonathan doesn’t have any problems with his business; he’s just lacking the funds to reinvest, but with this new loan he will have materials to deliver the orders he has received on time.  Most likely in March he will need a new loan to print more uniforms.  

He began this work because his parents began sewing 30 years ago.  Jonathan learned very quickly, thanks to his mother’s teaching, although his father is also an active part of the business, as well.  The loan will help him to invest more, because the classes in the schools are about to start next month and he already has various important orders.  Jonathan says, “Our only difficulty at this point is a lack of money to get the materials.  We need large amounts of money to be able to complete all our deliveries.” His uniforms are distributed to other towns, and not just where they live.  

Jonathan’s dream is to make his business grow, to be able to offer his services in other places and to perhaps open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy thread, inks, mesh, and squeegees

loans.name: Bicentenario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALMERAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isidora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, farmacia, artesanía, venta de pescado, venta de comida, venta de pasancalla y tostado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isidora es integrante, ella indica que hace es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un venta de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos que tenían de adquirir comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, harina) que adquirirá de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PALMERAS” credit group will begin its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Isidora is the president.  The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are a neighborhood store, selling vegetables, a pharmacy, artisanal crafts, selling fish, selling food, selling popcorn and toasted corn.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Isidora. She says that this is her fifth year in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Now she has a neighborhood store. She says that she learned about this business when she saw the need her neighbors had for a merchant. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying rice, pasta and flour. She will acquire them in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she us in a common law marriage and has six children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta and flour.

loans.name: Litoral Cautivo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LITORAL CAUTIVO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eulogia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, tejido de guantes, chalinas y gorras, venta de ropa, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eulogia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de gorros; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por al observar que este producto es uno de los más vendidos en el mercado internacional, es por ello que con un poco capital decide establecer su propio taller de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "LITORAL CAUTIVO" will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It is made up of nine members and is headed by a board of directors where Eulogia is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied. Among them are: grocery store, neighborhood store, knitting gloves, scarves and hats, selling clothes, and a bookstore.

The loan that they take will benefit small microbusinesses where Eulogia is a member. She says that it has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend that is a member of the institution. Today she has a business of knitting and selling hats. She says that she started this business by observing this product is one of the highest selling products in the international market, and it is for that that with little capital she decided to establish her own knitting workshop.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (purchase of wool) that she will acquire in the stores of the department of La Paz and subsequently she will sell it in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family as she lives in common-law marriage with a son.

She asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Rosas De Cacachi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CACACHI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Catalina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pesca, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Catalina es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca y venta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, pero cuando se casó decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "ROSAS DE CACACHI" will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board of directors where Catalina is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied. Among them are: fishing, knitting blankets, and selling fish.

The loan that they take will benefit small microbusinesses where Catalina is a member. She says that it has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her at her home. Today she has a business of fishing and selling. She says she learned this trade many years ago since it was a family business, but when she got married she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (purchase of netting) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and subsequently she will use it in her fishing space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has four children.

She asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes classes that the training offers.

loans.use: to purchase netting.

loans.name: Khantaty Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANTATY” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ganados, venta de verduras, tienda de refrescos, artesano.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace es el dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió con un pequeño capital que ella tenía y al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar, harina, enlatados, etc.) que adquirirá de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “KHANTATY” credit group will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Susana is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are a neighborhood store, selling cattle, selling vegetables, selling beverages, and artisanal crafts. 

The loan they will take out now will benefit the small businesswomen, including Susana. She says that she has been in Pro Mujer for two years. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a neighborhood store as a business. She says that she learned about this business with a little bit of capital she had and upon seeing the need her neighbors had for a store. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying rice, flour, canned goods, etc. She will acquire them in the city of El Alto and later she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Narasinghanath Group

texts.en:
Kuni is the leader of a group that hails from Bissam Cuttack of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 38 years. She has a small family comprising four members including two sons, age 10 and 9 years. The member standing on the left with raised hand is Kuni.
 
Kuni is doing a leaf-plate making and selling business. Her husband is running an electrical repairing and welding shop in the same town. Kuni is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She looks after her tiny business very systematically. In the morning her husband helps to run the shop. After completion of her house work, she spends the rest of her time on the business. 

This will be her third cycle loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of her business. Kuni took her first loan in 2012 with four other members of her locality. From this loan she will buy a new leaf plate pressing machine. Her ambition is to give higher education to her children for their better future.

The other members of the group, Jhunu, Golapi, Budu and Palaka, are doing leaf plate making businesses individually.

loans.use: to buy a new leaf plate pressing machine.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 30 years old.  She is a house wife and looks after her family which consists of three people.  She is a well trained in stitching clothing.  She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing etc.  This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally.  However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult.  So Gulnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.  BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement.  Gulnaz is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching related items like clothes, thread, cotton, sewing machine etc.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 37, is the mother of three daughters and a son. She takes her responsibilities as a mother and homemaker very seriously. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi.

Farzana's husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the past 8 years. As the sole breadwinner for the family, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. At present, his vehicle is in bad condition and requires essential repairs as well as ongoing maintenance. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to afford these repairs. Farzana has therefore applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Farzana's husband will be able to afford the costs of repairs and maintenance. This will allow him to provide improved transport services and earn a profitable income. 

Farzana also plans to build savings with the increased profit from her husband's business to meet her family's needs in the future.
  
Farzana is very grateful to her Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for essential repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is 37 years old woman and a mother of two sons.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been running his own business of Photographing for the past 15 years and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.  Aneela's husband wants to purchase some office furniture and accessories for business purpose, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these merchandises. 

Therefore Aneela has asked for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will help her husband to buy these merchandises for his business purpose, and also enable him to earn more profitable income to serve his family.  Aneela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some office furniture and accessories for her husband's business

loans.name: Lingaraj Group

texts.en:
Sabita, aged about 47 years, is the group leader of a four-member group in Bisam Cuttack, situated in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. 

Her family comprises five members, her husband and one daughter, age 11, and two sons, age about 13 and 7 years. The member standing second from right with raised hand is Sabita. At present she is doing leaf plate making and selling.
 
Her husband pulls a rickshaw in the locality and out of his income he pays INR 50 daily to the owner as rent of the rickshaw. Sabita is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts.

At present her family income is about INR 4,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a big stock of leaves for stitching and selling.

She has a dream to be a proud owner of a rickshaw so that they will not pay the daily rent.

The other three members of the group, named Sabita, Sabitri and Rajeswari, are doing individual businesses. Sabita and Sabitri are doing leaf plate making and Rajeswari is running a hotel in her locality.

loans.use: to purchase a big stock of leaves for stitching and selling.

loans.name: M. Tufail

texts.en:
M. Tufail is a 33-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years he has owned a small firm that knits embroidery dresses by machine and sells them. He has been recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages. In this way he is not only cherishing his own family but also becoming the source of employment to workers. He has been using heavy machinery for the purpose of knitting embroidery dresses. He takes orders from the wholesaler and knits and embroiders as per order and fashion.
 
A few days ago his embroidery machine went out of order due to continuously working. He has to complete orders but is unable without the embroidery machine. He wants to fix the embroidery machine and to buy additional threads to continue his business. He had been completing orders but most of the payments are still stuck in debt. Due to lack of availability of some capital, he is unable to fix the machine and to buy thread spools of various colors.  

Therefore, M. Tufail has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can fix the embroidery machine and buy a variety of silky threads for embroidery. 

M. Tufail is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To fix the embroidery machine and buy a  variety of silky threads for embroidery.

loans.name: Lider Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIDER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de chuño, servicio de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posteriormente decide establecer un negocio independiente para generar sus propios recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chuño) que adquirirá de las ferias de las comunidades de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "LIDER" will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Patacamaya. It is made up of 8 members and is headed by a board of directors where Amalia is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied. Among them are: purchasing and selling dehydrated and mason services.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Amalia is a member. She says that it is the first time as a Pro Mujer member, joining by invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her in her home. Today she has a business purchasing and selling chuño (dehydrated potatoes). She says that she learned this business many years ago as it was a family business. Later she decided to start her own business to generate her own economic resources.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (purchase of dehydrated potatoes) that she will acquire from markets of the communities of the department of La Paz and later sell in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support what is possible in the home, as she lives in a common-law marriage with four children.

loans.use: to buy dehydrated potatoes.

loans.name: Rashkhanda

texts.en:
Rashkhanda is 34 years old and married with a daughter and a son. The family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and lives in an IDP settlement.  She is a farmer who grows fruits (apples, pears, quince etc.) and vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, greens, etc.) and then sells them at the local bazaar. She has worked in this field for 10 years and her monthly income is approximately 150AZN.

People living in IDP settlements have high demands for fresh fruits and vegetables. They prepare different delicious dishes for their poor families. They buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens because products there are cheaper than in the usual markets.

Rashkhanda doesn’t earn enough money to cover her family’s needs. She applied for a 2,000AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers to increase the harvest. She hopes that one day she will be able to provide her children with a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers to increase the harvest.

loans.name: Leydi Noemy

texts.es:
Leydi, estudio hasta bachillerato opción contador, tiene una hija de tres años y está casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y en esta temporada se dedica a la corta de café en la finca,  son una familia muy unida y trabajadora ya que mientras él pasa en el trabajo ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar a cuidar a su hija y a atender una pequeña tienda que poseen.

La tienda es atendida directamente por ella, ya que en busca de llevar un ingreso extra a su familia ella decidió abrir su negocio el cual le genera un buen ingreso; pero por la zona en donde ella vive no puede tener la tienda en su casa así que tiene que caminar durante 15 minutos hasta donde tiene el negocio todos los días y estar pendiente del cuido de su hija y de la llegada de su esposo para atenderlo.

Con el crédito comprara más mercadería para surtir tienda, ya que por ahorita no tiene mucha mercadería con la compra de todos estos productos obtendrá más ingresos diarios y tendrá mas ganancia ya que comprando un volumen más alto de mercadería será a un precio más bajo,  así como en el transporte se ahorrara ya que tiene que ir a la ciudad a comprar y como el transporte para su comunidad es escaso ella tiene que pagar un vehículo para llevar su mercadería.

En un futuro ella quiere ver a su hija crecer en un mundo donde ella sea una persona de bien en su comunidad, trabajadora y que estudie una carrera universitaria, también ella quiere que su pequeña tienda crezca más y al final sea muy grande donde pueda tener más ingresos para que su condición de vida cambie.
texts.en:
Leydi studied through high school on an accounting track.  She has a 3-year-old daughter and is married.  Her husband makes a living working in agriculture.  At this point in the season, he is harvesting coffee on the farm.  They are a very unified and hardworking family.  While he is at work, she dedicates herself to the household chores, taking care of her daughter, and tending their small store.

Leydi is the one who directly tends the store.  In search of extra money for the family, she decided to open this small business where she is able to generate good income.  In the area where she lives, she is unable to have the store in her house.  Therefore, she has to walk about fifteen minutes to the store every day while also caring for her daughter.  She does this until her husband arrives to help her.

With the loan, she will buy more merchandise to stock her store.  She currently does not have many products to offer.  In having more merchandise, she will increase her daily income and be able to increase her profits.  By buying her merchandise in bulk, she is able to get a lower price.  She will also save money in transportation costs.  She must go to the city to buy merchandise, however transportation to and from her community is limited.  Therefore, she usually has to pay for a vehicle to move her products from the city to her community store.

In the future, she wants her daughter to grow up and become a good, hardworking member of the community.  She also hopes that her daughter will be able to study at the university level.  She also wants her small store to grow a lot so that she is able to earn a greater income and change her life situation.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store, since she currently does not have a lot of merchandise.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta segunda año en salud, está acompañada.  Ella vivió en argentina donde aprendió el trabajo de terapeuta,  luego se fue a buscar el sueño americano y trabajo durante 5 años siempre como terapeuta; posteriormente,   ha trabajado durante 3 años en la ciudad y por su forma de tratar a sus pacientes es muy reconocida en la comunidad tanto que vienen de otros lugares a ser tratados por ella, sus hijos un varón de 19 años quien esta recién graduado de bachiller y su hija de 9 años está en básica.

Su experiencia es de 8 años trabajando,  pero como terapeuta pero solo tiene 3 años de estar trabajando como propio este tipo de trabajo le ha generado mucho reconocimiento en la comunidad, aprendió en Argentina y como estudio medicina ella siente que su vocación es ayudar a los demás con sus masajes y tratamientos, el trabajo ella lo tiene en su casa es ahí donde llegan los clientes y sus horarios pues son de todo el día, ya que en el momento que el cliente llega ella lo atiende por ello casi no sale de su casa.

Con el crédito ella comprara dos máquinas para masajes,  ya que por el constante uso que ella les da se le han dañado y le son de mucha ayuda para ejercer su oficio y con el crédito podrá comprarlos y así seguir trabajando y dándoles a sus clientes la atención que ellos merecen.

En un futuro ella desea comprar un terreno y construir la casa que ella siempre ha soñado en un lugar donde sea un clima fresco, ya que donde ella es originaria es un clima caliente por estar cerca de la costa, quiere que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria, que su hijo mayor sea ingeniero civil y su hija sea doctora que son los deseos de sus hijos esto lo lograra trabajando muy duro y teniendo la fé en Dios para que él le ayude a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Reina is 41 years old, has studied until the second year in the healthcare field, and is married. She lived in Argentina, where she learned physiotherapy. Next, she pursued the American dream and worked for five years as a physiotherapist. Since then, she has worked for three years in the city, and, because her way of treating her patients is very well-regarded in the community, patients come from other places to be treated by her. Her children include a 19-year-old man who has recently graduated from high school and a nine-year-old in primary school.

Her experience includes eight years working as a physiotherapist, with three years of experience working as an owner. This type of work has generated Reina a lot of recognition in her communication. She learned in Argentina and, as a medical student, she felt that her job was to help people with massages and treatments. Her clients come to her home for treatments, and she works the whole day. From the moment her clients arrive, she takes care of them, and as a result, she often does not leave her home.

With the loan, she will buy two machines for massages, since the constant use has damaged the ones she currently has. The machines help her a lot in doing her work. With the loan, she will be able to buy them, and thus, will be able to continue working and continue giving her clients the attention that they deserve. 

In the future, she wants to buy land and build the home that she has already dreamed of in a place with a cool climate near the coast, which is different from the warm climate in the place where she is from. She wants her children to study at a college so that her son can become a civil engineer and so that her daughter can become a doctor. Her dreams are that her children have a long and successful career, and she has faith in God that he will help her go forward.

loans.use: to buy two machines for massages.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the expense of his rickshaw repairs. This will help him to continue his business. Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the expense of her husband's rickshaw repairs.

loans.name: Flor De Durazno Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE DURAZNO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y comida, venta de chicharron (comida boliviana), venta de queso, servicio de construcción, venta de bañadores, trenzado de mantas, venta de frescos, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de baño público; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de unos amigos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material de limpieza) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente al instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella está soltera y  seis hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "FLOR DE DURAZNO" will begin the fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of the Andes. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board of directors where Primitiva is the President. The businesses that the member of the community association carry out are varied. Among them are: selling sweets and food, selling chincharron (Bolivian food), selling cheese, construction services, selling swimsuits, braiding rugs, selling drinks, and selling fruit.

The loan that they take out will benefit small micro-businesses where Primitiva is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining by invitation of a promoter that went to visit her at her house. Today she has a business servicing public bathrooms. She says that she began this business by recommendation of some friends.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital (purchase cleaning materials) that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later use it in her service business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family as she is single and with six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cleaning materials.

loans.name: Alaysa

texts.en:
Alaysa previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a tricycle for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and cover her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alaysa dreams to be more successful in business and have another tricycle unit. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Tuwatikanaye Group

texts.fr: Wanzavalere est un brave commerçant et président du  collectif  d’affaires «Tuwatikanaye», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgé de 65 ans, marié et père de 10 enfants, qui tous mariés. Le client est vendeur de la boisson et habillement (pagnes). Il installe sa marchandise dans une buvette/magasin à l’entrée du marché central de la ville, où, il a su gagner sa clientèle. Il commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents.  Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 45 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Sa conjointe, elle aussi, est commerçante. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 50 caisses de Primus, 50 caisses de sucré coca cola et 50 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser ses petits fils et les nourrir. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Wanzavalere is a good and honest merchant and the president of the business collective "Tuwatikanaye". A senior entrepreneur and energetic, he is 65 years old and a married father of ten children, who are all married. This client is a vendor of drinks and clothing made of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). He sets up his merchandise at a refreshment stand/store at the entrance to the town's central market, where he knew how to earn his customers. He has been in this business for 45 years. His spouse is also a merchant. 

He started his business with initial capital from his parents. Later on, he benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan is going to be used to purchase 50 cases of Primus, 50 cases of 'sucré coca cola' and 50 lengths of 'pagne' cloth. Thus, he would like to provide education for his grandchildren and to feed them. 

In conclusion, he thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado de educación, es madre soltera de 2 hijos  los cuales viven aun en casa de ella,  ambos estudian. 

Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa particular donde le pagan por su servicios, se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 9 años, es la forma en la que está sacando adelante a sus hijos, además de este trabajo ella tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas los fines de semana, lo que le genera un ingreso adicional antes de dedicarse a eso, ella era agricultora en pequeño pero es una actividad muy difícil y no le era suficiente para mantener a su familia y decide mejor  instalar un puesto de tortillas en el municipio más cercano de donde vive en el negocio, se involucra una hermana quien le ayuda. El horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz para seguir vendiendo tortillas, el préstamo le ayudara a tener la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas, esto vendrá a mejorar los ingresos de la familia y por tanto su calidad de vida al mejorar la dieta alimenticia de sus hijos, esto también ayudara a que su negocio  prospere pues tendrá lo necesario para seguir trabajando.


Los sueños de la cliente son muchos y le gustaría alcanzarlos todos, dice que con voluntad y trabajo lo lograra entre esos sueños están poner un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y hacer una casa de un mejor material,  pues actualmente vive en una casa de barro.   Para su familia,  es que ellos estudien y se superen a través del estudio cosa que ella no lo logro por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Ana is thirty years old.  She studied through the eighth grade and is a single mother of two children.  Her kids still live at home with her and are both in school.

She works as a domestic employee in a private home where she is paid for her services.  She has been involved in this work for nine years, and it has allowed her to move her kids ahead.  In addition to this work, she also has a small business selling tortillas on the weekends.  This generates extra money.  Before doing this, she was a farmer on a small farm.  This was extremely hard work and the income was not enough to maintain her family.  She therefore decided to set up a tortillas stall in the nearest city center.  One of her sisters helps her with this work.  She works about seven hours a day.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy corn so that she can continue selling tortillas.  The loan will help her buy the raw materials she needs to make her tortillas.  This will help to improve the family's income.  Her children's overall quality of life will also be better through improved diet and nutrition.  The loan will allow her to have what she needs at her business to continue working.

Ana has many dreams that she would like to achieve.  She says that with determination and hard work, she will be able to make her dreams come true, which include starting a business selling basic needs products and constructing a house made of better material; she currently lives in a house made of clay and mud.  For her family, she hopes that her children study and improve themselves through education, something that she was never able to do because of a lack of financial resources.

loans.use: to buy corn in order to continue selling tortillas.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margaryth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de bayetas, venta de medicamentos naturales, venta de fruta, venta de abarrotes, venta de celulares, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margaryth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura y tejido; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace cinco años aprendiendo este negocio de su cuñada, quien le dio capital para iniciar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá en la ciudad de Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Emprendedores", meaning Entrepreneurs, will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the center "Centro Focal de Panamericana".  The group is made up of eight members and is overseen by a committee of directors, where Margaryth is the President.  The members' businesses include knitting cloths, selling natural medicines, selling fruit, selling groceries, selling cell phones, and selling blankets and ponchos. 

The loan will benefit these small micro-businesses.  Margaryth is the featured borrower.  She says that it is the first time that she is working with Pro Mujer.  She joined this group through an invitation from her sister-in-law, who is already a member of the institution.  She currently has a small dressmaking and knitting workshop.  She learned this trade five years ago from her sister-in-law, who also gave her the starting capital she needed to begin her business. 

The loan will be used to grow her capital by purchasing wool.  She will buy the wool at the festivals and markets in El Alto.  After making her goods, she will sell them in the city of Oruro.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home; she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings, the loans, and the health center services offered through the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: María Ínes

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los dieciocho años, quedando viuda a los treinta y nueve, tiene la hija menor es su casa, está estudiando su séptimo grado, los otros están ya fuera de núcleo trabajando. Actualmente, solo vive con su hija de doce años.

Es vendedora de productos de revista (cosméticos, perfumes etc.) cuenta con una experiencia de seis años, una amiga le indujo a la actividad, considerando que con su esfuerzo lograría más ingresos a su hogar, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, ella vende de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde vive, la actividad la realiza ella sola, tiene un horario de 10:00 AM a 5:00 PM.


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar cosméticos, perfumes etc. el mejoramiento será vender a muchos más clientes, con lo que obtendrá nuevos y más ingresos.

Lograr ser una vendedora de prestigio y que su hija puada tener más oportunidades y comodidades en su vida,  que pueda ampliar más sus ventas, las ganancias serán dirigidas a la compra de muebles y comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and completed 6th grade. She married at the age of 18 but was left a widow at 39. Maria has a minor daughter at home who is in 7th grade. The remaining family members are away from home working. At present, Maria lives with just her 12-year-old daughter.

Maria is a vendor of beauty products (cosmetics, perfumes, etc.) and can count on 6 years experience. A friend introduced her to this activity, believing that with her determination, she would bring in more income for her household. Maria has no other activity to pursue. She sells door to door throughout the community where she lives and carries out this activity alone during the hours of 10:00 am to 5:00 pm.

The loan Maria solicits is for purchasing cosmetics, perfumes, etc. The advancement she seeks is to sell to many more customers in order to earn new and greater income.

To become a prestigious vendor and offer her daughter more opportunities and comfort in life are Maria's motivations for expanding sales. The earnings will be used to purchase furniture and other household conveniences.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, etc., to sell door to door.

loans.name: Zuleyma Yasmary

texts.es:
Zuleyma es una joven de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato en la ciudad. Actualmente, esta casada, su esposo  trabaja  en una fábrica  de productos lácteos, donde tiene los ingresos para solventar los gastos de la familia de los cuales tienen un niño de 2 años de edad el cual está al cuido de sus padres.

La cliente se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, desde hace 2 años ya que  fue iniciativa propia. Anteriormente, se dedicaba a ayudar a su madre en las venta de pupusas, la vente las realiza a los alrededores del municipio desde las 7:30 hasta las 11:30 de lunes a viernes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más productos cosméticos y además quiere vender ropa para así obtener mayores ganancias para sacar adelante a su hijo.
Su deseo es ampliar su negocio de productos cosméticos y comprar ropa para ir ampliando su negocio, para aprovechar los días que sale a vender llevar productos más a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zuleyma is 24 years old, and has completed high school in the city. Currently, she is married, and her husband works in a factory for dairy products, where he earns income to take care of the family’s expenses. They have a two-year-old child who is cared for by their parents.

Zuleyma sells cosmetics. It has been two years since she started her own business. Previously, she helped her mother sell pupusas. She sells her products around the city from 7:30 to 11:30 from Mondays to Fridays.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more cosmetics, and she also wants to sell clothing to generate more earnings to bring her child forward. Her dream is to grow her cosmetics business and to buy clothing to help grow her business and to make the most of the days she sells by bringing more products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and to sell clothing to generate more earnings to bring her child forward.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is a 39-year-old mother of three daughters and five sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his vehicle. Because the current condition of his vehicle is not good, it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to perform maintenance on his vehicle. Therefore, Taj has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Taj's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Taj plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Taj is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
