loans.use: To pay for her husband's taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She acquired a 22,000 PHP loan and she used it to buy additional computer parts and supplies for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a meat shop for additional income.

Miguela would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week where she draws strength from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 54 years old, and lives with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been working in dairy farming for many years and has made a reasonable income for her family. Her forefather worked in the same business for many years and her husband inherited all of the buffaloes. 

Naseem's whole family are involved in the milk selling business, and all of them contribute to the monthly expenses according to their incomes. All of her family members participate with the tasks assigned to them e.g. her two sons milk the buffaloes, one of them sells the milk to the retailers, one son takes the herd to the pastures for grazing and her three daughters prepare fodder for the herd. She herself sells milk at the front of her house, and also provides door to door milk to her customers.

Her two sons have got married, and they have to support their own families as well. Due to the increased number of family members, she wants to grow her family’s business as well. 

Naseem has therefore requested a Kiva loan so she can buy an additional buffalo to meet the monthly expenses satisfactorily, and spend her life happily among her family members.
 
She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is aged 41; she is mother of two daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Jameela is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Hussan

texts.en:
Hussan is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession.

For the past many days his taxi has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. Therefore Hussan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the taxi. This will help him to continue his business. 

Hussan is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairs for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Ilo Ilo Sisters Group

texts.en:
Rosalie is the featured borrower of Ilo Ilo Sisters. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they came to work in Lebanon in order to provide for their families' costs of living.

Rosalie is a 49-year-old married mother of three children, who works as a housekeeper in Lebanon to cover her family's needs. Rosalie is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to send money for her family back in the Philippines to make necessary maintenance for her house after the tornado hit  their village and made damages.

Rosalie is a hard worker who is working hard to save money in order to go back one day and unite with her beloved family. She is trying to establish her own business and develop her family's living conditions.

Rosalie is the lady at the right with a jeans jacket. As for the other members, Salvacion is the first from the left, and Malou is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to send money for her family back in Philippines to make necessary maintenance to her house after the tornado hit  their village and made damages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams for good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old mother of a daughter and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation by driving a taxi for fifteen years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires maintenance expenses on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his vehicle. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation to earn a profitable income. Shazia  also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income in order to meet her family's needs in future. Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her husband's taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Flor De Viento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIENTO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noemi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chantilin, venta de fruta, ayudante de transporte, venta de comida, venta de chompas, servicio de odontología.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noemi es integrante, ella indica que  hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por necesidad de generar una fuente de generación de ingresos y al observar el alto comercio de este producto decide emprenderlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLOR DE VIENTO" [Wind Flower] communal bank consists of eight members and is about to start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer. This organization is part of the Santiago II Regional Office. A board of directors, led by Señora Noemi, manages Flor de Viento. The bank members run varied businesses that include sales of foods such as pastries, fruits, and other items; serving as a conductor on a bus; and a dental practice. 
 
The Flor de Viento members are applying for a loan that will help small business owners such as Señora Noemi, a married mother of three children. Señora Noemi has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined the organization at the invitation of a friend who was a Pro Mujer partner. Señora Noemi saw great potential in food sales, and needing a source of income, learned how to run a business preparing and selling food. 

Señora Noemi is applying for a loan to increase her capital so she can purchase rice, noodles, and oil at markets in El Alto. She will then use these supplies to prepare food that she sells from her stall. This work allows Señora Noemi to generate income she needs to meet her household expenses  and support her husband and three children. 

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Noemi replies that the organization offers health care.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, and oil.
